Though the area outside of the resort we did not explore and on coach journeys to and from airport left much to be desired, the complex itself cannot be faulted.  If you’re looking to have everything at your fingertips, hotel turquoise is the hotel for you.

title: NOT 5*!!!
review: This is going to be a long review of a dissapointing holiday! On arrival this hotel looks amazing, but on a closer look massively underwhelming!   We arrived early hours of the morning got checked in, there was around 8 couples and we were told we could go down to the 24hour buffet before we went to our rooms and the bell boys would take up our luggage. However one bellboy asked if he could take us to our room before we went down to get some food, we agreed as we felt uncomfortable to decline. Once we arrived to the room, I realised we’d been given a basic room when we’d payed extra for a luxury room. I mentioned it to the bell boy who said to go to reception, however he then wouldn’t leave the room, we waited another few minutes whilst we put our belongings down and he was…

title: Great Hotel
review: We have just returned from a weeks holiday at this hotel,this was our third visit, Having read some of the reviews ,I felt concerned at going back,below is an honest review of this great value hotel. On a very late arrive,3.00am! welcomed with drinks,a bar that was still open ,and a snack buffet of food.  We booked a delux room in the main building,however previously we had a standard double room,Frankly it's not worth the extra,we don't use coffee making,we don't need slippers and dressing gown  Rooms are spotless,and cleaning is everyday. Booked all the A la Carte restaurants ,in one go,at the guests relations ,all really good,our favourite was the Turkish,but it's all down to a matter of taste. The buffet was very good,with fresh selections hot selections and up to 6 cooking…

title: Amazing !!!
review: Beautiful resort, spacious, good food and drinks. People are friendly. During the summer months the sea is nice and warm to swim in. Beach is a sandy beach. Also private to the Tuquoise Resort so sunbeds and parasols are free. There is a towlservice, so that's included as well. I will be back !

title: Very nice hotel, waiter Hasan is a star!
review: Great choice from buffet, food constantly being topped up and kept hot and fresh.  Could get quite busy at self-service counters and unfortunately some guests are too important/impolite to queue.   Most of staff are superb but management not quite up the mark.  Our room was cleaned well most days, some days not so well and one day it was completely forgotten about so that should be picked up; also the lower management were quite imperious- just barging in front of guests to get their coffee etc. and bellowing at the waiters/bar staff in front of everybody.  Special thanks to Engin and Ertac on the Sultan bar, and Hasan in the Karavanseray restaurant was an absolute delight- went above and beyond to help and such a nice gentleman.

title: June 2018 holiday
review: I can not fault this hotel at all. It was such a lovely place to spend a couple of weeks, the staff were very friendly and could not do enough to help you out. The management were ever present, greeting guests and ensuring the high standards were kept all of the time.  The room was superb, kept very clean by the cleaning staff. The view was great. The mini fridge was topped up every day without fail. The food was superb. Sometime at all inclusive restaurants you get the feeling that the food has been left standing for a while, but not here. There was great variety and it was fresh all of the time. A minor thing was that the sun beds around the pool were reserved very early in the morning, and some people didn’t appear on them until early afternoon, but for me this was no issue.…

title: Perfect holiday, sad that’s it’s over
review: We are currently on our last day at this resort and it has been amazing from the moment we arrived, with champagne on arrival it really is 5*. The a la carte restaraunts are fab, highly recommend visiting them especially the steak house, although for a small extra charge it was well worth it. The weather has been beautiful apart from a day of thunder storm but it cleared for the evening. The food overall was lovely, however as someone else has mentioned, it is non-English based, it is a true 24/7 all inclusive. Entertainment good with good live music of an evening and always lots of activity during the day. Beach sandy and 2 lovely piers to walk down and swim off- pool large and refreshing temperature. Overall we have been very impressed with this hotel and have had a fabulous…

title: Relaxation  and amazing service
review: We have just returned from our second stay here in Side. Another week of amazing service and beautiful surroundings. The weather is a given but the devil is in the detail... great food ... well equipped and spacious rooms. Excellent pools and facilities. But for us it's the staff that stand out. Some familiar and some new faces...but all feel like friends to us now. Thanks to Ali at the beach bar ..Ali in the kitchen ..Taner who was so attentive in the restaurant together with Ugurcan and Hasan. We can not though forget Anisa and sAhande in the foyer bar...these two young ladies will go far in life .. they made our holiday and are a credit to The Turquoise Hotel ...thank you both for making our holiday the best ever 😁😁

title: An amazing place
review: Just wanted to thank everyone at this amazing place , it is like paradise. Room service, food , bar, the garden is wonderful. And big thank you to animation team they are the top class, made our honeymoon such great fun ! Also planting our tree was unforgettable! Hope next year we will be able to come to see how its grew! Thanks guys!

title: Miss
review: Hotel nice breakfast is for none  British people. Beds are hard nothing at all outside hotel at least four miles one way and six the other there isn’t even a shop outside. If you like to explore outside hotel this is not the place for you. Champagnes good

title: Nice hotel but nothing to do nearby
review: Very friendly staff and clean hotel. The pool is lovely and easily accessible for children including my 3 year old daughter who celebrated her birthday at the hotel. The staff accommodated celebrating her birthday with a cake, balloon animal and decorated table which again was lovely.  The food is very much the same and the air conditioning did not work at night, it was hot and fairly uncomfortable. There is no way of walking into side town and only accessible by taxi or bus and there is not much around outside the hotel.

title: Turkish Paradise
review: We stayed in the the hotel just after the opening this year. I found that the hotel and its beautiful surrounds amazing. The staff In the hotel was so nice and helpful. This was not the first 5* resort we have been to but surely one of the best. The rooms are well kept and beautiful. We had a perfect massage (actually 2) and visited the Hamam under the hotel. It was so relaxing and we felt so unstressed. I would recommend to anyone to have a look and experience this tradition. The animation was kind and not pushy and I enjoyed the conversations with them. The food was, although not so many guest, excellent. The last days they opened a sensational live cooking buffet which we enjoyed afterwards from mornings during breakfast till the dinner when they served freshly grilled fish…

title: Nice hotel
review: It was a nice but a bit old hotel with lovely surrounding. Some sections of the hotel including the rooms and the aqua need to be renovated. Main pool was not big, hoped to see a larger one. We did not like Animations at the anfi theatre. Kids club was good. The ladies there were doing good job. Our daughter enjoyed to spend time there.

title: 2 week stay beautiful
review: We stayed at turquoise for two weeks in Oct and had a great stay, we were supposed to be going to Cuba but because of hurricane Irma we changed to the turquoise hotel and wasn't disappointed. the hotel is very clean and well presented.the pools , gardens and beach are beautiful. The food was very good plenty to choose from also you had 4 other restaurants you could use by booking , there is steak house, Italian, fish and Chinese the best were steak and fish. The entertained was ok had shows but only went to one Michael Jackson , we prefer to sit in bar and have few drinks before bed. The rooms are really clean and well equipped, the staff are all really nice cant do enough for you Turqut , Selcuk and Irem were especially nice really helpful and kept the drinks flowing. We had a…

title: 10th visit to the Turquoise Resort
review: Clearly, I like this All Inclusive Hotel, returning for the 10 consecutive year. I stay in the deluxe rooms in the main hotel block, a nominal upgrade cost offering an inclusive safe and back illuminated mirror through which the TV is visible only when on. The mini bar is restocked daily with a selection of soft drinks, beer and water. If you wish you can get drinks from the main 24 hour bar and take to your room, just a few minutes away.  The hotel is set in a  beautiful Pine Forest, flowers abound, which are well-manicured. The site continues down to a sandy beach with two piers.  I am currently starting the second week of a 2 week stay and continue to find this hotel as enjoyable as always. Whilst the hotel faces challenges with staffing levels, due to the significant tourist…

title: an honest review
review: we arrive very early hours of the morning and was sat on long time and given a cool glass of wine, we were given room 1044 we had no view and a white mould building directly outside our terrace it was an awful setting. I went back to reception to be informed to come back at 9am it was approx. 4am. So next morning at 9am I set down to the reception to change room, the hotel female manager actually didn't speak to me she spoke to the bellboy who took us to the second floor to view the room which had a lovely view (room 1210) of the pine forest. I personally found the hotel female manager very rude. If you are given the key to 1044 do not take it!!  The room - double bed, tv, plenty of storage and wardrobe space, mini bar (stocked with coke zero, coke, sprite, Fanta, sparkling…

title: 4 star hotel at best
review: When selecting our holiday, we were aiming for 5 star resort (we were conscious this was not a luxury 5 stars but we were re-assured this was a proper 5 star level) and selected Turquoise Resort and Spa, using this criteria. The price was quite premium, comparing to other well known resorts, so we were quite confident it should be a good hotel for family vacations. Also, interesting to mention, the reviews are really good in Trip Advisor and Booking.com, that made us even more confident upon the choice.  But boy did we get disappointed upon arrival to the hotel! First of all, hotel is really run down. Despite the fact they claim to have had renovation few years ago, I think the renovation was only very superficial - repainting of some walls and lining new wall papers in the…

title: Life of a princess - Room 1362 Sea view
review: I cannot rate this place highly enough, life isn't the same now were back home without our beautiful view. Our room was cleaned daily with petals and towel art left every other for us. The bed was super duper comfy and the shower was amazing. No bath was the only downfall to the room.  One tip i'd say is maybe have the mini bar staff come a little later in the day as that poor boy got our just woken faces a few times through no fault of his own.  The staff are outstanding, so friendly and cant do enough to help. Unfortunately my boyfriend took ill with appendicitis towards the end of the holiday and was taken to hospital. The staff back at the hotel done all they could to help me and when David was brought back to the hotel we were given a free courtesy room in order for him to…

title: Great place!
review: Great hotel, good food (nice choice of restaurants), we stayed in G sector which was a bit far, but we got family room so we were happy. I read a lot of comments here on TripAdvisor and this is why we have chosen this hotel and we were extremely satisfied with everything. Great pools for kids, beach is a bit difficult to enter, rocky on some places, but not bad. Sunshades on beach could be bigger for families but ok.... Animation team is great, our kid enjoyed Mini Disco, mini club, pools and all amenities you guys have... many recommendations for families for this hotel, one of the best in Antalia region

title: Beautiful grounds but 3 star service and mediocre food
review: Visited here with my parents who have stayed at this hotel on three separate occasions since 2011 . Beautiful grounds , pools and an abundance of sunbeds first impressions were good . Our accommodation was a two bedroom  villa which was lovely  was well stocked albeit floors could have been mopped more often  . Sadly the food did in no way match the hotel price or general appearance,  the buffet was same food pretty much every day and I dreaded meal times , limited staff and struggled to get a drink  . The ala carte were better , but as mentioned on other reviews you have to queue . The hotel would benefit from publishing the opening days of each a la carte so you can plan but this didn't happen . I didn't see a rep the whole time I was at the hotel  which didn't matter to…

title: Not 5 star ,3max on a good day
review: We have just got back from here ,,,,,well ,,,,it claims it's a 5star no way we have stayed in a five star not even close ,,,we stayed in room 2125 which was in the trees first impressions room ok but veiw was naff we was thinking about changing trying to find the rep was a joke to ask here was a a joke when we did two days later she just said ask reception in morning to see about moving some rep,we stayed in room it was quiet and easy short walk to bars and restaurants,,,the room itself was clean and was cleaned every day very good cleaner ,,,,now why not a five star,,,room ,they had run out of paint I suppose because bathroom walls not finished paint had been watered down so it went further patchy walls ,shower tray felt loose and plug/drain not fixed left a big hole,,,bed hard…

title: Location great, staff & service not so!!
review: Stayed at the Turquoise Resort from Sept 10-17. Room 5219 Location is great within a forest area going all the way down to the sea. Plenty of sunbeds, but if you want to bag a parasol and premium place get up at crack of dawn! This is not by any means a 4 or 5 star resort, due to the total lack of customer service provided by the most miserable staff I have ever come across in a hotel.  Customer is definitely not king here. Our apartment was never swept of cleaned. Mini bar water never refreshed, shower gels never refreshed. All that was done was bed made and towels changed. As someone else has already mentioned in their review, your feet are black after walking on the floor.  There is an obvious lack of staff, normally only one person serving at bars, so don't expect a drink…

title: Not 5* as advertised
review: We recently returned from a week in the Turquouise Resort & Spa. Very mixed feelings about this hotel. The external pool area and beach are excellent and very well maintained with plent of sun beds, although you had to be down at 6am to bag one with an umbrella for shade around the pool of grassy area's. We opted for the beach most day's as there was a pleasant breeze and was the least busy. There are three bars from which you can get drinks from around the pool and beach area which was really nice, however the staff left a lot to be desired, one or two were reasonably friendly but in the main very unhelpful and slow. I can only suggest this is because the were understaffed and worked long hours. It doesn;t help that predominantly that the majpority of guests appeared to be…

title: Lovely hotel let down by sullen staff.
review: When we arrived we didn't receive much of a welcome or a glass of bubbly or orange as previous guests had and were just told were the restaurants were and handed our keys. The grounds, very pretty and the rooms were comfortable and clean . Nice big hotel with a huge swimming pool and plenty of sunbeds if you get up at 6am!!.  The biggest let down for me was the waiting on and the bar staff, they either ignored you or walked around looking like they didn't want to be there. To get good service you had to tip bad service which is just wrong. Once they had a tip they then would smile and serve you.  The food was okay (just okay ) , you could find something to eat each night which was different but who had to go hunting for cutlery as the tables were cleared really slowly. We ate in…

title: This is not a PLATINUM Hotel !!
review: This was my 3rd time here and why or how has this hotel gone such downhill ? Dirty, unkempt, boring variety of food, miserable staff, poor waitering service the list is endless.  After a shower and walking in your room, you are left with black feet !! the room decor has ripped wallpaper and is in need of much refurb. The food here used to be exceptional and widely varied, 2 visits before this one and the main restaurant was a joy to behold, boring now and now you can guess every single night whats coming in the main restaurant. The Al la cartes have dropped in standard, where has the rose petals gone on the italian table ? where has the guy who carves watermelons gone? why is there no staff like before, we were left waiting for drinks all night long every single day. there`s not…

title: Relaxing break
review: Just returned from hotel last night ( 12.09.17 ). Stayed in room 1047 05-09-17 thru to yesterday.  First impressions.  The hotel grounds and reception are immaculate. The staff, truthfully, are 99.9% attentive and receptive. The odd " hiccup " with surliness but overall they all contributed to a very relaxing week of late summer sun. The management should be proud to have such staff and their managerial motivation shines through via them all.  The room we had, I have to agree with other TA contributors, was dated and small. Especially when you consider their star rating backed up by Trip Advisors own 4.5 star which the hotel proudly display within the hotel itself. Our room had rips in the wall paper and little space between the bed itself and the one wall. Very " compact "…

title: Turquoise is not the same as before!!!
review: Gutted, I'm currently here (room 1222) with my husband for our 3rd time and alot has changed from 2 years ago!!!!  The first thing we noticed was the standard of food and choice has gone down hill (one morning I picked up 2 boiled eggs which when I cracked open were not cooked). The dishes are repeated which the old turquoise never did.  The entertainment is poor and was never the hotels strong point before but as everything else used to be so good you would put up with it.  Housekeeping?? What's happened??before this place was spotless, I went to the ladies today there was no toilet roll or soap or paper towels in the main toilets!!!  The main hotel used to be couples and family's had the bigger rooms in the garden area, now it's all mixed up and kids are running and screaming…

title: Family holiday
review: Warm welcome to the hotel.  Very clean room, smelled fresh and well stocked mini bar.  Buffet restaurants excellent, infact all the restaurants were amazing.   Our favourite was the italian., food was outstanding and service second to none!   Animation team great, just wish there had been more pool games for my son to join in to.  Kai was great, very friendly, his aqua gym was intense but always great!!  Not many English families at the hotel mainly dutch, so my son didn't make any friends and was extremely bored, spent a lot of time on wifi in the lobby bar.  Bar staff could be rude at times and ignore women and children who were waiting to be served.  I have one major gripe here and that was on our last night, we were enjoying our last meal in the chinese al acarte when a…

title: Not good as before-Disappointed
review: This is the 4th time for us in this hotel. We stayed 12 days in August 2017.   Hotel degraded very badly, and this is a known issue over there Reception is understaffed and bad English ( not professional )  Eating at buffet is bad ( chicken is bloody, salad are getting smelly and warms ... )  Main swimming pool chairs are dirty ( fight to find one )  We do not recommend this hotel anymore

title: Very disappointed!!!
review: That was our fourth time in Turquoise and unfortunately, we won't go back! The management have decided to save money and you can see it. Food is not as good as in previous years (apart from Steak house). The animation manager is new and does not know anything about entertainment. They have changed one of the best bands ever seen in a hotel Priza!!! When there is a confusion about lyrics on the screen for karaoke, the manager just said to the French lady: "You should learn Spanish". Where is educatiin and professionalism? Disco nights are organised on one of the peers. Forget about sleeping before 12 if you are in the main building? Floors are never cleaned or tables. Everything is getting dirty. In two weeks, the beach was cleaned once!!! Fewer employees everywhere: at Sultan…

title: Fantastic !!!!
review: We stayed here in August 2017 as 2 families total of 9 - Our first visit to Turkey ..  we arrived at hotel to a lovely reception, after a long night flight the welcome was very much appreciated., especially the Fizz and kids cocktails.  Our Rooms were in G block, quite a trek away from main buiilding but the surroundings are so beautiful we were ok with this - also being away from main building our rooms were very quiet.  When we arrived it was my nieces 13th birthday, we went to see Veronika, (Guest relations) who arranged for a table to be reserved in the main restaurant and this to be decorated with flowers, petals etc for her. Also as a lovely gesture from the hotel a rose in a bix and card was left in her room to wish her a happy birthday. Also the week after my daughter…

title: When you pay for 2 beds you get couch for one!  This is a ripoff!!
review: My husband and son are now at your hotel. They asked for 2 beds, instead they got one bed and one couch!!! You say the hotel is complete!! This is not HONEST!! It is a bad publicity for you and they certainly not recommend your hotel to our travel agency nor to our freinds.

title: Fantastic Holiday
review: Spent 10 days at this Hotel with my Husband for our honeymoon/first year anniversary and we had a fantastic time. The Hotel filled our room with flower petals, red rose, towels shaped into hearts and a touching card. Followed by being given a small tree to personally plant in the hotel grounds and a wooden plack with our name on it. A lovely touch. From the moment of arriving at the hotel to evening we left, the service from the staff was friendly, professional and helpful. The food and Beverage Manager Yavus was an absolute star, working incredibly hard and still had time to spend talking with us and a pleasure to get to know. The bar/waiting staff worked incredibly hard but look out for Ahmet 5 who was our favourite happy helpful waiter, where nothing was never too much…

title: Disappointed!
review: 2nd time in lake villas, we enjoyed but were disappointed : 1- no more lounge service for the guest staying in the villas although it's still mentioned on the hotel web site 2- room furnitures, sunbeds and sun umbrellas on terraces are getting old and should be renewed 3- no more children buffet nearby children swimming pool 4- beach is dirty due to lack of maintenance Overall there are obvious cuts in the services and maintenance and this is too bad since this place was a real paradise 2 years ago. Hotel should update their website with correct informations , they are lying to their customers.

title: Greeeen
review: It was our first time using all inclusive services so we can not compare this with some other hotels, but we enjoyed Turquoise very much. First of all, it was our choice because of the woods, and we were more than happy with the surroundings. And that's what we loved the most. We enjoyed the food, entertainment and piers. Our biggest problem was climate in this region, temperatures were around 33 C, but humidity almost killed us. :P That wouldn't be that big much of a problem, if water was colder. BUT, the sea used to be 29 C, and pools maybe even hotter. And it was such a shame cause they look amazing. Vilas and these "private" pools are close to perfection, from the outside. We stayed in main building, and it's not that nice, but our deluxe room was fine. Yes, service could be…

title: Splendid in 2016
review: I was at this hotel with my sambo during 2016 august.  As there was the infamous coup attempt and political surges in Turkey during that time, we were planning to cancel our trip to this hotel.  I am living in stockholm and we had a pleasant experience in this hotel with my girlfriend.  The staff was cheerful which was a plus. The food was fine.  One important aspect is that when we were there, more than half of the hotel was empty so i suspect this 'improved' the quality of service as i suspected that the number of staff seemed low in number.  Following points to improve: The pools were not deep enough for adults. There should have been at least 1 pool for this need. The walls in the rooms were rather thin and it is easy to hear your neighbours. The AC seemed a little oldish,…

title: Eat, drink, dance, sweat...repeat for 14 days !!
review: My sis & I returned from 2 week stay at Hotel Turquoise last weekend & had really fab time. Fellow guests mainly from Belgium (met some lovely people from there), Holland, Germany & Russia. Knew beforehand that Brits would be in the minority but wasn't an issue - got quite a shock when we heard Scouse accent during second week. Stayed in one of the blocks in hotel grounds (4022) - very dated but always spotlessly clean. Shower great + lots of mirrors (important to us ladies). Air con a pain - on return to room late afternoon it blew hot air out for a while & then dripped water. Eventually settled down but not before we'd done a bit of cursing ! Grounds were immaculate: lovely flowers/shrubs. Bottled water available everywhere. Hundreds of sunbeds on beach/lawned areas + round…

title: Not the best value for It's price
review: Positive: 1. Great, clean, green and big territory. 2. Very warm and nice sea to swim in. 3. Good Mini-club personal  Negative: 1. Room service has poor quality and as a results It's not clean enough. 2. Food were same almost every day, not all dishes were ok to eat. 3. Bar and reception personal doesn't understand English, so It's hard to communicate. 4. Towels are very old and should be changed to new ones. 5. No sound isolation in rooms.

title: Part of my top 3 all inclusive holidays
review: Me and my partner stayed for an week all inclusive in September 2016, he hadn't been abroad since he was 8 years old (now 25!) and it's safe to say we both had an amazing time!  We were very lucky with the weather, 28 degrees + everyday, whereas the week prior Side had horrendous storms.  One of the best features of this hotel is the 5 a la carte restaurants to choice from, well worth getting up early and making a reservation for! From what I remember the Chinese and Steakhouse restaurants were the best, whereas I wasn't so keen on the Fish restaurant because of the bones.  The most glorious beach is located at this hotel, you can access the hotel wifi here no problem!   Drinks are okay, standard for all inclusive.  Lots of choice on the food front.  Hotel and rooms clean, mini…

title: Spot On Relaxing Break
review: Arrived after a trouble free flight / transfer at approx. 22.00 hrs and was greeted with some fizz and a refreshing cold towel. From that point I knew I was going to enjoy the stay.  We had been allocated room 7024 which was a bit of a trek from the main lobby / bars etc but this did not spoil the holiday.  The rooms themselves were spacious with pretty much everything your need for a comfortable nights sleep. Air con working, mini bar always topped up (although the fridges were not the greatest at cooling your drinks) and one of the best showers ever.   The hotel itself is situated in immaculately kept grounds with plenty of shade / trees.  The main lobby was very modern and had a touch of class. There was also a bar in the lobby which was a nice cool place to have a drink…

title: Averge Overall
review: Arrived early morning as had a night time flight, we booked a private taxi with Thomson but this wasn't there and got taken to the taxi rank to wait, after a very long day travelling from Jersey to Gatwick first was very disappointing. Took an hour to get to the hotel, when we arrived it looked amazing lush gardens, very clean and greeted with a glass of fizz. Our room was in the main building which was lovely inside a lovely big shower and a very comfy bed, mini bar stocked daily so all in all a great room. The maids did an excellent job very clean rooms. Not that many english people its more catered for Dutch, German and Russian but i found everyone of them polite and friendly, The food was good with a lot of choice at breakfast, lunch and dinner in the main restaurants.  The…

title: Lovely kept hotel good mix for all tastes
review: On arrival after a long overnight flight etc met by a beautiful entrance with very well kept luxurious gardens ,on entering staff were there to welcome us ( group of 8 ladies ) and get us checked in straight away with a lovely glass of fizz , hotel is immaculately clean , friendly staff in most areas with exception to night bar staff who unless you have previously tipped them can keep you hanging around but not really for long , food drinks etc all very good  However you have to book a la carte restaurants a day in advance or so they said but sone restaurants were only open on certain days possibly due to staffing issues and if you asked about booking further ahead they were already full !! But we ate in Chinese Turkish and fish and all restaurants were welcoming and food very…

title: Overall Very Good
review: Arrived on the 10th June for two weeks we had a night time flight and landed around 10pm, we booked a private transfer with Thomson but this still took an hour to get to the hotel, when we arrived it looked amazing lush gardens and greeted with a glass pf fizz and refreshing towels a nice touch. Our room was a sea view room which was lovely inside a lovely big shower and a very comfy bed, mini bar stocked daily so all in all a great room, the only downside is the rooms overlook the main bar and stage this after a few nights is very annoying so my advice is dont pay the extra if your looking for a quiet balcony with sea view, and trust me the music is loud and everyone in the Sultan bar can see you on your balcony. the maids did an excellent job very clean rooms and some lovely…

title: Heaven
review: This was our first visit to Turkey. We booked the week before with Thomson . Our flight was at 21.35 so we arrived at the hotel at around 05.30 . I would not travel at this time in the future.  On arrival at the Hotel we were greeted with warm towels to freshen up and drinks.  Our cases were taken up to our room following a brief Introduction to the hotels facilities which are vast and excellent.  The meals are well presented and offer a great variety.  As are the drinks. The staff are helpful and engaging. We didn't go on the organised trips but used the bus which is cheap and frequent. Most  places take euros but you get better value using TL. Everywhere in the hotel and complex is clean and well cared for.  There are over 16 yrs areas on the beach and a separate pool. Which…

title: Great 10 nights
review: We have just returned from this hotel , having spent 10 nights , hotel is some 1 to 1.5 hours from airport , we arrived at midnight and were greeted with cold flannels and glass of fizz , all bits explained by staff , only down side no food on offer such as sandwich , would have been nice touch after long day , not the end of the world though . Temperature fluctuated between 30c and 38c so lovely and hot . The room was in the main building which was very good , only small issue was air con not the best , but you don't spend long in the room after all . The hotel is very clean with coffee and water available throughout the hotel , numerous bars open throughout the day for all types of drinks, Pool is great very well payed out and right next to the beach , and the time of our…

title: PERFECT!
review: We can say allott but just come and enjoy.... everythıng ıs just really great, the locatıon, the weather, the servıce, the food and the staff... we found the matrass to hard for us, but we dıdnt complaın because everythıng else ıs just to great....when the lovely lady from the receptıon was talkıng wıth us and she found out off the beds, ımmedıaletly she arranged for a extra toppıng on the bed.... we wıll certaınly come back here and are gonna recommend everyone.... greets from Holland:))

title: Terrific turquoise
review: We stayed in October 2016, got a great last minute deal. The hotel is outside Side, you could walk to the town on the beach, it took around 45 minutes. Or you can catch a dolmus bus from outside, which is very reasonable.  The hotel complex is large and set within trees. The beach and piers are lovely. There are loads of loungers, though some people still insist on leaving their towels on them!  There was a good range of food in the buffet & we really enjoyed eating at the al la carte restaurants, which are included in your stay. My favourite was the steak house, which is set out next to the pool. It was my birthday when we went here & they set up our table with flowers, which was a lovely touch.  There is a good range of drinks including a cocktail of the day, alongside an…

title: Really lovely staff
review: Stayed here last week for 5 days, am based in London and was looking for a short sunshine break. The Hotel grounds are really well looked after. The staff were so lovely, have to give a mention to the Food and Beverage Manager who was excellent. The hotel feels very safe and you have direct access onto the beach. The area itself was fairly quiet, this may be as it is quite early in the season. It was a nice relaxing break and i felt really good value for what we paid.

title: Perfect beach holiday
review: My boyfriend and I stayed a week early July 2016. My only criticism was the heat. However, this was my fault for not checking the average temperature before booking. So this will not go against my rating as it was completely my fault. Our first 2 days they average temperature was 41c and for the rest of the week averaged between 36 and 39.   The hotel is in a perfect location, right next to a sandy beach which is lovely to swim in. This is where I spend most my time trying to keep cool. I have to say it's one of the nicest beaches I've swum in (maybe as it helped cool me down!) Beware though as there are rocks in it. As the sea is so clear you can see them clearly though.   The hotel have a private section along the beach as do the neighbouring hotels. They have security…

title: nice place to stay
review: We were there last year in June and would definitely visit this hotel in the future again as we usually don´t visit same place twice. I recommend to travel little earlier in June because not so many people will be there, but whole hotel site is quite large with many places to spend your time so it should be no problem go there anytime if you don´t mind more people.  It´s is true that there are no bars, shops etc. around hotel, but you can take bus (cheap, about 3 TL) directly in front of entrance and go to Side town which is only about 4km and 10min by bus, or take nice walk on the beach. Or try little bigger city of Manavgat, about 7km far. Taxi station is in front of hotel too so no problem with transport and last bus is going back around 9 or 10 p.m.  If you are really lazy…

title: Amazing holiday September 2016
review: What can I say.....We booked this holiday 2 weeks prior to leaving the UK for a weeks break and for me the first time that I had ever been all inclusive..... Yes, there were concerns with going to Turkey and I had to advise my girlfriends parents that all would be ok as I had done my research on the Government websites, so all was fine. We flew with Thomsons and so we knew that we were in safe hands. The flight went as planned and we landed at Antalya Airport... Again easy to find our coach to the Hotel and ok the travel from the airport to the hotel took just over 1 hour 30mins but once at the hotel the welcome was FANTASTIC... A Welcome glass of sparkly and a warm towel to freshen up.  From here we were able to grab some food at nearly 1am in the morning..... For the next week…

title: Amazing Hotel
review: Went here for a week for a relaxing in the sun break . From the moment we arrived we had first class service .  We had sea view room , which was spacious and spotless. But was noisy at night as when the bands were on singing it was above our room . Even with the patio doors shut the noise was far to loud. So if I came again I would chose a different room.

title: Amazing All-Inclusive First Vacation!
review: Loved it! What more can I say? First holiday with the other half, and it was brilliant!  Champagne arrival with cold towels, room upgrade as soon as we arrived and amazing service all throughout the time we were there.  The quiet pool was just that - out of the way and quiet. There was stuff for kids to do, and the beach was beautiful!  Great hotel, great staff, amazing food, amazing cocktails and one of the best vacations I've ever had! We'll be going back on a family vacation within the next year or so, and will be taking a villa with private pool, just so we are all together.

title: Turquoise hotel  still doing what it says on the tin
review: Returned home on the 21st October after our third visit to this superb Hotel.  The Turquoise can accommodate 1300 guests at full capacity. For obvious reasons the hotel was much quieter than usual; probably only half full during our stay with numbers decreasing towards the end of our second week.That said it suited us as we were automatically upgraded to an executive room in the main building  The hotel closes its doors at the end of the first week in November and during our stay any incoming guests after our first week were also upgraded as management had made the decision to close almost all other types of accommodation within the complex. If you are minded to book this Hotel and I can't recommend it highly enough ,note that all types of  accommodation at the Turquoise are of…

title: Best holiday ever
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 11 nights in October. This was our first trip to Turkey and I can honestly say from the moment we arrived at this lovely hotel till the moment we left we had the most fantastic time. We were greeted with cooling towels and bubbly when we checked in, our room was upgraded without even asking and we were treated everywhere during our stay with such friendliness and courtesy. The hotel is set in beautiful grounds and right next to  a lovely beach. The bar by the beach was a fantastic spot to have a cocktail and watch the setting sun. We had beautiful warm sunshine every day though we were told that was not always the case in late October! For the first time ever, we joined in with some of the extra activities such as water aerobics, quiz…

title: Enjoyable
review: We arrived in the early hours and met by 2 friendly and polite members of staff.  We were offered a glass of bubbly and as I don't drink bubbly I was offered an alternative but was too tired - it was a nice touch though.  We were also upgraded!  Our room was in the main building and had a nice view, although it was over the main evening area so could be a tad loud.  All staff were friendly, although I would suggest some could smile a bit more, but this is not to say they were rude or uncaring.  Food - I am quite fussy but there was plenty of choice at breakfast and evening.  The snack bar near the pool was the same which, although fine, did get a bit boring but saying that you could eat in the main restaurant which I believe had more choice (hubby liked the snack bar).  We tried…

title: Cheeky second holiday
review: Visited the turquoise in september as a second holiday just my wife and I and so glad we did it was a spur of the moment thing first time here looking to go back 2017 lovely place lovely people proper holiday.           Was in olu deniz in july in the sun city hotel dissapointed in the drop in standard in one year the difference in these 2 hotels is unbelievable considering they are not a million miles apart but this only my opinion I would give the turquoise 10 out of 10 proper fully inclusive well worth the money left the kids at home kids 27,21,18 they wouldnt have kept up anyway haha

title: Our second time here but even two weeks wasn't enough!
review: This hotel is mine and the fianceè's soft spot, when we first came in September 2014 for a week we were blown away and had been itching to come back ever since but unfortunately in 2015 didn't get a chance so decided to go for two weeks this year and this is my review:  ARRIVAL: We were greeted by the lovely front of house staff who informed us our room wasn't ready yet so we were told we could go and have something to eat and drink and use any facilities we needed and return to desk in 30 mins. This wasn't an issue as no arm bands are required in this hotel and we felt welcomed straight away. Upon returning to the lobby we were given a quick run down of the hotel, any requirements met and given a glass of bubbly each. Very nice touch, other hotels could learn a thing or two. …

title: Turquoise Hotel in Side
review: We just came back from nice holidays in Turquoise hotel.  Food was really good and every day you could have something different stuff to eat because choice was big. Staff quite friendly but most of them you feel like they are waiting for some tips and should speak more English. Rooms are very clean but I think need some new decorating. Towels an bedding were changed every day so that was nice. Swimming pools were very cold and should be heated at this time of year as ocean was also could so we didn't do much swimming this time.. If you go to Side it will take around 50 min walking on the beach and about 15 min in taxi which will charge around 20 Turkish money. Basically  I am not sure if we could come back there especially in the season time as can be really busy and loads of…

title: We liked it
review: This is a large hotel complex and not sure we would want to be here when full.  The main building is set back quite a way from the road and from the outside is not the most attractive hotel but inside is clean and modern. The main hotel is built as a quadrangle with open air corridors facing the inner courtyard. The rooms are strangley numbered with even numbers on the east side and odd numbers on the west side, the rooms in the main building are delux rooms, we had a nice sized room, comfy bed, sofa, chair, plenty of storage, fridge restocked every day, kettle, tv, bathrobes,slippers, only fault there was no plug for the sink, think I can live with that.  Facilities - There are many as can be found in the brochures, we liked the over 16 beach area and pool although didnt use it…

title: Turquoise Hotel Side
review: Just returned from a 2 week stay at the Hotel Turquoise in Side,  I would agree with the majority of reviews about this hotel. When we arrived at 1am after a 5 hour delay, we was greeted with a glass of Champagne and given a brief overview of the hotel by a representative. We was then advised the main restaurant is serving breakfast and we can grab a bite to eat after a long day travelling. Unfortunately there was only a small selection available of stale bread, cheese that had been out a while and sweaty ham. Then the group was left to find their own way to their respective rooms, after a brief walk we returned to reception and asked directions. Straight away I am thinking is this a sign of things to come, thankfully it wasn't. However, during the night our air con unit decided…

title: Lovely Holiday but some signs of decline.
review: Returned to Turquoise as enjoyed so much last time. Inevitably you can’t help making comparisons.  Still had a lovely holiday but small signs of ‘tiredness’.    The grounds, plants and trees were recovering from a severe storm which occurred prior to our visit, so hotel clearly not responsible for their appearance and work was carried out to improve and make safe.  Many brollies missing – again storm related and work taking place to slowly replace.  Disappointing things were small like:  mini bar not being replenished as often, on number of occasions  found no soap in toilets or no paper handtowels. There were clearly less guests this year but service at Terrace bar still very slow if sitting in rear of area.  Food became very samey even with alleged themes.. .having said that I…

title: Excellent All Inclusive
review: I spent the first week in October at the Turquoise with my wife, we only booked at the last minute and didn't regret booking this hotel. We were allocated a standard room on the ground floor of the main building. We found it to be a spacious, well equipped room and the bathroom was more than adequate. Although the hotel was not full the service at the bars was always very good and we had no problem finding sunbeds, although we did favour the jetties as a place to sunbath. The food was excellent and there was more than sufficient choice at the evening buffets. We did eat in the specialty fish restaurant and the Turkish restaurant, both of which were a little bit disappointing. It didn't bother us too much as the buffet was so good. We walked into Side a couple of times along the…

title: turquiose side
review: This trip to turkey from the uk was my first ever holiday abroad as well as flying, my partner had been to hotel turquose before so she knew it would be a good choice for me and I was very impressed by it which now sets my benchmark for any further trips to hotels abroad, we travelled via the Thomson agent/airline.  The trip from Antalya airport took around 1 hour on a modern coach, it was dark on arrival and late but the welcome was good, once the bags were in the room we had a late night snack and a few drinks.  Accomodation The room was very nice with private balcony and air con, tv, and mini bar of which is topped up each day, and a very comfy super king sized bed, spotlessly clean throughout, we were on the third floor and it seemed very quiet, having the balcony door open…

title: Amazing hotel
review: Just arrived back in uk after a fabulous 10days at the Turquoise Hotel Side Turkey . This is the best Hotel we have stayed at by far from the moment you arrive you are welcomed at reception with drinks and refreshing cold towels the reception lounge is really lmpresive we stayed in the main building the rooms are really smart also you have slippers and dressing gowns .The food is really good spoilt for choice , you also have a food restaurant outside in the grounds for midday lunch, great pool's water slides for children, with bars for drink open all day a buitifull beech with a clear sea.the staff are fantastic from waiters,barstaff,to the entertainment staff a thank you to Julia who always  along with the other girls made you at ease .The entertainment every night was…

title: After many visits not quite the same!
review: We always enjoy our visits to the Turquoise but if you had not visited before you would not be aware of the differences. The food was good with a reasonable choice but did not match the quality and choice of previous years, Staff are always friendly and hard-working but there was an obvious lack of waiters and bar staff during our visit and the hotel was very busy .I must agree with previous reviews about 'smoking' --I would like to see no smoking in any eating areas and parts of the area around the Sultan bar. Why should non-smokers put up with second-hand smoke ? We had a good time and enjoyed the peace and tranquility of the hotel and grounds. I hope this review explains why i could not give it my usual 'excellent' rating.

title: Very good all inclusive holiday
review: Overall, this hotel ticked all the boxes.  Myself and my partner returned from Side a couple of days ago after spending 7 days at Hotel Turquoise. We and a few other couples were greeted with champagne on arrival at around 2am after a four and a half hour flight and a one hour coach transfer. We are not that much into champagne but it was a nice gesture, and those that do like the bubbly certainly appreciated it.  It didn't take long for us to encounter our first issue though. The bellboy took our luggage and we were given our access cards for our room. We made our way to our room only to find it didn't work. This was a little inconvenient because as you can imagine we just wanted to get our heads down. But the bellboy arrived around 5 minutes after and helped us using his…

title: First class
review: Still here . Food to much to choose from a lot freshly cooked. Soo tasty. All staff from cleaners to chefs are very friendly and welcoming. So much space to move . There is a pier/ jetty to sunbath on. There is no need to put your towel out. Still places at 9.30. Will come back again

title: Good price for a good Hotel
review: Visited this Hotel for a week towards the end of September at a cost of £450 pp now for that price this was fantastic value for money, the Hotel itself is very clean, outside pool area is where this hotel excels with the pool and grass area to the beach where there is plenty of room to be found, plenty of daytime entertainment to enjoy if you want to participate, the entertainment staff  are pleasant and will take time out to speak to you, all-inclusive drinks are decent and we never had to wait long to get served at the bar, La a cart restaurants were hard to book  but I think this was due to going in September and there were less staff present, the food at this Hotel is not the best I have had  but that's not to say it was bad just not so much to choose from, we found that the…

title: Never again
review: The good points lovely clean hotel nice and peaceful close to the beach  Just arrived back this morning  read all the reviews on TripAdvisor and was feeling very positive about going,  would I return no  and I like Turkey been several times,   Rooms very clean  we had a deluxe a badly lit room over looking the entrance to the hotel nothing really deluxe about it except the safe was free and the fridge was stocked everyday ,  no hardship as you only use the room to sleep and shower   Plenty of places to Sunbathe and relax the kids pool was great as it was by the beach and was very quiet, plenty of sunbeds but no umbrellas for shade , they were starting to put them up as we were leaving   The drinks were good not watered down and a good choice of cocktails, I enjoyed the coffee…

title: Amazing!
review: Just returned from an amazing one week holiday here with my partner and was so impressed with this hotel that i felt compelled to write a review.   The food was brilliant from morning to night - so much choice, well prepared, fresh and tasty. Open air chef stations in the outside restaurant area so you can see them cooking which is a nice touch. Restaurant area's are very clean and relaxing.   The staff were first class - very attentive and polite, which really made our stay here pleasurable.   The room was clean and well maintained with good views.   The evening entertainment was very good (live music, children's circus act from Russia, cuban dance show, etc).   There are loads of sunbeds and places to chill on the resort (poolside, beach, grass area, beach decking area). Lots…

title: Relaxing break
review: Just back from a very pleasent week at this hotel the staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel is kept clean the food is just what you would expect in an all inclusive resort yes it does get boring and repetitive but no more than any other resort and you can always find something to eat,drinks are fine if you like efes but the spirits are just cheap substitutes again just like other AI resorts. Plenty of sun beds and plenty of places to go if you want somewhere a bit quite,if you want to get away from the hotel there is a bus stop outside and buses are very regular or you could take a walk along the beach into Side it takes about 35 minutes and is a very easy walk.The hotel does have some form of entertainment every night can't really comment on that as not my scene but…

title: Excellent place for peaceful holiday!
review: Excellent place for peaceful holiday. Hotel is surrounded by a beautiful garden. You do not need to go outside to have a nice walk  Service is very friendly and always try to help.  Restaurants are on a very good level. Main restaurant with strong variety of food. I highly recommended to try all regional restaurants. I did not expect so good Italian food  Sea view rooms placed in a main building are absolutely amazing! Renovated in a very modern style, very comfortable. Hotel is protected by guards – you can feel save.

title: Hit & MIss
review: Hotel grounds are beautiful and peaceful, the staff helpful, polite and lots of staff which  is reflected in the hotel always being clean and tidy. The beach was clean and lovely, the pool was lovely but the constant "games" and VERY loud music was annoying and unfortunate as it ruined the ambiance.   Food was OK in the main dining area which had lots of choice, sometimes too much choice which can reduce quality and more signage of ingredients would be helpful. Snack bar very popular for lunch and food was good but repetitive as same food options every day. The "a la carte" restaurants are not a la carte but set menus mainly and hit and miss, but the Turkish and Steak were delicious!  The Chinese was awful, very poor, so bad we didn't eat more than a mouthful of the food and…

title: Great holiday
review: This is one of the best hotels we've been to. The staff were all friendly and the hotel and grounds are beautiful. The room was a deluxe one overlooking the most lovely Bougainvillea tree and nice and quiet. Plenty of sun beds on the beach and around the pool so no getting up at the crack of dawn to reserve a bed. Everything was spotlessly clean and smelled lovely too. I will definitely go back to this hotel next year.

title: Lovely hotel, great staff and beautiful gardens
review: Just returned from a lovely 7 nights stay. The hotel is set in beautiful grounds, with lots of pine trees, bougainvillea and lush bedding plants. We had a terrible storm whilst we were there, which resulted in a massive clean up of damaged trees and broken beds and umbrellas. However, this did not spoil our enjoyment, as so many staff and guests mucked in to get the place back to some normality. Our room in a Villa suite was large, with a lovely view from the balcony of the gardens and private pool. The only negatives we personally felt were that the bathroom was a little dated, tiles and shower screen , and that the bed was a bit firm. However, that's a personal thing I guess!. The food was plentiful, with lots of choice , however being a Vegetarian I found there wasn't many…

title: Wonderful hotel
review: Excellent in everything: service, friendly staff, activities & entertainments, food, etc. (I can write a long list of good things).   It is almost 1 hour from Antalya airport by taxi. Driver asked for 160 Turkish Lira but after 10 minutes drive he decided that it should be 170 TL.   When we reached the hotel, the first good impression was the smell of the Lobby which was so fresh, I loved it.  Then the nice receptionist who greeted us with a smile. We asked for an early check-in and when we reached our room was ready.    The room was spacious and clean. We had a sea view room (no. 1370). It was very nice.  The food! So yummy .. plenty of choices, very tasty. "Chapeau bas" for the chef :) The All Inclusive package includes almost everything even ice cream, wine, beer, etc.  …

title: AMAZING
review: stayed for 1 week would of loved two weeks stayed in a villa was very quiet area huge spotless massive bed . BEAUTIFUL stroll about 35mins along the beach have a dip in the sea as you go through the Ruins into SIDE use EUROS not lire Turquoise Hotel is well run with happy friendly staff excellent food areas huge main pool plenty of sun beds and shaded areas Entertainment very good although the Ampitheater seating is difficult to sit on after 30mins I Never go back to same hotel but this Hotel ticked all the boxes as a couple the right side of 50 so will definately be back , not many English when we stayed but meat lovely people Al la Carte restaurants very good we tried the steak and chinese  tip book early wi\fi free works even on the beach .Highly recommend well done everyone…

title: Excellent Holiday
review: We booked our holiday roughly 2 weeks before departing and had a nice chilled out time. The resort is clean tidy and air conditioned which was a blessing considering the heat. The food was the standard for all inc, and no complaints, they even went away and made me plain grilled chicken, and couldnt do enough for you. Entertainment was a surprise, not normally my cup of tea, but was very entertaining if you like shows. Bars again the normal drinks etc, but staff ensure you are served as quick as poss ! bus stop outside hotel in SIde 10mins roughly....would defo recommend to friends. I hope the staff manage to get their hotel back in order after a terrible storm on our last day which destroyed the resort....good luck guys

title: A surprisingly great holiday
review: In brief, this is a really good hotel.  We had a fantastic holiday, would happily recommend it to everyone and look forward to returning in the future.  In detail, we stayed her for 1 week in September 2016.  This was our first trip to Turkey, booked as last minute deal via the Thomson website.  It was also the first time that we’d gone for such a large, family-orientated, all inclusive hotel.  Usually, we’d go for a quieter, adult-only place but the low base price made us want to give it a try.  For all those reasons, didn’t quite know what to expect.  The flight was good, no issues at the airport other than quite a long wait for the luggage to be on the belt.  It was very easy to locate the TUI desk and although there several incoming flights for them to deal with, we were on…

title: Great Value for Money
review: We took a late holiday on the spur of the moment and so did not do much research on the resort.  We need not have worried as it is a great resort. The resort is set on its own large sandy beach which extends out in to the sea.  The beach slopes gently into the sea which is fantastic for small children.  It is a blue flag beach (2016) and so is great quality and is patrolled by lifeguards. The main swimming pool is one of the biggest that I have seen.  Towels are available on poolside in exchange for the free towel cards.  There seemed to be an endless supply of towels. There are plenty of sunbed and shades both around the pool, on the beach and on the many grass areas.  The bar near the beach has a lovely grass seating area which is great for a glass of raki whilst watching the…

title: Adequate
review: Poor evening entertainment. Al la cart restuarants, very dissapointing food, soulless and rushed. Themes non existent. Bars ok but nothing exiting. Staff friendly. Bar staff good.  Hotel adequate,  been to much better at similar prices. 11 nights is more than enough.

title: Good place to stay
review: Turkey always has beautiful hotels and beautiful beaches and, well, beautiful everything. It is the ideal holiday makers hub. This hotel is the perfect example of this. Clean spacious lovely warm water. Shame we cant go there this year.......

title: "Excellent Resort"
review: We spent 2 weeks at Turquoise Resort in august 2016. We had a good deluxe room with see view, large and modern, everything was clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Excellent food, enough choices and possibilities to eat and drink almost 24h. Good located hotel with private beach and different pools with towel service. Beach is perfect for children and adults. Plenty of sunbeds. Pools are clean and warm. Beautiful gardens, pine forest. Free WIFI available all over the resort (even in the see). Couldn´t fault anyone for everything.

title: A very good hotel but a little disappointed
review: We went back to Turquoise for the third time and not even a single sign of courtesy. We arrived at night very late, we were given a bedroom on the first floor just in front of a tree... We asked to change. After seeing the other bedroom that we didn't like either, we were told by Nahir that we would be given another bedroom the next day because it was full. I really had doubts about this. So, that was our first struggle. Once we booked the Italian restaurant and we were asked to change our booking... I don't really get the new policy of the hotel. It seems that the more often you go back the less they care about you. We have noticed that it is not as clean as the previous years either. Then, at dinner time I was told off in German because I was trying to learn some Turkish with…

title: Perfect!
review: Currently enjoying our last couple of days at this wonderful hotel. Everything is perfect. Rooms are clean, spacious and well stocked. Wifi is excellent even in the sea! Food is always hot, lots of choice and a la cartes are beautiful especially the Turkish restaurant which has the best presented tables and friendly staff.  All staff are lovely and the welcome is the best we have ever had at any hotel. Thomson rep is also good and reception staff can answer any query and give information easily and with a smile.  Pools are clean and warm. Beach is perfect for adults and children and very peaceful with gently sloping sea depths. Plenty of sun beds everywhere. We never had to get up and reserve one despite getting up at gone 11 am one day!  We would like to thank all the staff for…

title: Dissapointing
review: Myself and 8 other members of my family have just stayed here for 1 week. On arrival we walked into a lovely air conditioned hotel and was met my a very nice man whom checked us in followed by cold flannels and champagne. We went to our rooms and the disappointment began my completely disabled sister in law her wheelchair could not fit through the door of the bedroom we complained and they then moved her to a family room with her husband my mum niece great niece and nephew with 1 shower for all these people and still her wheelchair would not fit through the door but they would not upgrade them to a disabled room as they didn't know she was disabled although she had assistance through the flight. That spoilt our holiday. Also the toilets in the bar area again the doors not wide…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Couldn't fault anyone for anything. Wonderful attentive friendly staff throughout, large clean modern rooms, free wifi (even down by the beach), beautiful gardens, excellent choice of fresh healthy food and plenty of it (albeit more Turkish than European). Great for carnivores too! Plenty of bars (all-incl). Good professional shows every night. Lovely location (few kms from Side) and very safe.  No security worries, even in these troubled times. On the down side, we were last to be dropped off after alighting in Antalya airport, as this hotel is on the east side of Side.  A bit let down with regard to the children/mini club.  Depends also on how much the child looks to get out of the experience.  As Anglophones, we were in a minority (mainly Turks, Dutch & German visitors the…

title: Fabulous Holiday
review: Our family have just arrived back from this resort and I wanted to do this review as we could not fault this hotel.   From the moment you arrive the welcome makes you feel special. All the staff were so friendly. The rooms were very clean and modern.   We stayed in the standard rooms and were very happy with the quality of the room. The rooms had walk in showers which had plenty of hot water daily.   We have 3 teenagers and there was lots for them to do and keep them entertained. The animation team were amazing and made their holiday special.   The food was fabulous, the buffet restaurant had something for everyone. And we also tried all the Al a carte restaurants and they were very impressive. We loved them all but you must try the Steak House as you sit pool side and see the…

title: Antaya's paradise!
review: A real paradise,i like it a lot.Very beautifil nature,great staff,clean rooms with balcony and garden or sea view.I have spent 7 days in this resort with my family,it was wonderful,specially for my parents.You should try the steak and the Italian restaurant,elegant decor and very pleasing food.I didn't have the chance to try the chineese and the Kebab restaurant,because you need to reserve two days before.The relax pool is really relaxing,the main swimming pool is great for family,with lot of activities during the day(games,sport...). The sea is very clean,and you can do water sports(parasailing,surfing,jet sky )with good price. A good variety of food in the main restaurant,the baklava is really yummy. We reserved a family room in the hotel,because of my parents ,but the private…

title: Very Nice, Clean Hotel!
review: Stayed at the Turquoise Hotel for one week, thought it was very nice and clean, the reception smelt lovely with fresh flowers, all the staff were very nice and helpful, we firstly got put in a garden room which was not the greatest of rooms, but the hotel upgraded us and changed the room without no hassle, beautiful setting and in general just a very good hotel for the price.  Food was very nice had a big selection and you could always get food if you was hungry, there was plenty of bars too, only problem was the adult pool did not have a bar and you had to walk a little just to get a drink.  Also, the adult pool was right next to the indoor pool and when you want to relax away from the children you couldn't as the children had to walk through the adult pool to get to the indoor…

title: Pleasant but not without its downfalls
review: Lets start with the good as i don't want to discourage folks by just moaning.  Pros. Very good selection of food all day long, Don't expect anything less than ALOT of meat here its lovely stuff i could return just for the food. Pool area well maintained to a very high standard, Plenty of beds and parasols available in my opinion MOST of the staff are very friendly, Afew got a nice tip for going the extra mile to make us feel welcome or have our drinks ready when they saw us coming in evening. Bravo to the bar staff at Beach bar and the one next to stage at night Entertainments team, This team deserves a hell of alot of credit for all the stuff they do to make the stay enjoyable  Cons. Staff in the Turkish A La carte restaurant were very rude, Seemed like they didn't care in…

title: Better than all the rest
review: From start to Finnish could not fault a thing. On arrival we were all sat at a table passports collected drinks served we had two of our grandchildren with us kids cocktails and balloons for them,the staff checked us in gave us our keys told us a bit about the hotel and that the porter would bring our cases to our rooms. 5 year old was hungry this was around 12  o'clock late night supper available,and the next day things just got better. We had been told that all inclusive in Turkey was not good value for money HOW WRONG THEY WERE. Not one day could we not get a nice meal and the poolside buffet could not be faulted. They were constantly replenishing all the salad and cooked food cleaning the areas around the big salad bar,so I say to those who have not tried it read trip…

title: First couple holiday
review: Had the most amazing time at Turquoise. Only stayed a week but both wished we'd stayed longer. The food was really nice with a good variety on offer. But the animation team deserve most credit. Non stop, energetic and enthusiastic about any of the activities on offer. Even staying up for the small night club in the late evening. Really recommend this hotel for a family of any age and even couples. Loads on offer with good excursions also.

title: Second visit and would go again tomorrow
review: We visited this hotel in 2013 and I must say that it was better than our last visit.  Hotel occupancy was down because of world-wide troubles, which is a shame as the Country and indeed, the people, need our custom.  We requested a room near to where we stayed last time and were given the room next door, this was overlooking the indoor pool and gardens, very quiet.  There was absolutely no need to go down early to reserve sunbeds, plenty of availability.  All aspects of the hotel were immaculate and all staff were extremely friendly.  I would say that the food was better than in 2013.  The first week or so, we ate our lunch in the buffet restaurant by the pool but as the weather got hotter as much as 51 degrees at one point, people were dining inside with the air conditioning. …

title: Ticked all the boxes!
review: We booked a last minute break a few days before travelling. We were after a restful, relaxing week doing nothing. Turquoise Hotel certainly ticked the right boxes. We had a very chilled week. The setting is perfect, on the beach but with lots of greenery. The room was spotlessly clean.  The food was good. The evening entertainment was ok and you could escape it if you wanted to.  All in all a very pleasant stay and we would recommend it.

title: Beautiful hotel
review: Returned today from Turquoise Hotel this is a lovely hotel.  It's absolutely spotless the rooms are nice and comfortable.  Couldn't believe how lovely the grounds and surroundings are plus they are so well maintained.  The staff are great couldn't do enough for you.  It's on the beach which is another plus . Would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone . We're hoping to return .

title: Why go to the Caribbean
review: Stayed here last August and forgot to write a review but my poor experience this week of Tenerfie 4 star reminded me. Stayed last August and this hotel set in a national park is far enough away from the main resort of Side that it is a different world.  Side itself is a dump, but apart from seeing the ruins which are a must, yiu don't need to leave the hotel.  Set is cool gardens with a a beach and lots of space to sunbathe, the entertainment was first class day and night.  It is reminiscent of a Caribbewn hotel set in big grounds. The food was excellent with so much choice and speciality restaurants.  The staff were all very pleasant and couldn't do enough for you. We tipped our diner waiter £10 th first might and every night thereafter our table was rserv d and beautifully…

title: Paradise
review: I traveled here in Sept 14 for two weeks and couldn't have enjoyed it any more. It had everything to offer you could ever need at an all inclusive resort. Would definitely go back in the future when the whole terrorism threat is lower.  If you do go, you must walk along the beach into the old town, it bus beautiful.

title: Pleasant Getaway
review: This must be one of the most reasonably priced 5 star resort I have ever been to. Most probably, the cheapest too. I suppose that the stars in Turkey say nothing about the quality, but rather the price you pay. I understand that people return multiple times to Turquoise, but if I may be honest, I would most probably not return any time sooner (I'd rather see more of the world than return to the same place every year).  Granted, the resort is set in a beautiful area just outside of the historical city of Side and is beautifully maintained by the many gardeners. It has the right size and space, for everyone to enjoy their time--may it be at the private beach, swimming pool or the many bars. You may think that there is a lot of choice, but after a few days you will realize that…

title: Simply the Best
review: Recently returned from our 11th visit to the Turquoise - just love this place, great location in the Sorgun forest, beautiful gardens, on the beach, plenty of open space, lovely pools and two fantastic piers.  The hotel was quieter than past visits as was Side itself and its such a shame that some people won't travel to Turkey.   The people of Turkey are so friendly and the staff at the Turquoise excel in this department, nothing is too much trouble and you feel spoilt rotten by the time you leave. The quality of the food is second to none and it is good to see that the choice and standard of the meals has maintained even though the longstanding head chef, Izmet has retired and his second in command has taken the reins. Credit to all the chefs for the wonderful cuisine. It is…

title: Great visit
review: I am currently staying at the hotel with my husband and two small children. The visit so far has been great. The food has been varied and delicious and there is lots to do for everyone. The staff have been very friendly as well. The room (family room) could use some touching up but the grounds are immaculate.

title: Going down to be 3 star hotel
review: PFFFFF where I will start ! Let start who to fire direct ! NR1 the GM NR2 he right hand GM Grey man walks around do nothing NR3 head house keeping aka dictator.  1.let start with the GM do nothing walks around don't help don't walk DON'T ask guest if they are happy, poor English, just eat and play phone en drinks just get him out waste off $  2. Grey man when people complain it your job to FIX it en don't come 13 day later bla bla bla stings still broken (MICROWAVE) en no staff never lie to guest that know how this hotel normal works  3. Head house keeping when a trainee is sick this towel boy at the towel handout was sick and coughing in my face with his virus I ask him you sick he say yes I did see who his boss was it was the dictator housekeeping telling him to work more I…

title: Brilliant
review: Thank you very much for your comment. As Hotel management, we are sorry that you, and your family did not have your dream holiday.                  We are running a big Hotel, and in order to improve our service and quality  we have to make some changes, and unfortunately there sometimes occur such problems. We are a big family, a big team and we all have team spirit, so every body can do any work here. We have a team leader, our General Manager, who coordinates all the work, speaks flueant English as you must have noticed when you had a conversation with him.                 You are all free to critisize and comment us, which we find very useful to improve our service, but you never have right to insult persons.                 Your comments, which are written in a respectful way, will be noticed down.  Best Regards

title: Wonderful hotel in Turkey
review: A lovely holiday and you couldn't ask for better all inclusive which included the mini bar. Plenty of room around the pool and plenty of loungers but there is the usual sunbed reserving as with most hotels. Food and drink were brilliant and some of the shows were amazing.

title: Great hotel with loggerhead turtles just of the beach
review: This is a great hotel, lovely food, service, everything you could want, but the most amazing thing is if you go snorkelling, a few yards off shore you can see turtles just grazing and swimming slowly around. This will be our third visit. It really is a lovely place.

title: Unbelievable
review: Was looking for somewhere different in Turkey when a customer I sold a car too told me to look at this hotel. So i went home had a look and within 20 minutes i was booked to go. We arrived quite late and the transfer took a while but thata not the hotels fault obviously but when we arrived at the hotel we where greeted witha nice welcome and given a glass of champagne and a few cakes in the lobby while we got given our resort guides and keys. The buffet was still open so we could eat or go for a stroll around the grounds and beach. Even at 1am the sea is lovely and warm.  Every day our mini bar was refilled and everything inside it was complimentary. So was the bottle of wie they left in our room for our annieversary gift from the hotel.  The beach was spotless and was groomed…

title: Good holiday at this resort, hotel to recommend, but know what to expect!
review: Dear guests,  thank you very much for your positive review and many insider tips. We will be very happy to welcome you this year too!  Best regards Hotel Turquoise

title: wonderful relaxing holiday
review: The hotel grounds are beautiful. The pools are really nice and clean. We went to the resort with older kids and they where very happy. The animation and the shows are really good!  The staff at the restaurants were very helpful and friendly, The service at reception was less good. The people there were less friendly and helpful.  The concept all-inclusive should fit you. For me it was the last time.   Some facilities are older, some parts are new and well designed. Nice to have the choise to eat al la carte.   Unfortunately at this hotel also, the towels are used in the morning to reserve the best spot. If you want a quiet start, you have to settle for a place remotely.  Although this is considered a 5* hotel, I would mention to anyone who has visited 5* hotels, that the…

title: Great Week in Side, Turkey
review: Dear guests,  thank you very much for the review.  Best regards Hotel Turquoise

title: Great food, service, entertainment, accommodation etc.
review: We stayed with our teenage daughter in one of the two bedroom garden villas for a week at the end of October 2015 (got home just yesterday!).  The villa bedrooms were both en-suite, and were kept spotlessly clean.  We had not previously stayed at an all inclusive resort, and were slightly concerned that the food may be mediocre and would not have sufficient choice.  However, the hotel had themed evenings such as fish, Italian, Mexican, etc, and there was always a wide choice of not only the 'theme' of the evening, but lots of other types of food too.  In fact, we chose not to book into the hotels other a la carte restaurants as we found the buffet food delicious.  The hotel was busy when we arrived (half term week), but many of the hotels and businesses close for the winter at…

title: Great Place, Nice Staff, on the whole.
review: Dear guests,  thank you for your long review. We hope that you will visit us again.  Best regards Hotel Turquoise

title: Hotel ready for refit
review: My wife and I booked this hotel only two days before departure, with Thomson, at a good price in a DeLuxe room which is a part of the main building, unlike the Standard rooms which are a short walk away.  We travelled mid October for two weeks.  The hotel is very satisfactory and we have decided to return next year assuming we can get a good price and hopefully NOT with Thomson. (Reason later).  The food in this resort was excellent, there was so much choice at the buffet for every meal and also the snack bar for lunch.
