Having said that the rooms we stayed in were in the older (?) part of the hotel and needed some revamping although this didn't spoil the holiday as we spent very little time there.  Spa was also very good - try the Turkish bath package if you're brave enough! Good value…

title: Fantastic hotel
review: Just returned from a one week stay, the hotel was more than we'd hoped for! On our arrival we were given an upgrade to a deluxe room, we had help with our baggage, given a welcome drink and treated exceptionally well throughout our stay. The staff are very young but very hard working, they are a credit to the Hotel and made a real difference. There's a huge variety of food and if you wanted to you could eat loads throughout the day. The place is immaculate inside and out, they never stop cleaning it. Lots of facilities and a great pool area, right next to the beach.  A big Thank you from us to the Hotel team for making sure we had such a fantastic holiday!

title: Perfect holiday!!!!!
review: Dear Diane A,  thank you for the review and nice words about our staff!  Best regards Hotel Turquoise

title: Really great holiday
review: PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT LISTEN TO NONSENSE REVIEWS!!!!!!  Just returned from this amazing hotel. I am well travelled and have been to lots of hotels in Turkey. This hotel was outstanding and I have nothing to fault. The reason why this hotel stands out from the rest is due to the outstanding service from the staff who are always there with a smile and happy to be doing their jobs. I believe this is due to management looking after their staff. Keep it up!!! This makes your hotel extra special.  The Turkish bath is a must with the Bali girls who were excellent along with all the food staff, reception staff, bar staff etc. The hotel was spotless and even management helped out cleaning in the restaurant. Nothing was ever too much hard work. I have never had such good service in…

title: FAB HOLIDAY WITH FAB FRIENDS
review: Dear Hayley T,  thank you for the review and for the nice words about our service team!  Best regards Hotel Turquoise

title: Great Family holiday
review: Spent 1 week here at the end of August. We had such a wonderful time.   Our room which was a short walk from the reception which wasn't a problem as the gardens are immaculate and it was a pleasure to walk to and from the pool.   The service couldn't be faulted at all. Everybody went out of their way to get info for you if they didn't know immediately. Always smiling and friendly. The lobby barman was the friendliest of all and always remembered our drinks.  We ate in 3 of the 5 restaurants . We couldn't get into the others. Our favourite was the Chinese and the Turkish was fab too. It was my birthday when we were there and the table was beautifully decorated. The buffet which I'm never keen on for dinner was a delight. Plenty to choose and always fresh. Sitting outside made me…

title: This is a fantastic hotel
review: Stayed here three times now it's a great hotel one of the best I have ever stayed in. Rooms a large and very comfortable.  The resturant is huge one of the largest buffet I've ever seen. The do a 14 day menu so there is plenty of choice. The pool is very clean beach is on the door step if you get board. Lots of things for the kids to do too.

title: Excellent value
review: Dear Eddie241,  thank you for the review! Hope to see you next year for the 4th time!  Best regards Hotel Turquoise

title: Excellent all round
review: We arrived on 26th August for a 10 night stay at approximately 4:30pm and owing to the very efficient check-in process were in our ground floor room for 5:00pm. We opted for the standard room and it had everything we needed; it was clean, had fresh towels and linen replaced everyday if you requested this by placing a card on the bed, a good sized comfortable bed, good shower and air conditioning which is a little noisy and did leak once but, to the credit of the hotel staff, was fixed within approximately 15 minutes from the point we reported it to reception. All the staff without exception are extremely helpful and very hard working- I cannot in anyway comprehend the statements other reviewers have made about them being unhelpful, rude and unable to speak English -it certainly…

title: Great resort
review: Dear EmmaNickHolt,  thank you for such a nice review. We are happy that you enjoyed your stay at Turquoise Hotel. Hope to meet you here next year!  Best regards Hotel Turquoise

title: Would Recommend!!
review: Had a wonderful 7 days at the Turquoise. The resort is stunning.  All the staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean and offers excellent and much needed air conditioning in a number of areas. The deluxe rooms are fantastic, with enough room to sleep three if necessary and all necessary facilities provided including a very useful minibar. Food is of a high standard and there is certainly enough variation for a week. One downside is the difficulty in booking the a-la-carte restaurants. There are five to choose from but we only managed to book two. Would recommend trying to book as soon as you arrive (both a la cartes we tried were very good). You can also get great food, pastries and ice creams throughout the day in the numerous snack bars. Facilities in the complex…

title: Fantastic hotel
review: We just had a wonderful family holiday at the Turquoise Hotel. We are a family of 5, with 3 children aged 11,13 and 16, as well as their two grandmas and we all loved this hotel. In summary: food fantastic variety, fresh, always replenished and queues not bad at all for August. Pools lovely (we especially loved the relax pool and cool indoor pool). Shady gardens - to shelter from the August sun. Right next to nice beach. Loads of sun loungers available even in peak season. Really good evening entertainments (we LOVED the Four Seasons night outdoor disco!). Nice rooms kept spotlessly clean. And finally the lovely Turkish staff; TBH I find it a bit embarrassing lounging around for two weeks like a lazy north European lobster, stuffing my face all day long (there is afternoon tea…

title: No complaints for the price
review: Dear guests,  thank you very much for your comment. We are happy that you enjoyed your stay so much at Turquoise Hotel.  Because of the caretta caretta turtles we can not remove anything from the sea.  Best regards  Turquoise Hotel

title: Over priced average hotel
review: Booked with Thompson, stayed 7th August for two weeks. Booked the deluxe rooms (in the main building) Antalya airport was surprisingly quiet when we arrived mid afternoon, straight through passport control and not having to queue for a visa was a plus ! Transfer about an hour, no rep on the coach which seems to be the norm lately. Cold face cloth and glass of bubbly on arrival and quickly shown to our rooms. I emailed before departure and requested high floor and adjacent rooms which was what we got.  The rooms are quiet small but are clean and comfortable. If you are next to the elevator then they are even smaller. Now as for deluxe, they may be for a four star but I have stayed in better standard rooms along the coast in 5* hotels in Belek. But having said that this was…

title: Turquise hotel side
review: Dear guests,  thank you for adding a comment on trip advisor! We are glad that you had a nice and relaxing holiday.  Best regards Turquoise Hotel

title: Excellent holiday
review: The four of us stayed for two weeks starting 6/8/14. We also went with several other friends. We found the hotel a real mix, some good points and some real let downs which I will go into. Overall, having stayed in several other 4star all inclusive places worldwide, this had to be the least luxurious and the most expensive.   Good points- fantastic pool scene, some helpful efficient staff, clean modern rooms, lots of daytime activities, food mostly good, fantastic weather.  Bad points- breakfast was barely worth getting up for. No fresh coffee ( all machine, self service) no bacon nearly all food catered for the Germans and Dutch.  Restricted eating times at main buffet, if you miss the first 90 mins then the freshly cooked food has shut up. This is the food outside eg. Pancakes…

title: According to our expectations!
review: We are family of four (My Wife, my 2 Kids and me) and have been at the hotel one week (26.07.2014 to 02.08.2014). Transfer from airport take little over an hour, but once in the hotel check-in goes fast and personnel makes you feel welcome immediately. A bit more of info about activities and how to book them would have been appreciated. We tried to upgrade for a Villa but all was fully booked. We were in the building E, room 6035. 5 minutes awl from the main building / reception. Seven from the Buffet restaurant and 10 from Swimming pools and the beach. Spacious room, confortable and clean, a room for me & my wife, another for the kids. You have to pay a fee for the safe which is not big deal. Minibar refiled everyday although we should remember them to leave  some beers. :-)…

title: Lovely hotel
review: Dear AlfreK,  thank you very much for your opinion. We are happy that you enjoyed you stay at Turquoise Hotel.  Hope to meet you here next year!  Turquoise Hotel

title: Lots of stuff to do
review: Stayed from 31st July for 2 weeks before travel I emailed the hotel to arrange a birthday cake for my daughter as it was her birthday day after we were due to arrived hotel were very accommodating and helpful. Arrived on thomson flight was bit stressed on arrival as one of our suitcases had gone missing thomson rep was very helpful and it arrived a day and half later.  Arrival at the hotel was very professional had lovely glass of champagne whilst they briefed us on hotel facilities.  We had booked 2 double standard rooms which were very nice in peaceful location overlooking the gardens fridge was stocked daily.Main buffet was lovely always good choice to a high standard and very nice during the day snack food bars were also very nice also enjoyed the fresh Turkish breads that…

title: Up to what we expected
review: Dear Suzanne h,  thank you for the comment!  It's great to hear that you liked our rooms, main restaurant and hotel grounds. Hope to sea you next year.  Best regards Turquoise Hotel

title: Summer holidays in Side
review: turquoise Resort has lots of stuff to do eg: they have tennis court games mini golf mini market gift shop spa and swimming pool. If you want to play tennis you have to book it at the mangement office.

title: Dissappointed
review: Arrived at hotel around midnight and was met with glass of champers and cold flannel Very nice touch We were shown the way to our room which was very nice with a lovely comfortable bed As we hadn't eaten we thought we would go down to the midnight buffet which was really poor Only cold ham and  cheese a couple of cereals and bread not at all what we have experienced before. The pool area although very busy was easily accessible and there were activities going on which gave it a good atmosphere although lacking in cleaning staff around this area. The Entertainment was average and service at bars adequate The biggest problem in this hotel was the restaurant and food  The food was very repetitive and poor quality not what I expected from a hotel with4+ stars Even the gala evenings…

title: Great Holiday
review: Dear guests,  thank you for your review.  Best regards Turquoise Hotel

title: Would have been brilliant, customer service let them down!
review: I spent time here last summer and I must say, this was one of the best holiday I have ever had. We had a room in the main building, that was spacious and clean. Everything was near, food in the main restaurant was very tasty. There is a lot of sunbeds for you, both on beach and close to the pool. The area around the pool is grassy, with many trees, so you can always find shadow. The animation team was great, spa very relaxing. If you want to go to Side or Manavgat, the bus stop is just ouside the hotel entrance. I'll be back for sure.

title: Another awesome holiday at the Turquoise Hotel
review: Dear skebrik,  thank you very much for your opinion. It's great to hear that you liked our food, rooms and animation.  Hope to see you next year!  Turquoise Hotel

title: Visited as a Day Guest
review: We stayed as a family, 2 adults, 2 teenagers 15 & 17, 1st-8th Aug 2014.  Overall we had a lovely holiday, however, these are my key points:  Positive: clean, staff friendly and helpful (except reception!), an excellent selection of food & drink.  The teenagers enjoyed the disco each night, entertainment was good, compared to other hotels we have stayed at in Turkey.  Negative: We arrived at 4am I had booked 2 rooms online, I then emailed requesting a double & a twin room, this was agreed by email.  On arrival we were given 2 double rooms, not ideal for brother & sister really!  We made do at that point but the following day we had to argue the point, and it was only the fact that I had the email with me that they were willing to sort the rooms.  We were upgraded to a garden…

title: Fantastic holiday
review: We spent 11 nights at this hotel and could not have wished  for anything better. The staff were friendly and very professional. The only down side was the evenings entertainment. Having said that, the children's entertainment was excellent,which gave us time to relax and socialise. The food was well prepare and gave a host of different choices,the general appearance of rooms and facilities were of a high standard of cleanliness.(and that is said as we have a commercial cleaning business).We would certainly book for next year and  would certainly recommend the hotel to our friends.

title: Unexpected hospitality and comfort
review: Dear guests,  thank you for review and for recommending Turquoise Hotel to your friends!  See you next year!  Best regards Turquoise Hotel

title: Fabulous from start to finish!
review: I stayed in the hotel together with my wife and two sons, 8 and 10 years of age, from July the 19th till July the 30th. I am very pleased and satisfied. I try to tell about in the bullet points: Check in and welcome: We were welcomed with sparkling wine and puffo for the kids. The receptionist explained everything in details. We were upgraded from family room in the block of flats to the luxury family suite in the main building with the sea view! This was very nice gesture. Room: Very spacious! Soundproof was a huge plus, airco working perfectly and silently. Three balconies to choose:-) Drinks replanished daily. Also have no remarks for the cleaning of the room however I used to leave some euros for the maids. Food: Huge choice of breakfast, lunch and dinner dishes. No quees…

title: Double booked rooms
review: Dear James05500,  thank you very much for such a long and positive review!  Best regards  Turquoise Hotel

title: If no soap, human shot in the sea and a twisted knee is no issue to you this is your place to stay
review: I took my 19 year old daughter for a 2 week holiday end of July.  I must say we both enjoyed everything about Turquoise Hotel & Spa resort.  The only one downside for me would be the block we stayed in is in need of a make over! Could be stunning! The surroundings however are beautiful and peaceful!   The food was delicious! Especially the variety of salads! The roast lamb! Need more traditional Turkish kebabs on menus! The staff was always smiling and worked very hard! The last week was full occupancy and the hotel staff still remained to keep the standards going! Big up for Turquoise Hotel & Spa resort Side!! We miss you! X

title: Totally Wonderful !!!
review: Please don't get any second thoughts about staying at this hotel, it's lovely from the welcome you receive at the start to the service you get throughout your stay. The rooms are spacious and spotlessly cleaned each day. The hotel is set in acre's of grounds so you never feel like it's too busy or that your too close to other people. The pool's are really nice and a wonderful temperature, you can just walk straight in.  The food is plentiful and a changed theme each night and you'll always find something you like no matter how fussy you are. Special thanks to Ulker on the lunch time snack bar. She is a credit to this hotel and the management should treat her like a princess. She doesn't stop and her attention and service is fantastic. Evening entertainment is of a good standard…

title: Price quality the best you can get
review: Dear Andyobie38,  thank you for your review and for recommending Turquoise Hotel! Hope to see you next year!  Best regards Turquoise Hotel

title: The best resort i ever stayed.
review: In 2 days we will be leaving back home again but untill that time we, familiy of 5, will enjoy every bit of this great hotel.  Food and bars : ***** We have booked the all-in concept and to be honest, this is some of the best you can get. It starts with the breakfast buffet with all you can think of, lunch, thematic diner buffets, snacks all day long, pattiserie and ice-cream, ..... do not step on the scale before you come here. There are plenty of bars with a rich choice of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks.  Rooms : ***** book the deluxe room as these have been renovated and look great. Airco is perfectly adjustable and very silent. (bad much worse in 5* hotels) Pool and beach : ****(*) great pool, and very well maintained garden. The hotel rests in a very large garden with…

title: Our Family thought it was great!
review: Dear guests,  thank you very much for such a long and positive review!  Best regards Turquoise Hotel

title: Good but not great !!
review: Friendly staff and kind. Great cooks and food.  Rooms so clean .  Gardens fantastic. Beach very green . I spent 2 weeks and enjoyed all activities . Our room cleaned everyday .they changed sheets and was so helpfull. While we stayed at Turquiose , hotel was full . Full means 1400 guests. Even with full capacity nothing changed and service was same as good as. Thanks to Turquiose Manager and all friendly Staff .

title: Good but not perfect
review: Stayed for 2 weeks from 8th July Antalya airport a nightmare waiting ages for cases coming through a few at a time then none for ages We had a private transfer one way with graham very efficient would highly recommend Checkin went smoothly had booked a room in main hotel and got exactly what we asked for a high floor with late afternoon sunshine The sunsets from balcony we're amazing Very impressed with room and facilities On some days however not always impressed with the cleaning We always keep room tidy so not much for maid to do However one day came in to find dirty towels and there was shaving foam on tiles in shower area for 5days before we wiped it off ourselves also some coffee spilled on dressing table which was there for days We arrived on Tuesday and went straight to…

title: Great stay at Turquoise
review: Dear guests,  thank you for your review.  Best regards Turquoise Hotel

title: Mostly good
review: Food: staying 2weeks in an all inclusive can mean the food is a bit repetitive, but we found that the theme nights and the 5 al a carte restaurants gave plenty of options. We had no issue booking the al a carte restaurants, managing the Chinese, Turkish and fish in our first week (these 3 booked the morning after we arrived) and then after we had been here a week we booked into the steak and Italian restaurants no issue. The only watch out, getting toast is chaotic, and certain guests have no concept of what a queue is.  Sun lounges: the hotel policy is good that towels are removed if they are left before 9am, but they only remove a couple everyday, and most people camp out on the best located loungers from 7am, so need to get up early for the best spots.  Location: excellent…

title: Great setting in the beautiful gardens!
review: Dear Hannah T,  thank you for your review. We are glad that your stay at Turquoise has met your expectations. Hope to meet you here next year!  Best regards Hotel Turquoise

title: My review broken down into main areas
review: Stayed 1st week of July and overall had a lovely holiday, but very disappointed that the hotel boasts 5 a la carte restaurants but we couldn't get into any..very limited availability. Food was ok but definitely geared towards Russian/ German visitors, bit samey, I'm not a fussy eater but I was not overly impressed with the food. Plenty of sunbeds but nowhere near enough umbrellas!! Turkish staff in the lobby were lovely but Russian ones quite rude. Also almost all of the kids entertainment was not English..my little boy couldn't understand most of it! Saying all that we still had a good holiday, but prob wouldn't return.

title: Great Holiday at Turquoise
review: Just returned from a great and relaxing holiday at Turquoise in Side.   Location The hotel is situated in the forest of Sorgun. No shops or anything right outside hotel but taxi and busstop right in front of entrance. Side and Manavgat are 5 minutes away. Cost you 7 and 8 euro for taxi.  General The surroundings are amazing, palm trees, pines, flowers. Gardeners did a great job keeping this garden very clean. The general areas were kept spotless clean. Even saw a live turtle in the garden.  Room We booked 2 standard rooms and asked adjacent rooms. We were amazed by the fact we were upgraded to a 3 room villa with terrace. Our villa had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and a livingroom. Every room had separate airconditioning, mini bar (replenished daily) and a flatscreen tv. Bed was a…

title: Great hotel but
review: Dear Kevin B,  thank you very much for your opinion. We are very happy that you enjoyed your room, food and service so much.  Hope to see you next year!  Hotel Turquoise

title: Fabulous Hotel
review: Write this review sitting on the beach on last day of my holidays, everything up to now is great,2nd visit so I knew what expect great location, service, food, cleanliness, entertainment but as I speak I have just been told I cannot use my room after 12 midday.  When you have a late flight you risk having no place to freshen up and if they can spare a room it's approx £35 for 4 hours and £70 for 8 which Is pretty expensive, that luxury I don't have so here's to a long 10 hour wait for the coach

title: Another Great stay
review: Dear Roy c,  thank you for the review.  Late check out is only possible if there is no or late arrival to the room that you are occupying. If new guest come early we can not let you stay in the room longer than till 12:00 because it has to be cleaned and prepared for the new arriving guests. The guests can use free of charge all the hotel facilities including food and beverages till their departure.   Best regards Hotel Turquoise

title: fabulous holiday
review: Stayed at this hotel 01 July - 15 July.  We arrived after 10.30pm, after checking in we were given a glass of champagne and an ice cold face flannel which was a nice touch.  We were then offered something to eat.  Our bags were taken to our room 1364 which was beautiful and the view was fabulous over the main pool and sea.  The mini bar in our room was stocked daily with Pepsi, Orange, Lemonade, sparkling water, Still water, Effes Beer. Tea and coffee was also stocked daily. Rooms are cleaned everyday.  All staff at this hotel are excellent and work very hard to make your stay enjoyable, nothing is too much trouble.  The buffet restaurant is fantastic with a very wide choice of delicious food (Well done Chefs!).  We also visited 3 of the a-la-carte restaurants (Turkish, Italian…

title: Top Resort! Great holidays!
review: Me and my wife stayed for 3 nights (main building, not villas) and we enjoy just about everything!! Beach in front of the hotel; main pool is so large and amazing (not hard to get a good spot); children pool with slides; adults only pool to chill out; indoor pool if you don't want any of the previous; very friendly staff; lots of animation (at the pool, at the beach and after dinner); everything spotless clean; the peers are great to walk and to spend quality time; the hotel surrondings are beautiful; all the environment is cozy and inspiring; plenty bars in strategic spots; the buffet is superb and always available - lots of food to choose from, great quality. Really not many differences between being at Turquoise Resort Hotel or at a Caribbean resort.

title: Superb
review: I will start at the beginning of the holiday . After arriving late check in is rather brief but everything is explained by the night manager .Taken to our hotel room by a porter which was quiet a distance from reception which bothered me at the time , I was so wrong. The pool areas are excellent but be up early for a parasol as these are taken up  quiet quick .We tried all the the eating areas on the complex apart from the steak diner , i was disappointed will all of them apart from the Turkish which was very good . The buffet is what it is good quality food but sometimes a little bit the same , but that's not a complaint .Entertainment in the evening is very good and all the staff working the bar areas make sure that your looked after , Would I stay here again ---a big yes ,…

title: Fab hotel but location not great.
review: Excellent hotel. Good choice of food and always hot. Staff worked extremely hard at every bar and restaurant to get people served. Friendly and welcoming staff. Lovely young man called Ali Can in the main restaurant always found us a table.  Weather was fabulous - very hot and sunny every day. Deffinately needed the air con in rooms.  Hotel is very big with villas in the grounds looking a bit like Center Parcs.  We had booked 2 double rooms, but ended up in a 2 bed villa with 1 double room, 1 twin room and a lounge all rooms had a fridge all well stocked with drinks. Private pool with allocated sun beds with villa number on the side. Also private eating place for breakfast and lunch. Main restaurant could be used if preferred. Villa lovely just a little trek down to the pool and…

title: PERFECT!
review: We stayed in many high quality hotels (including far east famous with its service) with my wife and thrust us that this hotel presents its guests one of the best and warmest wellcome and friendly service.  We stayed there for 6 nights and also celebrated our anniversary.   Taste of the food and variety of a la carte restaurants (other than the main restaurant offering food three times a day) of World cuisine such as Chinese, Italian and Steakouse are perfect.  Both food and drink (including alcohol) menus are quite satisfactory in comparison to other many famous all inclusive resorts.  Pools and sea side areas are spacious where you may also relax in a quite pool for adults which we found quite comforting.  If you are someone who likes to attend daily and mostly sport…

title: Wonderful 🌞
review: So glad we booked here at the last minute ... Weather was absolutely fabulous -VERY hot and sunny -glad of the air con and swimming pool to cool down in . Take plenty of sunscreen and mind your lips don't get burnt like mine have !  Hotel is very big but it has a great atmosphere . Rooms and surrounding areas are clean , immaculate and well maintained . The beds are so comfortable .The staff make every effort to make guests feel valued an welcome .  There is a lovely well kept beach and if you are lucky - you may be able to see the turtles which swim around the jetty . Pine trees around the hotel give welcome shade and are also tranquil to walk around  Lots of activities available such as aqua gym , free diving , daily pool game , darts Pilates and Zumba . There is a on site gym…

title: Excellent hotel, location, food and staff
review: Didn't have any great expectations as our previous holidays have been booked with five star or deluxe accommodation.  However, from the champagne check in on arrival every member of staff contributed to making our holiday a great one.  The hotel is set in stunning well kept gardens and small pine forest.  The rooms and all common areas are immaculately clean and there was space enough to chill out or get involved in the many activities on offer day and night.  This means it works for both couples and families. Snorkelling from the beach and seeing turtles from the jetty were unexpected bonuses.  This is one place I'd recommend you investigate what's on offer and book the activities on arrival.   Don't book private taxi transfers with Transfersdirect.net as you don't get what you…

title: 4 not 5 stars this time - but only because of our Al La Carte experience
review: 4th visit to this hotel. It is still very good and has improved slightly since our last visit- with the addition of a Patisserie- open 11 until 11. By enlarge this is still a very well managed hotel- food quality in the main buffet restaurant is excellent. Cant believe previous reviewers complained. Drink quality is generally very good- consistent quality a little hit and miss maybe during the peak evening period. Reception staff very professional and pleasant with it.  We were unable to get a table for 6 at the Italian or the Steak restaurant during our 1 week stay - sold out. We managed to secure a table at the Chinese restaurant for 6 people. Started off well- nice soup and side salad. Starter was very average. But the main course arrived stone cold - 3 out of the 6 meals-…

title: Excellent location, good hotel... Needs some improvements
review: Hotel location is perfect. Has two Jetty's going in to the sea with some fantastic sight seeing opportunities. Located in a small pine forest and only ten minutes by cab to the old town.  Overall the hotel has everything on offer, good food, relax pool, main pool, children's pool with slides and indoor pool within the wellness centre.  Entertainment team are great. However, the evening entertainment starts at 9:30 and usually ends within 90 minutes. Many of the guests (European) are rather stiff and do not engage with the acts which is a shame as some were brilliant.   Staff are generally attentive but some do need a nudge.   Reception team however let this hotel down. We wanted to extend our stay and was told the hotel was fully booked. However online there were over 40 rooms…

title: Amazing
review: Great hotel, clean, quiet, nice beds and the staff is extremely friendly. Also a great animation team (for kids and adults). It was fully booked when we were there, but it never felt crowded. I actually thought there were only about 500-600 persons there, turned out to be 1400. So great job! And then there's the food... is was amazing. I'm usually not a fan of big buffets, but this one was the best i've ever had. Every night a different theme, with different dishes, everything fresh and well seasoned.   Best resort i've been so far.

title: Fabulous
review: This hotel is great.  Beautiful grounds, good food, excellent staff, very clean.  Entertainment good, entertainment team very good and work very hard.  The grounds and pool are spotlessly clean with plenty of shade from umbrellas and trees.  Pool is great.  Reception was very good and on arrival we had a pleasant surprise to be told we were being upgraded because of over-booking to a beautiful villa and pool.  Apparently these are not in the Thomson brochure, but they should be.    The steak restaurant was very good, outside in the pool area, lovely food, watching the sun go down.  Didn't have time to book other restaurants as only there for a week.  The only downside to this holiday was that the beach is not very big and the water was cold!  So if you're looking for a purely…

title: Unbeatable perfect Hotel turquoise
review: If you want a short haul holiday that is excellent in every area and at a very reasonable price visit this hotel.Those of you who worry about going to turkey because its dirty or Muslem or for any other unfounded reason,visit this hotel and resort you will never want to go to any short haul destination again.i had been wondering how some hotels get the top 3 placing s on trip advisor as many are self catering.this year we went to an all inclusive hotel in Paphos Cyprus listed number 2 on this site.After one week in Cyprus we cut this holiday short and flew to Antalya from Cyprus and finished our Holiday off at turquoise.The hotel in Cyprus was a sham compared to Hotel Turquoise.My tip is thus that the best hotels all round are between 4 and 6 on Trip advisor.  I agree with all…

title: wonderful hotel
review: Lovely to read such glowing reviews and they are true. We stayed in the sea view deluxe room 1168 lovely views can be noisey late night but not enough to put you off.The staff are all extremely polite and do their best to please always smiling. The food was of a very good choice and standard well presented and tasty. Everyone works hard to ensure cleanliness is a priority. There are vast areas to sunbathe we preferred the beach but there is a lot of quiet areas.The outer gardens are well cared for and this gives the grounds a very nice viewing point.We have stayed at some 5star hotels in the past and this certainly is on parr with them.

title: Top holiday
review: Stayed at Turquoise Hotel and spa 6th june 14 for two weeks, The hotel staff were all very friendly from check in til the time we left, some didn,t speak much english but always acknowledged us with a smile. Our room 1201 was in the main hotel and very nicely furnished , comfy bed , lovely walk in shower , complimentary toiletries , good quality hairdryer,slippers and robes. Cleaned every day always spotless.Plenty of sunbeds around the pool , beach and garden area, didn,t reserve and always managed to get one  mainly on the beach which is where we like to be. Sandy beach with a shingle shoreline so water shoes are ideal especially for the kids. The beach was cleaned every day and the piers swept. Lovely big swimming pool very warm and the small aqua park was great fun. WE…

title: FANTASTIC HOLIDAY AT TURQUOISE RESORT SIDE
review: Five of us visited the hotel along with two close friends between the 20th june 14 and 28th june 14. The welcome at the hotel was great however the lack of thomson rep wasn't. We sat and waited for the friendly hotel staff to complete the check in and it was then we were told we were being upgraded to a villa with its own pool and restaurant and what a fantastic treat. Ali the manager was first class. Fantastic accommodation, friendly staff and where we were situated no screaming kids. Bearing in mind this is a family hotel you expect to see them everywhere but this was a gift. A big thanks to the manager. However there are quiet places to sit and there is an adult pool. The food was excellent. We have holidayed in Turkey for the last ten years and have visited some expensive…

title: Love love love!!
review: I stayed here from the 17th June until the 24th with my boyfriend. As a young couple this was our first holiday abroad together and we were a little apprehensive. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning and we're greeted by champagne and a little welcome meeting where we were told about the facilities on offer and everything we need to know.  We were shown our room which was located on the third floor in 1306. Our room was lovely and very spacious the room was clean and had a large toilet, shower, bed and a lovely balcony with a table and two chairs. The hotels all inclusive package was amazing and the bars and restaurants cater for everyone. I must recommend the steak house restaurant it is lovely over looking the pool and the food is outstanding. You get one visit to each…

title: great holiday
review: We arrived late at night on the 13th of june,long day but were quickly & well recieved at reception.Had a bite to eat also a couple of drinks.The next day our holiday began,and it was great all as we hoped.staff all really good also really friendly.Before i go on we had an encounter with a geordie who informed us that the food was awful room awful rep usless,beds around pool saved too early etc.Next day around 8 30 our mate had just put atowel on his 2 beds and sat there this idiot geordie promptly sat on the same bed threw my mates bag on the floor &just sat there strange.Think he was after comp.Food was fine had better but had worse.Felt the a la carte restaurants slightly disappointing the italian quite poor culminating with a boy riding around the restaurant on a scooter?…

title: Amazing 14 night stay!
review: I have never written a review before on trip advisor but this hotel certainly deserves one.    We arrived at 10.30 at night to a very warm welcome by the staff, champagne on arrival and a nice sit down talk regarding all the facilities the hotel has to offer and details regarding the restaurants,rooms, entertainment etc.    We stayed in a standard room in D block which was very lovely.  The block was overlooking the pine forest and was a lot larger than we had anticipated.  The bed was a large king size, the room had a balcony which was nice to sit out at night and the bathroom was a decent size with a walk in shower. Wardrobe size was ample even though we could have done with a couple more coat hangers. Very quiet also at night.   I had never stayed in an all inclusive hotel…

title: Thompson holiday
review: This is the second time we have travelled   with Thompson holidays to Turkey. The Turquoise is a lovely hotel, clean, efficient and friendly.  The staff go out their way to be as helpful as they can, sometimes their is a language barrier, but this is usually easily crossed, after all we are in their country and unless you are arrogant enough to think every one should speak perfect Queens English then you must expect Some misunderstandings. The food is excellent, I have a fussy husband who eats very little in the way of food from other cultures (he even struggles with English food unless it is fried, he doesn't do 'healthy') and he enjoys the selection here, I can safely say there is something for every one. The first night we were here we could not get the air con to work, this…

title: The perfect place to stay on the Turkish Riviera.
review: That was our third hotel in Turkey and our first time at Turquoise Hotel. Only one word: wouah!!!! We had been so disappointed before that we even doubted before going back to Turkey and chose that hotel after reading all the good reviews on Tripadvisor. The service is perfect, friendly and helpful staff. We had a good deluxe bedroom with sea view and just loved it. Everything was clean and neat. The food is delicious specially all the Turkish cuisine.  The only shameful thing is that we travelled with NECKERMANN BELGIUM. NO BUS PICKED US UP when we got back home... NEVER AGAIN WITH NECKERMANN BELGIUM. I'd like to congratulate and thank the night receptionists: Mr Ersin Guller and Mr Gurkan Gur who made all the phone calls for us (by the way, no one from NECKERMANN picked the…

title: Fantastic hotel and holiday!
review: I've been to many hotels in different countries, and this one is definitely the best! I travelled with my boyfriend and used Thomson, and the hotel completely exceeded our expectations on first impression and throughout the week we stayed.  When we first arrived at the hotel at around 10.30pm, the manager of the hotel welcomed us with a nice glass of champagne and gave us details about things around the hotel. This is certainly the first hotel I've been to where you have a little welcome meeting on your arrival from one of the hotel managers. It was great to get some information so we knew where to go for breakfast the next day and how to get pool towels etc.  The hotel is in a great location. You can walk to beautiful Side town from the hotel along the beach in about 45 mins,…

title: Everything catered for
review: We have been to the Turquoise 3 times, we found it by chance on the Internet, we loved it so much that we told 2 of our friends,they came with us the following year, this year they came with us again and brought their daughter and 3 grandchildren. This made it a different holiday for us as we got involved in things we wouldn't normally do if we hadn't had the grandchildren with us.  The animation team were fab the children loved them all ( so did we).  There is Arkan the lovely waiter in the outside snack bar, and the lovely Merva in the Sultan bar who works extremely hard keeping a smile for 8 hours is not easy, when u are busy.  We used the amphitheatre more this year. The food, staff, and cleanliness at this hotel is second to none, we highly recommend it.

title: Fab holiday
review: Everything about this hotel was excellent,staff were lovely and nothing was too much trouble,rooms were very clean and cleaned daily,food was good,pool area was nice with plenty of sun beds,hotel had it's own private beach, all in all a grt8 holiday, well worth a visit.

title: Even More Shocked
review: Thank you for your good comment!

title: Lovely hotel
review: Having stayed at the Turquoise 7 times, the most recent in May 2014, I don't usually do a review for every visit as I have said it all before. I do however feel it necessary to come to the defence of the hotel and the staff in view of a couple of recent reviews. I wholeheartedly agree with Ian N, the staff at this hotel are some of the friendliest people I have ever met, even when provoked by rude behaviour from guests they are at all times polite and professional. I have encountered probably hundreds of guests, both foreign and English who just demand a drink at the bar, no please or thank you. If I encountered such rudeness in my job I would, and I'm glad to say, am able to without losing my job, point out that I won't deal with people who are not prepared to treat me with…

title: Excellent holiday perfect place to stay
review: Thank you for your good comment!

title: No air conditiioning in rooms
review: I have read many good reviews on this hotel whilst we were there and they must have stayed in a different hotel.  I spoke with many UK guests whilst at the hotel and they said it was fantastic, then I pointed out the lack of air conditioning in the main building, the complete slop for food in the buffet restaurant, the lack of english speaking staff, the rudeness of staff and failure to get drinks and they all agreed that this is not the excellent hotel it claims to be. Check in was OK, staff did not have good english, but it went off OK, room was on third floor in main building, alittle hot when we arrived, but thought it was because the air conditioning was not on, we attempted to put it on, but did not work.  On contacting reception they stated it was only put on, when the…

title: great Hotel and staff
review: Dear guests,  Thank you very much for your comment. We will take all the mentioned points seriously to improve our performance.   Air conditioning in the main building is working 24 hours from 1st of June till 15th of October.  Before and after this period air conditioning in the main building is weather dependent.   Kind regards

title: Shocked
review: We had a great time here,  rooms are nice, food is great and plentiful, beach wonderful with two piers that are so breezy it's great to cool off on them.  swimming pools are fabulous, very clean. staff so friendly and happy, will do anything for you,  lovely lovely people.  loved it and can't wait to visit again.

title: Enjoyable Holiday
review: We are still on the last days of our holiday at this hotel (but as I am chilled and with time on my hands I decided to review it now). The reason my piece is titled shocked is that on reading reviews I see that some people describe the staff as unfriendly and I honestly do not know how shockingly bad mannered or rude you would need to be to provoke any of this staff to be unfriendly when ordering at the bar etc or being served I always use the words please and thank you (and maybe smile - you're on holiday) and I have NEVER had anything less than a smile back and "you're welcome". It is true some of the staff do not speak a lot of English but that doesn't detract from their hard work FOR YOU. We have spoken to a waiter who initially spoke to us in German when he realised we were…

title: Better than expected and would return
review: We've just returned from a week here and we thought the hotel was very good.  Couldn't really fault anything other than the weather, we had some bad thunderstorms, however there's nothing we can do to change the weather! The only point I would like to mention is that although the Hotel have a policy regarding the reserving of sunbeds before 9am, we found that most of the sunbeds were taken by this time, it seems that guests were putting there own towels on the beds, so the hotel would leave them. We struggled most days, even when it was cloudy to find four beds together with a parasol, this was very frustrating as we were down by the pool by 8.50am at the latest most days. We would return here however as we had a good time. Also I just want to say a big thank you to the…

title: amazing holiday
review: Our holiday could not have been any better all thanks to this amazing hotel.The grounds,rooms,staff and food were outstanding.Very friendly hotel,would DEFINATELY go back as lots of people we met there have done for several years.The pier is the best place to enjoy the beautiful weather.

title: Could of been better
review: Just got back from 2 weeks at this hotel. We went going on the excellent reviews. Thomson give this hotel Platinum status which it isn't. Have stayed in other Platinum hotels which deserve it, this doesn't. Staff are rude and very unhelpful. Rooms are okay but general areas need a refurb as look shabby and tired. The worst thing is food. If you have an allergy or are a veggie then you will have problems as very little choice. Everything either in a sauce or dry and unappetising. For two weeks we lived on fruit, bread, soup which was always piping hot and tasty and cheese. Show buffet not in restaurant but outside and food either cold or luke warm. On first arrival hotel looks fantastic but don't be falled by first impressions. Our first time to Turkey and we would go back as…

title: Turquoise Delight
review: Have just read some of the recent reviews I feel they must have been to another hotel!! This has to be one of the best hotels in terms of service, food quality and variety, friendliness of the staff, and the overall ambiance.  Some of the recent reviews are hard to comprehend in terms of their comments.  Yes there are better hotels nearby but at almost double the cost for only a slight increase in quality.  The food is well presented, varied and hot.  Each evening in the main restaurant has a different theme which adds to the variety and allows you to sample different cuisines. The rooms are well furbished, roomy and the beds very comfortable.  The grounds are immaculate and well-kept with any litter being removed almost immediately.  The animation team are excellent and the…

title: A lovely, relaxed holiday!
review: I wanted a holiday in the sun where me and my partner could relax for a week! This hotel was perfect! Great weather, great food (buffet and Alacarte). Rooms were really good and had all the facilities needed. Staff couldn't be more friendly or helpful! We had a very warm welcome when we arrived and were greeted with champagne! A lovely resort with a lovely beach - the resort is in a quiet location but is perfect if you don't really want to leave the hotel. We did take a walk to side town which was about 2 miles walk down the beach but didn't feel we needed to leave the hotel. If I had to chose a down it would be the spa staff could be  pushy and would keep trying to get you to have a massage! But I would highly recommend this hotel and will return! Thank you!

title: Good, but by no means the best
review: This hotel is located in what can only be described as idyllic surroundings; lush green forestation rolling down the relaxing lawns to an iconic Turkish beach. This is the hotels main selling point, which I suspect is now starting to slip somewhat with the onset of newer hotels around the corner.   The hotel is immaculately clean in nearly all areas, and it is clear the staff work hard to keep it that way.   The pools were excellent and we always found space to set up camp and take in the sun.   So that is the good, now to the not so good.   The staff - while there are some gems in the mix, overall the staff were not that friendly, and with a predominantly German clientèle not all speak good English. The animation team did an excellent job of being out and about, and there were…

title: Fab hotel (09/05/14 - 23/05/14) Lorraine H Leicestershire
review: Outward flight - Very good flight, on time and cabin crew very friendly Antalya Airport not great, had to wait around 40 minutes for luggage then when trying to find Thomson Rep this proved difficult and eventually found them sitting behind a desk at the front of the airport which was not labelled Thomson so caused a lot confusion. Transport to the hotel was also not great as we had a driver that could not speak English and as it was dark we could not recognise any of the hotels that he was pulling into.  Arrival at the hotel very good, first impressions very good indeed. Reception staff very efficient and explained everything in detail whilst we drank a glass of champagne. Bell boy very efficient when taking us to the room with our luggage.  Room very clean and comfortable (E…

title: Relaxing but not perfect
review: My thoughts on a week-long holiday (20 – 27 May 2014).    The welcome at the hotel was excellent.  Everyone who arrived (about 14 people altogether) were directed to a large table in the lobby and then asked to sit down.  We were presented with a glass of champagne – annoyingly thought my 13 year-old daughter was not offered a soft drink as an alternative.  The lobby was bright, airy and exceptionally clean.  After filling in basic paperwork, we were given our 2 electronic room keys, 2 pool-towel cards and an in-house credit card to purchase branded spirits (not included in the all-inclusive deal).  The bell boy escorted us to our room (D Block room 5117).  Again, exceptionally clean, well-appointed and a very comfortable bed.  I paid 2 Euro a day for the safety deposit box in…

title: Excellent
review: Marvellous hotel in all respects from reception to the hotel cats. Everything about the place oozes pleasure, relaxation and friendliness. Second time around and it just gets better, will be returning again.

title: Paradise in Turkey
review: I decided to surprise my wife for our 35th Wedding Anniversary by taking her to the caribbean, but after going into our local First Choice I came out booking the Turquoise Hotel Side Turkey, how did that happen, you may ask, but that is another story. We arrived on 6th May after a 4 hour flight and a hour drive to the hotel, when we arrived and saw the lobby we knew right away we had hit the jackpot. After a short briefing from the Hotel Management we were shown to our room, which was in the main block, opened the door and entered a well decorated clean room with a balcony.  Rooms : It had a shower & wc with good lighting, hair dryer and plenty of towels changed every day. Two sliding cupboards, a dressing table, 2 bed side tables, sofa, tv, drinks, fridge and a good size bed,…

title: First time experience at Turquoise Resort
review: Based upon reviews on Tripadvisor and Booking, my mother (60 years) and I (35 years) decided to spend 5 nights (6 days) at Turquoise Resort. We booked a standard room and I am under the impression that many reviews are written by people who stayed in the much more expensive villas. We were welcomed at the reception by a trainee. She worked there for 3 days. She was very nice and trying to inform us as good as possible but obviously she wasn't trained well enough for this yet.She wrongly informed us that the "pay card" which you received was meant to pay extras with such as wine. We asked where we could eat (we had been travelling for 10 hours and very hungry) and she just told us where the restaurant was (which was closed). So we checked in our room and went out to "look for…

title: just back
review: okay  just back and for the 2e time there and all whas stil a 10 i whas looking for bad things but can not find anything bad everything is clean no big mouth russian drunks eating for 100 people and don't eating there food.  all whas just perfect water sport is still expensive $$$ and the shop think they are in amsterdam $$ money street also expensive but for sure i will be back  Mij top obers Doruk, Under ,  Adem 4 , mustafa animation team always doing his best

title: Top class hotel
review: This is our second visit to this hotel and this visit was much better than previous the hotel has expanded from 9 years ago and the staff were very helpful. Very beautiful surroundings. Food was excellent especially a la carte Turkish.  Animation shows on the evening were professional and excellent and varied. Nice open air disco.

title: absolutely fantastic!
review: we loved it from day 1 to the end. Stayed there end of October 2013 and were very lucky with the weather: blue sky all week long. The hotel is just perfect, we loved having both pool and beach. Being walking distance by the beach of antique town Side was a real plus, we enjoyed visiting the ruins with our young children. Staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. We would simply go back to the same place!

title: excellent hotel
review: Really loved this hotel. Our room was fantastic! It was v clean, always tidy and spotless, lovely bathroom! Apart from the smell, for some reason it smelled of sewage all the time! Great bed and plenty of space, quite modern decor. Keep the doors closed though unless you love the sound of crickets they are in the tress, you dont really see them but you defiantly hear them. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The food was good, lots of choice and different styles each day. There was a lot of activity by the pool side which we enjoyed! Plenty of great shows on all week. Staff were friendly... Mostly. Some staff members were a bit miserable but on the whole they were nice. The beach was a bit of a let down as we expected sand not a shingle beach, but it was still clean and…

title: Super resort with great service
review: I enjoyed the last week of the season this year at this resort.  It's quite large, with plenty of entertainment options.  The food was a great as was the service.  The pools are far too cool, however.  Especially at the end of the October.   Fine rooms, good bars and plenty of options for soaking up the rays.

title: Perfect vacation
review: An excellent hotel with great service, the personel seems to love their job. We have now been to Turquoise 2 years in a row and already booked for a third time. Starting at the greeting when you arrive you get cool towels and champagne with a big smile. The rooms are always clean and fresh. Food is great, variations everyday in the buffe resturant and great food in the 5 theme resturants. The beach is a bit rocky but otherwise perfect, you never have to look too long for a sunchair. If you want a chair on the piers though you´ll have to be up early.  Turquoise is a perfect receipe for relaxation!

title: Nearly There!
review: Although this Hotel is rated 5* locally and 4*+ by Thompson,I would like to say it seemed to be more 4* than 5*. My personal feeling was that although the Hotel was very clean and all the staff were very pleasant it lacked something that I have not been able to pinpoint. It could be that it's size is too great to give it any feel of intimacy? This was the largest of the three All inc hotels I have stayed at this year, that aside it is a very comfortable and well run hotel but it maybe trying too hard. I personally would not return to this hotel only because   I like to have a whole new experience when I go away.  If you like larger Hotels then this one is worth a visit.

title: Very nice hotel, but the service touches perfection!
review: We visited this hotel with our family arriving late in the evening. Our son has food allergies and we were quite hungry arriving without diner. We mentioned to the chef that he could not eat everything so he was only eating some fries and meat. Nevertheless, our son still got something he cannot have, so he was ill the first night. Without telling, the next day, the chef came to us to ask how everything went last night. When we told him the story, everything was organised to be separated and fresh the whole week!! Every evening, the chef or his replacer went to the kitchen to organise the diner for our son personally and we had a lovely week with varied food, also for our son! The hotel is very nice, clean rooms, big pools, very good food but the best experience was the service.…

title: You will like it ....
review: We stayed in this resort for a week at the end of october, with one baby and two young kids. The whole family really enjoyed it. We often select resorts based on Tripadvisor comments and rating, looking at the ratio between excellent and mediocre feedbacks. This hotel was clearly recommended and we were not disappointed. The location is great, close to the city of Side were nice roman ruins could be visited. It takes 15 minutes by running along the beach to reach it. Otherwise 4km and  8 Euro by taxi. We walked several times with the kids there (50 minutes, along the beach, back with Taxi)  The hotel is very well managed.  Strong hotel management team seems to be in place with procedures in place very well followed by all personal. The food is diverse and good, lots of…

title: Good hotel, poor management
review: We were booked into this hotel from 10th-17th October this year. My husband and I, along with our 4 year old son and 7 month old girl were given a room on the ground floor not far from reception.  The room had a doublebed, sofabed and a travel cot. Although we were told it was a "deluxe room", we felt it was rather small. But the worst was to come: the very poor air conditioning. This was centrally controlled and in temperatures of 29 degrees average during our stay, was mostly kept switched off, or was fixed at a temperature that made no difference. My kids found it very hard to sleep in the heat. I spoke to different management personnel 3 times and was eventually told by Irena at reception very dismissively that I "cannot do anything about it".  How disappointing that a 5…

title: Brilliant
review: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days 5 nights and was there with work. I cant say more that it was amazing the service the food and the room were fantastic they also had an amazing conference room the drinks at the bar were very strong and they clean the rooms first thing in the morning but do it untl it shines.

title: Lovely relaxing holiday
review: This was our first visit to Turkey and we were not disappointed with either the area or the hotel.  The hotel was spotlessly clean and the room we had (to the side of the hotel but still with a sea view) was lovely.  The room had a good built in wardrobe, shelves and drawers, as I think it's nice to unpack. TV with some English language channels,  free minibar, tea and coffee making facilities.  The bathroom was good with a range of toiletries supplied, a nice shower to refresh with decent towels and robes.  The balcony had a nice amount of space, with two chairs and a table to enjoy a nice drink whilst watching the sunset.  The bed was excellent, firm but comfortable, nice duvet and pillows.  Importantly as we had our son with us the sofa bed was more like a single bed and also…

title: Really Good
review: Recomendable If you wants a relaxing holiday without any negative surprises I will recomend this hotel. It is not neccesary to leave the compound. They have everything on-site. The childrens-club was good, with different activities every day. The staff was exelent.

title: Great holiday
review: Stayed for 1 week mid October. Quick check in and a friendly welcome at reception. We had a sea view room on the first floor. Room was clean and reasonably well fitted out. A nice touch was a fridge that had beers/lemonade etc  all part of the all inclusive. The food was really good, a lot of choice with consistent good quality. The hotel grounds are kept in really good condition.. The entertainment on a couple of evenings was extremely good, in particular the youngsters from the Moscow state circus - they were brilliant. The hotel is in a good location, Side is about a 40 min walk along the beach or you can get there by bus. Directly outside the hotel main gate is a bus stop and a small taxi rank. One point to note is that some rooms overlooking the pool area experience noise…

title: Fantastic best ever
review: Arrived at turquoise to be greeted with champagne  1st lovely touch , staff were so helpful + polite couldn't do enough for you , entering the hotel room was just lovely clean , spacious  plus an added bonus fridge not only had water in but 2efes beers, 2of all , coke , fanta orange , lemonade + a few more 1st for us in turkey & we've been 6 times. Restaurant  food was lovely plenty of choice you wouldn't go Hungary , 24hr bar in main hotel , the a la carte restaurants were brilliant staff very friendly and helpfull plus food excellent , there's something for everybody to eat you can never go Hungary 24 hrs on the go if you want . Cocktails the best , bar staff no what they are doing , not forgetting evening entertainment was great can not fault it a lot of thought has gone into…

title: Enjoyable week apart from a couple of hitches.....
review: We came to stay at the Turquoise on Oct 8th for a week. On arrival we were surprised at how new and fresh it looked. We were told after our meeting where to go to our room, 1020. Very pleased to find out it was on the same level as reception. On going in it was another matter! It was kitted out for a disabled person. Anyway, we got over that and decided to go for a wander round. Was very impressed by how many bars there are around the complex, and also by the size of the pool etc. We went back to unpack, and unfortunately, the safe didn't work. Then my husband realised that when upon hanging up his clothes, they all fell off when he went to slide the doors shut. He got in touch with reception and then they said we could have another room. So off we go, just to the other side of…

title: Good location and settings
review: Just arrived back from a two week stay with friends at this lovely clean hotel.  The hotel is set in lovely surroundings and the cleanliness is top notch, the staff are cleaning all the time, the food is excellent and plenty of choice.  The a la carte restaurants are nothing to write home about, limited choice and small portions.  When we arrived we were given a two bed roomed villa only to be told that we will have to move the next day.  We asked if we could pay the extra and stay in the villas but were told by Valeria at reception rather abruptly 'Impossible' ( we knew the hotel wasn't full).  They took all morning and part of the afternoon to relocate us to rooms in the main hotel, we were then given a bottle of house wine and a plate of fruit for the trouble ( we could have…

title: best hotel Ever
review: Just got back from another fantastic holiday at the Turquoise. (Our fifth time).  We arrived at 11pm very tired, but the Reception we got was second to none, Selcuk, Sarah and Derya were on hand to help us, we were given warm towels and Champagne, and asked to sit down whilst everything else was taken care for us. We were given all of the information for our stay by Selcuk, with assurance if we needed anything else, we only had to ask, then Derya whisked our cases to our room. A massive thank you to reception, and all the staff, too many to mention.  The rooms are beautiful, the hotel has had a refit this year and I must say I was very impressed.  After a good nights sleep in a queen sized bed (so comfortable) we went down for breakfast, which was lovely, everything you need to…

title: What a Great Place
review: We stayed at this hotel for a week in September 2013 and had a great time. We booked relatively close to our departure date and because we wanted two separate rooms for our party we had to have what is called a Family Room. We were a little apprehensive but that turned out to be without foundation. Our room(s) was situated in a block about 100yards from the main building. The room was more than adequate but I have to say that I don't think the furniture in the room was of the quality I would expect from this standard of hotel. That said, that was my only complaint as everything else was truly great. The quality and range of food was excellent and this was supplemented by "theme nights" throughout the week where foods of different nationalities were cooked in front of you. We…

title: Our kind of hotel
review: We are tempted to write a bad review, if only to push people away from what we would like to keep as our little secret.  But the quality of this place means many other reviews will scupper that plan! We first stayed here in 2006, and returned in Sept 2013.  To be honest, little has changed.  There are more a la carte's (the Turkish one is not quite as intimate as before, having moved from the beach area to the gardens).  The lobby is more open plan and better.  Re-decoration has been done. And our room this year was only a few doors away from where we stayed the 1st time. The Turquoise meets our requirements perfectly.  Although busy, it is so vast, that one has no problem doing whatever the mood dictates.  We always use the 'Quiet pool', being a couple in their 50's, and not…

title: Fantastic Hotel, amazing food & drink.....But.....
review: Well what can I say, we stayed for a week and it was an amazing hotel. I have never seen a hotel so clean, not a bit of rubbish anywhere. The food was great and very diverse. There was plenty of alcohol, soft drinks, loads of different types of tea (I loved the apple tea so much I bought some), coffee, different fruit juices, loads.  The room was a standard one with TV, shower, couch, big bed and balcony it was very comfortable and the mini bar was stocked daily with soft drinks and beer. The room was also cleaned daily (they even folded my clothes which I dumped on the couch!!).  The bathroom was beautiful and had a great walk in shower which could easily fit two people.  The pools are lovely and big (but really cold), there were plenty of sun loungers but you have to be early…

title: The bright Side of the resort.
review: For me and my partner it was our first visit to the Hotel Turquiose and Side, Turkey and we were pleasantly surprised by the holiday that was recommended by our holiday agent.  The Hotel Turquoise itself was a good first experience of Turkey for us. Ranging from friendly staff to good quality food, it did not disappoint. However, the local hotel staff spoke limited English, but were very accommodating.  Food and drink is served 24 hours a day which for late and early arrivals can be a life saver! The selection of food is very good, from a la carte menu to full buffet range at breakfast, lunch and dinner. The best of the a la carte restaurants being the Turkish for us, which was a first for us to try real Turkish food.   The hotel grounds are massive and you cannot see the main…

title: Excellent Hotel, Staff and Setting.
review: My wife and I stayed for 10 nights AI through Thomson at the Turquoise, and can only support all the other excellent reviews of the hotel that persuaded us to go there in the first place. We had a third floor room in the main building, this was very comfortable and the bed was about the best "holiday bed" we've experienced. It must be a Super King size and we found sleeping very easy and restful. We had a balcony overlooking the driveway up to the hotel and the pine tree wood and gardens at the front of the hotel. This meant that we weren't disturbed in any way by the Terrace music that went on until about 11 o clock some nights as we were on the opposite side, the terrace being on the sea side of the hotel. The only possible issue we had was that the aircon was more noisy than…

title: One of the Best Yet!!
review: We travelled to the Turquoise on 17 September 2013 for 1 week, as a relaxing getaway for our wedding anniversary. This was our third visit to Turkey, visiting Fethiye and Belek previously.  The Transfer from the airport took ages, we were supposed to be first or second drop off as part of the platinum package, however we were last as the 6th drop off! Not a big deal, but not quite as sold by Thomson  We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom  room, which was quite impressive. The rooms are very modern, and had a kingsize bed with robes and slippers provided. The second room had twin beds (just in case we needed a huffy bed!)  The minibar was stocked each day with soft drinks and 2 beers. The hotel is well laid out, and everything is on hand. There were few English whilst we were there,…

title: Love this hotel!!
review: Stayed at the Turquoise 2 years ago and loved it, in the time since we were there it has been upgraded, the foyer looks so different, very posh!!  The entertainment team were not as good as 2 years ago, back then they were such good fun & were around the pool in the day doing little game's, now they are very young & only seemed to interact with the chosen few. The evening entertainment has improved, very entertaining!! Love the food, the grounds are beautiful, the staff, even down to the maids are very friendly, the only down point was the entertainment team but that certainly didn't spoil my holiday, can't wait to go back!!!

title: Great Hotel
review: Hi just returned from 10 nights at Turquoise Resort Hotel and Spa in Side. This is my 4th visit to this hotel, and once again it did not disappoint. The welcome and booking in is excellent, lovely greeting and nice glass of chilled wine and cold flannel awaits you. Booking in is quickly dealt with and Bell Boys take your cases to your room. As I had been here 3 times before I had an idea of where I wanted to be - upon arrival we had been given A Block, quite near to Reception but I wanted to be in rooms 1021, 1022 etc This was quickly sorted out and we were places in room 1023. The rooms have been recently refurbished, with new beds, new wooden flooring and new showers - flat screen TV on the wall. The rooms are really pleasant and there's tea/coffee facilities in the rooms…

title: Bit disappointed
review: Just got back from a weeks stay at this hotel , big complex, grounds are beautiful  staff work hard to keep it all neat and tidy, all exclusive was brill always a bar near by  restaurant and snack  bar was really good although got very repetative.We ate at the a la carte resturants and we werent blown away,the buffet is better it was just nice to pass a bit of time by having a sit down meal. Entertainment was very poor lasted 40 mins a night and after 10pm there was nothing going on, to say there such a big resort and lots of people to keep entertained was poor! Also the entertainment staff were far from entertaining they didn't even bother with us only 1spoke to my partner on the first day then ignored us after that , our room block was extremely noisy with kids screaming for…

title: Heavenly
review: Just back from a wonderful week at Turquoise Hotel Resort & Spa. I love travelling, and have stayed at many hotels. This one deserves top marks. Hotel: Situated about 3 km from Side old town in a lovely pine forest, and right on the beach. The grounds are so extensive, it is tempting to not leave the premises for the duration of the holidays. It is a large hotel, I believe about 1200 beds, so don’t expect intimate and family run. Tasteful, spotless and with a friendly and very professional staff is a better description of this hotel.  We arrived in the small hours. The bus was not allowed past the front gate because the noise might wake other guests – we were taken the rest of the way in a small golf buggy. In the comfortable reception area, we were given a glass of sparkling…

title: Fantastic holiday
review: Just returned from a fantastic holiday at the Turquoise hotel. Can not fault this hotel in any way, the food is beautiful, make the most of your chance to use the restaurants as they too are fab, loved the Italian as they made a special effort for my husband and I as it was our wedding anniversary.  The rooms are excellent with a free minibar filled daily, slippers and robes, towels and bedding changed daily if you wish. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is an excellent rule in place here, any towels placed on sunbeds before 9am are removed and the beds are tagged, this just allows everyone a chance to get sunbeds wherever they wish to sit. No need to take towels as there is a clean towel daily service available at the poolside. You must visit the old town of…

title: Great food
review: Just returned from a one week stay here. Having stayed at all inclusives before, we chose this hotel because of the good reviews, in particular in relation to the food - we think this makes or breaks an AI hotel.   The buffet is excellent, with a huge variety of foods - even for the fussiest of people. I think this is probably the best food we have had in an all inclusive. Lunch time snack bar was really delicious too, with buffet style Turkish Meatballs, bread, Chicken Doner, burgers, salad, jacket potatoes etc. Breakfast was pancakes, eggs, cooked, fruit, cereals, breads, juices, cakes, biscuits, pastries.   The rooms were clean and we upgraded to a Deluxe with Sea view. The air con was great and the beds huge and very comfy with a great view. They were spotlessly clean and…

title: Fabulous!!!
review: I have just returned from 2 weeks at this hotel with my husband. We booked the holiday to celebrate a BIG anniversary. What a wonderful experience it was! We were greeted on arrival with champagne and cool towels before being taken to our room. We had a standard room but the furnishings and facilites were very good. We especially appreciated having tea and coffee making facilities for our early morning cupp! The whole hotel was kept spotlessly clean with any spills in the restaurant and bar being dealt with immediately. Food was of good quality, plentiful and good choice. You can eat from 7am til midnight if you want to. All the staff were friendly and helpful and the waiters, waitresses, bar staff and entertainment staff worked very hard with long hours but always had a smile…

title: Perfect Holiday and Location
review: We have just returned from a perfect relaxing holiday, and this was helped by staying in the Turquoise Hotel. The ambiance and quality of the hotel shone through all the time, from the room (Sea View) to the staff, food and entertainment, and i must also include the Thomson rep Jack who was excellent on giving advice about the area.   Short and sweet, but this Hotel and its location delivers on all factors.

title: This was a perfect family getaway!
review: We are a family of 4 with 2 young boys. Turquiose really provided a wonderful, relaxing week.   The facilities for the kids were great ( the water slides could use some freshening up, but my boys never complained!) the staff was friendly and helpful. We loved the Chinese acrobats. Every night, my boys would run the football field until exhausted.  The food was amazing! We ate at the buffet every night but there was always an amazing selection. We never got tired of anything. Lunch was always just what the kids wanted.  The best part ( and worst) of our holiday was that on the first morning there my oldest woke with an awful ear infection. A quick visit to the resort doctor confirmed a severe infection. He really took the time to explain the problem to me and recommended visit to…

title: Excellent Experience
review: As one who doesnt venture out of the UK very often, this was a step for me to go somewhere like Turkey. This hotel was really a great experience and I hope this review will help you make up your mind! I was needing a holiday to relax and recharge, and I would say I was able to do that here.   We booked with Thomsons as a package deal to this resort from Glasgow, and would recommend this as absolute value for money and a great way to travel if you are unsure of finding your own way around a foreign country. Every detail for the traveling from airport transfers, to the check in was taken care of, and it was the best way to go - stress free and super well organised. The Travel Advisers at the hotel for Thomson's make sure you have a contact point during your stay and help to advise…

title: Great Family Experience ...
review: We had previously stayed at Cornelia Deluxe in Belek, and tried to rebook as an outstanding resort. However we couldnt find availability so opted for the Turquoise Resort. And we were glad we did. From start to finish the staff were exceptional. Really friendly and corteous. The main buffet restaurant was great, but particularly good were the italian, turkish, and poolside steakhouse. We also felt really safe with our 9 year old boy going to the slide pool with his new 'holiday mate' . In fact kids have a great time here. I dont have any criticisms as even the rooms and bathrooms were of a good standard. We may book again....

title: Fantastic Holiday
review: We have just returned from our stay at the Turquoise Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. The service, food, facilities and entertainment, in fact everything was of a very high standard. The staff, including restaurant, maids, gardeners, maintenance team were all very good and so polite all the time. The only negative point I would have towards any of the staff would be one of the receptionists who appeared to want to argue with her work colleagues in front of guests and she always looked so stern and could never raise a smile whilst the others always did. This is a very minor point though and perhaps she stood out as a misery because everyone else was so good. We would love to go back again next year.

title: Perfect despite two hiccups
review: A perfect 5 day getaway; loved the villa arrangement and never had the feeling we had landed in a mass market concrete complex. Gardens beautifully laid out, service was good and special mention to the staff at the villa bar and restaurant - they were fantastic with my 4 year old daughter. I can recommend this venue to single parents looking for tranquility yet with enough child entertainment to keep everyone happy.   Two quibbles though.  1. Kids Club For very young children ie: 4 years old - the staff seemed a bit stretched and I did not have the confidence to leave my daughter with them unattended. I think for slightly older kids the club works well. Everyone super friendly except for one staff member who truly looked like she wished she was anywhere else but there on the…

title: Absolutely Fabulous!!
review: I'll apologise first, as this is going to be a long review, but it was such a good holiday, I wanted to try and touch on all the little things.   I stayed here with my Mum in early July.  The first thing I'd mention is that she is disabled (though not a wheelchair user), and this place was pretty good in accommodating disabled people for the following reasons:  >Whilst the place was big, there were slopes and access ramps suitable for wheelchair users, or people who find it difficult on rough ground / steps.   >A wonderful touch, which I've never seen before was the 'disabled area' on the beach.
