Easy access loungers, with a little path over the sand.  This made for a great experience for my Mum, who otherwise wouldn't have been able to go on the beach or close to the sea,…

title: Service/cleanliness perfection!
review: Beautiful surroundings, excellent service, Clean!, decent food could definetly Spice more, great pool area with no que! Couldn't ask for much more! Great barber, superexpensive supermarket, many activities every day, Super shows every night, real drinks not just longdrinks! Good playground aswell!

title: Best Holiday Ever
review: This was our first time to holiday in Turkey. We stayed at the Turquise Resort Hotel & Spa. My wife & I went with our Daughter & Grandaughters aged 12 & 15. You could not fault the rooms which had everything in them that you could want. The Hotel was surrounded by pine trees & oliander bushes. The Al a carte resturants were fantastic especially the Steak House.We would recommend this Hotel to all our friends & family.We travelled at the begining of August 2013 though the weather was in the 90,s the two weeks we were there it did not spoil the holiday at all.We found ALL the staff very friendly & helpful. The spa was something special has it was my first one at aged 66.

title: Turquoise pools and heavenly meals
review: There is absolutely NOTHING that was not good at this resort.  It is really beautiful - the trees in the garden and the tranquillity from the forest around is just lovely.   It is close to Side although going into town is just such a let down and it is really overpriced....irritatingly touristy!  The food is magnificent and beach bar snacks and lunch is lovely.  My sister in law and I spent our days sipping mojitas on our sunbeds and the kids were well entertained.

title: Great Holiday
review: I visited the Turquoise hotel in August 2013 with my seven year old son. We had a great time, especially my son 'holiday of a lifetime' is how he refers to it. The food was good, location was fine, the hotel was clean, all staff we spoke to were helpful and friendly and the animation/entertainment team were great, my son loved it.  The reason I haven't given it full marks is because there are tiny details that could be improved, I have been to a couple of better hotels, but this hotel was still very good. There was food and drinks available 24/7, the choice of food was excellent (found only the fruit choice somewhat lacking in variety), drinks were good (my son especially liked the non-alcoholic cocktails) and he raved about the kids club.  There is a mini club 4-7 and a maxi…

title: 2nd stay here
review: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel, the 1st being last year. Last year our trip was with Thomas Cook, which was excellent , could not fault at all. This year (as Thomas Cook do not do this hotel now) we travelled with Thomson. We paid £1000 extra than we would have done with Thomas Cook. Based on last year.  The hotel once again was spotless, I was disappointed with the size of our room, very small, but saying that we stayed in a villa last year.  Food good choice. We found , that quite a few of the serving staff this year, just ignored the fact that you needed a drink at lunch etc, and walked pass your table to serve other guests. We waited 30 minutes one night for our 2nd drink, we had finished eating, by the time he came over. Very disappointing   Drinks excellent. We found…

title: Hotel turquoise side ( fab)
review: What a fantastic hotel , facilities , accommodation , everything was clean , food excellent ! We visited the hotel in July with our teenage daughter & friend , the rooms were spacious , the entertainment team were very friendly as we're the staff , would definitely go back !

title: Second Time in Turkey, First in Turquoise
review: It was a super holiday, nothing could be better. Great arrival with bubbles.. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, from family's to friends or couples. Great animation team (especially for the little children) Loves the cocktails.. loved the food.. loved the environment.. I loved Side, just wonderful for a little walk in the evening.

title: Just perfect !!!
review: This was our 3rd time at the Turquoise and was better than ever. Was very impressed with the new look rooms and reception. Staff helpful and polite as always. Rooms cleaned daily, tea and coffee making facilities have been added to rooms. Never a problem getting sun loungers but don't reserve them before 9am they will remove towels and tag your bed. Always plenty of choice in restaurants even for the fussy eater . Our favourite a la carte restaurants were the Chinese and steak(couldn't fault them) . Entertainment staff were all great, it was a new team for 2013 but Murat and his team did a fantastic job at keeping us entertained. Alona  who took the aqua gym is fun and always smiling, Burak does a fab job with darts and archery. Evening entertainment is also good with some…

title: Turquiose Hotel and Side
review: Our first trip toTurkey, we are a family of four including two teenagers.We arrived at the hotel at 2.30am in the morning,where we were greeted with a glass of champagne and tropical juice for the children.The hotel is spotless and can only give it high praise for the buildings and outside areas.Staff were friendly and helpful .It was also our first time booking platinum service with Thompson, and can only say again full of praise for their service.The food was great wherever you ate with a good amount of turkish food as well as the typical fayre for smaller children. Theme nights ensured all evenig meals were different and there are five a la carte bookable restaurants which provided a smaller more exclusive ambience with a lovely atmosphere.All inclusive cocktails were of a…

title: Very Very Nice Hotel
review: We booked this hotel based on previous Tripadvisor ratings and we weren't disappointed.  On arrival, as everyone else has said, some champagne and an ice cold face cloth we given to us, the staff checked us in very efficiently.  The hotel reception was really well air conditioned (although not early in the morning).  We were given keys to room 1228, which overlooked the indoor swimming pool and had a side sea view, the balcony was fairly private.  On entering the room we were very pleasantly surprised, it was very contemporary in design and very well presented.  The main buffet restaurant was similar to most AI we have previously visited, a bit of a rush with people rushing around to get their food.  The a la carte restaurants were nicely done, the steak restaurant was situated…

title: Brilliant holiday
review: Just returned from 10days at this hotel. Our first visit to Turkey and we loved it. We would struggle to criticise this hotel, but if we had to would say that although there were always plenty of sunbeds there was occasionally a lack of shade (and we certainly needed it with temps of 35 degrees plus) round the pool. However this is really splitting hairs as there are plenty of trees round the hotel and umbrellas free on the beach (although the shade they provided was only enough for one person).   Our one other slight moan was that the main restaurant the clearing service was a bit too efficient and on the whole your plate was taken from you the minute you had stopped eating. It's made it hard to have a leisurely meal. On one occasion we went to get dessert only to find that the…

title: Pure luxery, best holiday to date by far :)
review: Booked this as a last minute holiday based on its Tripadvisor rating and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is immaculate and the staff very helpful and friendly. On arrival we were sat down and given champagne while the desk staff checked us in and organised our welcome pack, keys for the room and safe etc then the porters took our cases to our room. The weather was hot this week sitting in the 40s each day but with various pools and areas to choose from such as the main entertainment pool where the excellent Turquoise entertainments team kept you informed on when activities would take place around the resort and even though some of the activities were at the pool you could choose to be involved or not as the pool is big enough. If you have kids there is a great area with kids…

title: Very comfortable hotel, food and drink is great, good for familes
review: Lovely hotel, stayed in main hotel in recently refurbished room, walk-in shower (no bath) Very comfortable bed. fridge with beer, water and soft drinks. Tea and coffee making facilities and free use of the safe. Free wi-fi throughout the hotel.  Food and drink available nearly all day on all inclusive basis, 5 very nice al a carte restaurants, The Italian is supposed to be best, but enjoyed the Turkish and Chinese more. There also a patisserie serving cakes, rolls and ice cream from 11:00 am each day. All very nice. The only thing they don't serve is a full English breakfast, no sausage or bacon, but it didn't bother us and we did well only to come away with an extra half a stone of excess baggage,  The evening entertainment use the usual hotel type acts and bands. All a bit…

title: Wow fantastic hotel we will be returning back
review: We were very impressed as the hotel was very welcoming on arrival cool glass of champagne and a cool towel.  We travelled with our 3 year old daughter and they brought her a melon cocktail and colouring book with pencils which made her feel special.  The rooms were very well equipped with a free safety deposit box and a free minibar.  The swimming pools provided free pool towels.  The main swimming pool was always the hive of activity but plenty of space.  The water slide pool was quieter but our 3 year old daughter loved it as did her father. We took part in the beach volleyball, aqua aerobics.  We spent time in the fitness room and the Spa.  We visited all the 5 a la carte restaurants and would definitely recommend the steak and the Turkish restaurant. The evening…

title: First time to Turkey and We will be back
review: I was a bit apprehensive travelling to Turkey as I heard it was one of those love/hate destinations....  On arrival at the hotel we were welcomed with a cool glass of champagne and a cold towel to help us adjust to the hot weather. We were checked in quick fast and professionally and our luggage was take to our room.  Room 1356 was beautiful,a two bedroom suite with full sea view. Rooms have recently been refurbished and look stunning. Beautiful king sized bed and very modern fixtures.Mini bar topped up daily. Beds were soooo comfy.  Rooms cleaned every day, to a high standard.   Food was great,I didnt now what to expect,yes you dont get Bacon etc but the breakfast was tasty . Lunch and evening meal were great too . There was a great choice and cooking stations also. Drinks were…

title: Fourth visit
review: We are here again for the fourth time.This has to be the best hotel we have ever stayed in (we've stayed in plenty) it's been refurbished since our last visit and its given it the total wow factor!!! The rooms are fab, the food is better than ever, it actually tastes like real food not the kind you would usually get from hotels,if your thinking of booking, you won't be disappointed if you chose to go,any questions please feel free to ask and I'll answer as honestly as I can

title: 3rd Time at the Turquoise Hotel Side
review: My Wife and I were surprised when we arrived to be dropped off outside of the Hotel at 3am, this is due to not the noise of the coaches dropping you off but the noise of the people arriving and chatting some people just complain for no reason.  We entered a totally new reception come seating area which was well laid out with very comfortable seating.  We then had fourteen great days and nights at this Wonderful Hotel meeting again many of the staff from our previous Holiday it was like coming Home.  I laid on a couple surprises for my wife with the help of the Guest Relations administrator everything was perfect in all aspects of the surprise brilliant.  Nothing is any trouble for any of the staff they will give you any help and assistance you may require during your stay at the…

title: Disappointed after renovation because hotel tries to save money on other facilities
review: We are here for the 7th time. The location and rooms of the hotel are wonderful but it's all kind of small things that have changed which leave us with a less satisfied feeling: - old fitness facilities - lots of broken beachbeds/poolbeds - long queues in the restaurants - buffet restaurant: often empty food container - personnel cleaning the floor during opening hours of the restaurant - personnel changing table clothes for next meals (f.e. During lunch for dinner) while guests haven't finished their meal.  I will leave detailed remarks on the evaluation form

title: Back a second time, and it didn't disappoint!!
review: Last year, 12 of us stayed at this hotel and the majority of us stayed in villas.  This year after a stressful few weeks, we decided to go away for a spontaneous break for a week, and decided to go back to the Turquoise having enjoyed it so much last year.  It didn't disappoint.  On arrival we were allocated one of the new delux rooms, which are all the rooms contained within the main hotel, these have been done up to a high standard.  We only have two small complaints........firstly the air conditioning.  Other reviewers have mentioned this.  It wasn't that it wasn't working well, when we enquired about this, we established that the aircon only comes on when the temperature hits 30 degrees or above, anything less than that it is is just a fan that blows in the room. …

title: A week in the sun!
review: Booked a villa room which was excellent. only, upon arriving there was no hot water in the shower. after complaining and talking to the holiday rep, the second day we got hot water. food and drinks were ok, but not of a 5star quality. we loved the quiet and peaceful begonville restaurant for breakfast & lunch. service was very good and staff overall very friendly. our room was great and the pool with beachbeds reserved for every room was great, too. 80 % of the people were Dutch due to the May-holidays in Holland, which made our holiday a lot noisier than we're used to.  we chose Turqoise because of the high ranking, higher than Voyage Belek where we stayed last year. but we prefer the really fantastisc 5star quality of Voyage Belek. although we enjoyed our week in the sun in…

title: The best hotel ever
review: We was upgrade into a villa,I could not believe the size of the place we was with our daughter we Had a room each, shared balcony between over looking our pool,the bar was by the pool, the bar man kept bring us drinks, and the food it's amazing,the beach was lovely, I can not rate this hotel enough, lots of activities, brill a la carte, it's all amazing, give this hotel ago.

title: Air con does not do the job
review: Looking at former reviews , the air conditioning does not work. It makes a noise. That's it !  Pity. Rest of hotel is fine. All staff , try their upmost to help. Reception staff are attractive but very little help. Hotel is full of Russians, but that isn't a problem. Lots of activities to do all day long A la carte restaurants are a bit of a let down

title: Continuously improving their service
review: Every day we could experience that employees of this resort are continuously looking for improvements to give better service to their guests. Beautiful nature, good quality food and service and a nice beach for a perfect holiday.

title: tech service lost a star
review: Beautiful garden - very noisy too many hours both pools and beach - fantastic staff expect techical service aircon down - floor floded and the "standard" answer was "A/C will be exchanged to morrow morning" and tomorrow morning came with a new floded floor.

title: Fantastic holiday but lots of Russians
review: Staff here work very long hours but are always friendly and smiling, they love children here. The grounds of this hotel are gorgeous and you woulkd benefit from staying in the grounds apartments and not main hotel as this proved too loud for us with a little one so we asked to be moved and loved the apartment in the grounds area. Rooms are basic but adequate and you don't really want to be in the room with the hotel as fantastic as this one. Great pools, one with slides and one large one with daily activities and an adult only lounge pool. The food was amazing couodn't fault it, we ate outside every night and the waiters were constantly on hand to top up our drinks. The waiters at the bar were so friendly and for a bag of daily haribos we seemed to get VIP service. The only…

title: fabulous holiday, fabulous hotel
review: Stayed here in September 2012, all inclusive with 2 other friends, 1 male 1 female. This hotel was fantastic, the grounds are stunning, very clean, beautiful lush gardens. Food did get a bit samey by the end of the week but still very nice and beautifully presented. Ate at the Turkish al a carte on our last night.....lovely food. Waiters very polite. Our room was at the back of the complex so a couple of minutes walk from the main bars etc but no real problem...they are refurbishing the rooms this year....all of the staff very friendly although being english you are very much in the minority.....good daily programme of activities such as aqua aerobics, darts and pool games....nice walk to side along the beach, took approx 30 mins but its lovely in the warmth of late afternoon.…

title: Good Hotel
review: The title says it all! Great food and plenty of it, great drink and great people. Not much around the hotel itself but then when it is this good, why would you want to move? We did take a walk into Side (takes about half an hour along the beach,) but wasn't that impressed. Food and drink in Side, on the whole, expensive and the shopping was far too expensive, with prices on average double that in Marmaris. If you don't enjoy this hotel you need your bumps felt!

title: quality hotel
review: My 3 children and i ages 13,18,21 stayed at this hotel and because they didn't have 2 rooms together we where given a villa room. What can i say it had 3 rooms and 2 bathrooms, a private  pool with our own numbered sun beds. The food was plentiful and of a high standard ,where we where was a bar which did the most amazing cocktails real ones not the made up ones that some resorts have. The staff were very attentive nothing to much trouble , The best part was that you couldn't put your towels on the sunbeds around the main pool until 9a.m if you did housekeeping would go round picking them up and put them in the towel hut,all hotels should do this.The beach was a narrow strip of sand but always clean, there was 2 jetty's with sunbeds and ladders were u could swim in the sea.…

title: Good Hotel but cut backs.
review: The hotel staff work very hard to give a good service. They work 12 hours a day and work 2 peoples jobs. there have been cut backs in this hotel over the years and noticed more this year (2012).  I have been coming here for quite a few years and enjoyed  the hotel and always booked through Thomson and yes  have gone in the busy time the last week of July and first week of August.  This year the slide pool area was not maned by a life guard and there was a few accidents and too many older children abusing the slides.  No one came round during the day to empty the bins which were over flowing with rubbish by the pool. And there was a nice barman at the slide pool bar (NOT) who attacked, and I mean attacked a few kids cause they split a drink.  We got him removed. It was the same…

title: Really impressed with hotel!!!, defiantly going back!!!!
review: Me and my partners first time visit to this hotel, in early july 2012 which any later it would be a bit too full (germans), food selection + restaurants was excellent even for a fussy eater!, staff were really friendly and helpful, rooms were nice i do belive there getting an update this year which it was in need of, would defintley recommend for familys or couples and will be going back in the near future.

title: A very not so special Honeymoon!!!
review: We travelled to this hotel in October for our Honeymoon, not wanting to leave our 11 & 6 year old girls my parents came along so that we could enjoy our honeymoon without missing the children. Well where do I start???   We arrived on my birthday at around 4.30pm greeted with a glass of bubbly wonderful!!! The room wasn't ready & we were told it would be an hour or so, we explained we were on our honeymoon as we did when booking but no offer was made to upgrade us which we wouldn't have expected although we have found out that quite a few couples had been upgraded to villas free of charge for no particular reason. On requesting something special in the restaurant I was told it was too late & was unable to book, eventually I just gave up & accepted our stay as a family holiday…

title: Fab hotel!
review: We traveled here in October 2011, sorry its taken so long to do this review! I'll just do some quick bullet points.  The room - Lovely, clean, spacious. We had a family room which consisted of a double room, and a separate twin room for the kids.   Food - lots of choice. A few strange things for our Scottish taste buds but we tried lots and enjoyed most. Kids never struggles for so etching to eat. The crepes were a big hit at the pool bar as we're the ice-creams! Afternoon tea was really good too. We ate far too much over the two weeks!  Pool - really nice but absolutely freezing! We didn't have the best weather. 4 very rainy days, 2 overcast/cool days and 8 nice sunny days in 2 weeks so this maybe had something todo with it but kids didn't even want to go I to the water. I…

title: Amazing Hotel! :)
review: My boyfriend and I went to hotel turquoise last august from 30th to 7th september. Golf buggy picked us up at the entrance and drove us to the hotel reception, glass of champagne and cold flannel was handed to us and staff took our suitcases to our room. Room ok, could do with updating but I know the hotel is getting updated this year.   Food was fantastic you had everything to choose from at breakfast to fresh crepes, pasteries, omlettes, fruit, boiled eggs, cereal, fruit juice, tea, coffee etc. No full english breakfast but that didn't seem to be a problem. Lunch was great plenty to choose from salads, jacket potatoes, spaghetti, pizza etc. Dinner was fantastic waiters served drinks, lots of food to choose from steaks, chicken, vegetables, curry, stir fry, sea food etc. We…

title: A very good hotel and complex, the gardens are beautiful.
review: I have been meaning to wirte this review since our holiday last August. Thought how accurate missblowfuse's review was. I can't really disagree with any of the good reviews but have a couple of additional comments to add. We went as a large family group and when we arrived the reception staff were excellent and offered us various accommodation options.  My wife and I decided to go for a room in the main building with a balcony and sea view all be it a side view it was fine. The best full sea views appear to be reserved for everyone who pays more except the Brits! Our room was good, everything was spotlessly clean, carpets had seen some ware but that's to be expected. The rest of our family decided to take 3 villas together with a massive private pool that is only shared by the…

title: Refurbishment
review: I would like to start by stating that my husband and I and other family members have been to this hotel for the past 9 years and have enjoyed every stay, however I feel I must point out that over the years we have seen many changes we started to notice small things at first that were being cut back firstly we noticed that the cleaning staff around the adult pool cleaned every sunbed with hot soapy water every day and the pot urns we emptied every day this year we never saw them cleaned once and the urns were emptied occasionally,secondly the tea and cakes at 5pm use to be a big event served to you in the outside snack bar with a mass of choice ,it's now barely non existent you can grab a biscuit and coffee if you choose, cut backs? This  Year we also noticed that the buffet was…

title: Best ever
review: best hotel in the area! Super fun! I was working there in the animation team - and I know all the THINGS from inside! All is great and you have a little money for 5* hotel - you better go there! Family type hotel, if you young and need party - then better to choose some other hotel!

title: Excellent family holiday and great weather mid October!
review: Would like to let everyone know how great this hotel is, the staff are extremely friendly, food is fantastic and so fresh. The hotel and grounds are extremely well maintained and such a big, beautiful hotel. There was a great variety of food something different everyday and caters for everyone. I went on the holiday with my husband, baby son, my mum dad and sister and we all thoroughly enjoyed the holiday from start to finish. The animation team were great and made us laugh a lot.  We had a Turkish bath and massage at the hotel spa costing £35 each-this I well worth doing on our first day if you can as makes you get a really good tan :)  Everyone was so friendly, we will most definitely be back to this hotel, I can't recommend it enough :)

title: It's a hotel I would happily return too
review: Great hotel, do not often want to return to a hotel as I like to go to new places. But I would go back tomorrow.  Stayed in a villa with private pool, given upon request when we checked in.   Lots to do and plenty of choice in the restaurants

title: Best of the Best
review: What a wonderful place. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The choice of food was excellent and there are 4 restaurants to visit in addition to the everyday eating places. The animation team go out of their way to ensure a good time is had by all ages. Particular thanks to Nika. No shortage of sunbeds. Very clean as staff are constantly working all hours to ensure there is no rubbish about. 2013 upgrade to rooms in main hotel looks great.

title: FANTASTIC,BEST HOLIDAY EVER
review: The Turquoise Hotel is the best hotel I have ever stayed in,been going to Turkey for 13 years and have been all round the other resorts but by far the Turquoise in Side is the best.From the animation team to the restaurant staff to the cleaners all were fantastic.They are so friendly and genuine and can't do enough for you.Brilliant entertainment for 2 weeks

title: Very restful holiday
review: We have just got back from Side the hotel is excellent, food very good lot's of variety. The gardens,pool area's, and sunbathing area's are really good plenty of places to get out of the sun. The entertainment was varied, some really good, the Karaoke was painful but a good laugh and the guests all had a good laugh when it was on. The rooms we stayed in were very clean, but in need of updating this is actually going to be done by next season. For an all inclusive I was very impressed and the mini bar in the room was always stocked up with water and soft drinks, I was surprised we didn't have to pay for that, also water was always available 24/7 at no extra charge. we will certainly recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family. The pick up to and from the Airports were…

title: Fantastic holiday
review: Best holiday so far, went late Sept and lovely hot weather.  Peaceful location and a short ride to town of Side. Beautiful well maintained gardens. First class service. Excellent food and number of restaurants to pick from. Great entertainment. Bedrooms are spacious and comfortable. Plenty of water sports to chose from, and great trips available locally.

title: Turkish Delight !
review: Stayed at the turquoise last year in awful weather in conditions and with a very good deal from Bournemouth Airport  (highly recomend this airport )decided to return in the first week of September and this time it was blue sky all the way ! The hotel has a lovely ambience and plenty of space and sunbeds. There is no need to be up at the crack of dawn reserving your spot ! The hotel is very cosmopolitan with all nationalities, dutch, german,, swiss,, norwegian , russian and they catered for all nationalities.It was not biased towards one nationality in particular, The hotel is spotless and the staff are very hardworking and friendly and genuinely go out of their way to help you. Customer service like this is non existent in many hotels in the UK.IThe food is first class and…

title: Good but not great.
review: We stayed here from 14th aug fr 2 weeks.  Good bits. The food was really good, always something for everyone and you can get snacks anytime day or night, the drinks were not overly watered down like some all inc hotels, the grounds and pool areas are absolutely stunning, well kept and staff are forever cleaning walk ways or trimming the gardens, sunbeds, we went at peak time and never had a  problem. The animation team always had something happening day or night and covered all ages.  Bad point, firstly our room 144, looked straight onto a giant concrete dome that you could reach out and touch, best to request avoidance of rooms 122-150.  The building looks fab but looking a little closer  its in a bad state (refurb due for 2013 we are told) cracks in walls and ceilings, floor…

title: 2nd time again Briliiant
review: Our second time at this hotel with a party of 12. Ages ranged from 28 to 62 and we all had a brilliant time. Breakfasts are not brilliant catering mainly for Germans but the rest of the food is excellent and I defy anyone not to be able to find something to eat.  The room was cleaned daily and spotless.  All of us were able to get sunbeds at any time we just had to move them together. Animation team were exceptional and the shows were reasonable.  In all a great holiday which we will remember with great fondness.  ******WARNING******  The duty free shop on return. They price everything in Euros and charge in Turkish Lira using an exchange rate of 2.41 so a bottle of Gin marked up at 13 Euros costs 31.33 Lira converted back at exchange rate of 2 (you can get 1.80 in most places)…

title: just fabulous
review: got back from this hotel 31st of august had a fabulous time got an upgrade to a villa room with large pool that was just for the 12 or so surrounding villas sunbeds that could only be used by the said villas dont think i would have enjoyed staying in the hotel though we were spoilt we had a superb view and a fabulous waiter who came up to our pool loads bringing drinks whenever you requested the waterpark was great for the kids but really hard to get a sunbed but it didnt matter to us we had our own the staff all around the hotel were excellent and really welcoming throughout our stay the entertainment was really poor on an evening never gor fired up till 10 if you like that sort of thing didnt bother us as we found ourselves in the lounge bar as kids liked to go on internet and…

title: 3rd time at Hotel Turquoise
review: This was myself and my wifes 3rd time here and this time we brought our 2 youngest kids (15 & 2) and the mother in-law with us. As this is our 2nd review of the Hotel I wont go over old ground but add a few things that I noticed this time as a family. It was nice to turn up at check in and be remembered from last year and this was not the 1st time this happened on our stay. Loads of old faces we recognised and also a few new employers but all happy and willing to help and have a chat. Food was good as usual nothing to blow your socks off but good when you have fussy kids. This year myself and my son tried the jetski`s and they were fab would deffo use them again. The only downsides I noticed this year was bits of glass left lying aound and not been noticed when cleaning in some…

title: Pretty much perfect.......
review: A large group of us stayed at the hotel between the 16th and 30th August.  Firstly, let me start by saying that all the reviews about the welcome and general service etc is spot on and generally faultless, the glass of bubbly and cold towel on arrival was much appreciated and a great touch.  The majority of us were upgraded to Villa Rooms with our own villa pool and sunbeds which pretty much made our holiday.  The food was great and did not feel at all repetitive and the cocktails were better quality than most hotels 'all inclusive' cocktails.  The grounds were stunning and well looked after, and there were banana, orange and olive trees etc to see.    Al La Carte Restaurants - I have been going to Turkey on and off for a long time, and I always remember that this is a Turkish…

title: Fantastic hotel, fantastic holiday!
review: Our first holiday in Turkey and we travelled with two teenage sons. The hotel was unable to give us two rooms close to each other so we were upgraded to adjoining poolside rooms. Beautiful rooms,overlooking lovely pool and gardens. We were very impressed.  We could not fault this hotel. Food choices at each meal were extensive. The choice of pools from quiet to busy, and wide choice of seating areas and bars. You were spoiled for choice. My only criticism was the lack of availability of late check out rooms. There were none and we didnt leave the hotel until 9 p.m. There were however showers to use in the indoor pool area and towels provided. All in all a winner!

title: just go
review: after reading all of the reviews prior to our holiday about this hotel can i just say please just go its really perfect,from the start to the end and the final wave from the bell boys we loved it food drink rooms pool sea beach slides the lot JUST GO and find out for-yourselves..:))))))

title: Just as good as last year
review: Went back to the Turquoise on 10th July,and we wern't dissapointed.took more of the family with us 10 in total.the rooms,food,wheather were all fantastic.most reps were new this year but they all work so hard.A few new shows, and the beerfest was brill.i  have never been to a place where the staff are so friendly.would deff go back again soon.

title: One of the best!!!
review: Just returned from a 2 week break at the Turquoise. The first think that strikes you are the grounds of the hotel which are immaculatety clean and set amongst a lush forest of greenery. Next was our check in; which was very efficent.We were given a glass of cold bubbly and an ice cold fannel, which was superb after a long night travelling.We upgraded to a double room, which was situated in the gardens(approx 5 mins walk from hotel). room was comfortable and spacious, air con worked well, minibar topped up daily with water and pop. Only downside was it was a tad noisy and everything seemed to echo inside. The food is the best we have ever had on a all inclusive From fresh pizza, jacket spuds and burgers at the beach bar, to king prawns, smoked salmon,and tai curry at the main…

title: Great family holiday
review: This was our first trip to Turkey and we would thoroughly recommend this hotel.  Four of us (two adults and two teenagers) had a brilliant holiday.  We had two rooms in an annexe to the main building and the rooms were very spacious and had very effective air conditioning that needed to be on all the time as it was so hot.   We spent most of our time lying on the sunbeds by the pool, in the shade of a palm tree.  No need to rush to get a sunbed as there's a rule you can't reserve beds before 9am.  The entertainment team were fantastic and encouraged everyone to join in. (Without being too pushy or agressive).  We all had a go at archery, the Olympic sports day, silly pool games and aquarobics!  The evening shows were very good too, especially the Michael Jackson show. One…

title: Brilliant hotel, the best staff, the best holiday.
review: We returned from the Turquoise on 20th Aug after staying for 2 weeks. We were a party of 8 varying in ages between 13 and 66 and had requested 3 double rooms as close together as possible in the hotel. After an awful journey from Manchester airport (there was a power cut for 2 hours just as we were checking in, but thats another story!) and travelling with Thomas Cook on a Lithuanian ? aircraft after lengthy delays. We were met, on our arrival, with glasses of champagne for the adults and fruit cocktails for the children with chilled flannels and wonderful, happy staff.  We were shown to our rooms and the hotel had very kindly given us three lovely rooms next to each other in block A, adjoining the main hotel. It was my Mother's Birthday the day after arrival and a lovely bunch…

title: Fantastic!! yet again
review: this is the 5th time me and my partner have stayed here, this time we went with 2 other couples, which was their first time,an absolute perfect week was had by all, it was my birthday while i was there, and when we checked in we were upgraded to the private villa FREE OF CHARGE, (only problem was mam and dad were travelling on a seperate booking,and as the villa slept 4 , they were not included) however the hotel made sure they were close by in one of the apartments, and were allowed to visit us and use the private pool we had.  we are not fussy people, but do like a bit of luxury and attentiveness,and you certainly get this from the staff at the Turquoise,and it is great to go back and be remembered,  the hotel is always spotless,food is fabulous,entertainment is second to…

title: Wonderful hotel & staff - Would highly recommend
review: We stayed here for 12 nights in October 2012 and the hotel was just wonderful! The food is out of this world and the a la carte menu's are worth booking in for. The hotel is out of the way, but it is a short and very cheap bus ride into town which is lovely to have a walk about (And also try and traditional kebab - Cheap and SO tasty!) and have a cup of coffee in the sunshine. There are some beautiful ruins at the end of the street which are a must see also. We went on 2 trips booked through the thompson holiday rep. The turkish spa which is a must! And the day trip to see the hostorical sights of Antayla. Again a very good and inofrmative trip that was worth the money. The pools are well kept as is the small beach and the decking area. It's a wonderful hotel if you like great…

title: 'What a fab hotel'
review: This hotel was the best hotel we have stayed in. Extremely well run, very clean, food excellent, even for the most finicky of eaters, there is a lot of choice and something for everyone.  Good entertainment.  Nice personal touches, with a champagne and a cold flannel at reception, bowl of fruit in room etc.  The service with the waiters was good very friendly, and the cleaners were very friendly and cleaned the room every day.  Did no know we had our eleven year old son as he just played on the slides in the pool and helped himself to the bar and the kids buffet they put on by the pool.  I can agree with some of the previous comments from other guests that there were a lot of Germans, but the there was no problems with beds as there were plenty and never had a problem trying to…

title: WOW! What a holiday!
review: My wife and I have just got back home after nine days at the Turquoise Hotel, 20th July til 29th July, our first holiday in Turkey. We have had many all inclusive holidays in Mexico, Cuba. Dominica, Greece, Spain, Italy, Malta, Cyprus, etc, so can speak from real experience.  The Turquoise Hotel stands up to any of our previous A/I holidays and deserves its 5* rating.   Apart from the large main swimming pool, there is a slightly smaller one complete with slides and flumes and at least four other pools and an indoor pool. The pool water temperature was 29 to 32 deg C, the sea temperature was 29 deg C and the air temperature was steady at between 32 and 35 deg C. The sea was great but there are rocks as other commentators have said. These can be avoided if you look around. The…

title: A few tips
review: I won't repeat other people - the hotel is good. We stayed there in August 2011, but the things I'm writing about are unlikely to change soon)  This is one of the greenest hotels in Turkey with a great territory, trees and flowers.  The sea is clean but there are many rocks in the water if you swim from the shore and you can easily hurt yourself. Be carefull.  Some buildings and especially "villas" are far from the sea and from everything else.   The staff tend to be tired by the end of the season)

title: Wonderful hotel
review: Stayed at the Turquoise for 11 nights from 5th July 2012, what a cracking hotel. We stayed in the Royal wings in Lara last Easter and thought no other hotel would be as good but the Turquoise matched it all the way. Arrived at the hotel about 2.30 in the afternoon, filled in the appropriate forms then told to have a seat in the lobby. A girl from reception came over and told us all the useful information about the hotel.10 mins later got key to our room which was in the main building,rooms are lovely,double bed and single bed for our 16 year old son,flat screen tv, plenty of storage and mini bar which is filled daily with 2 waters,2 cokes a fanta and lemonade. You also have a safe which is 2 euros a day. You get 2 rooms cards and towel card and a card which you charge things to…

title: An honest review of EVERYTHING
review: I went with my boyfriend for 2 weeks from the 22nd June until the 6th July.   The weather when we first arrived wasn't so fabulous, rain and storms the first evening and day but it did help us into the weather. Definitely one of the hottest places i've visited, even compared to when i went to the Caribbean! So prepare for about 35-45c of heat and its very humid! So humid one night our hair was actually wet from it. Never the less the sun shone every day except for our first day.  Food is brilliant. Best all inclusive i've stayed at. There is something different every night and it is cooked to perfection, no chance of any kind of food related issues at all. And its there 24/7.  Staff in the restaurant are very good (except for one or two who forgot your drinks order each time)…

title: recent trip to side turkey
review: what a fantastic hotel this is there is something for everyone we asked for adjoining rooms and as they didnt have them they upgraded us to villa with pool at no extra cost. the food is excellent there are so many things even fussy eaters will find something cant wait to go back.

title: The best holiday and hotel I have ever been too would most defenatley return and this was my 2nd time there
review: I had been to the hotel before and wanted to take my husband to a Place with variety and turquoise has this from just sitting by pool or join in pool games and activities around the hotel  I has the best entertainment team who work really hard day and night they do shows plAy games, joke around come talk to u making u feel part of a holiday family my husband thoroughly enjoyed and would like to go back

title: went 2010 / 2011
review: Amazing hotel  Beautiful surroundings lovely and clean  staff are so friendly treat you like royality  rooms nice and clean and airy staff 1000% trust worthy grounds so well maintained and big enough to find your own little spot to relax in  plenty of sun beds  Restaurants food was lovely lots to choose from, themed nights  24hr bar no restrictions bottled water always nice and cold at all the bars  a la carte restaurants  on our second visit there was a complimentary friut basket and try of fancies in the room with a thankyou note in them for being a return visitor nice personal touch I thought Free wi-fi in the lobby area  Free beach towels  On our second visit are room was further away from the main part of the hotel so because I have a sore knee that moved us into the main…

title: maybe not as good as first time
review: the hotel it self is very clean,the waiters didnt seem as attentive as last year & the food was nearly the same every night .there's alot of russians about side and they arent very pleasant at all

title: So good, we went again
review: The Turquoise has a charm of class for a hotel. It is spacious, clean and functional to whatever your needs. If you want a quiet holiday, the lobby bar is for you, but if you wish to let your hair down then there is a couple of bars to choose from, and a disco.  The food is nice and staff are helpful. There is free wi-fi in the lobby and drinks whenever you need them.  The a la carte restaurants are faultless and worth visiting at least once. The grounds are well kept and spotless. If you wish to be adventurous, there are taxis outside the grounds which will take you anywhere.  The Turquoise will never leave you wanting (there is even weighing scales to weigh your cases!).  I could not endorse this hotel enough and look forward to going for a third time in the not too distant…

title: excellent
review: This was our first visit to the Turquiose Hotel and we were pleasantly surprised .The hotel its self is spotlessly clean the food very varied and plentyful and the staff were the nicest I think I have ever encountered in a hotel. Nothing was too much trouble they were all very cheerful and really made us feel very welcome The only draw back was the postion it was a bit out of the way and not close to any amenities.But there are  taxis outside the drive and buses are very frequent. if you want a relaxing holiday this is the place to go

title: 3rd visit
review: We spent two weeks at this hotel from the 14th - 28th May. This was our third visit in 20 months and this was as good if not better than the first two visits. Where do I start, I emailed the customer relations team before going and asked if it was possible to have the same room we had last September.On arrival we found this had been arranged much to my delight.The room was overlooking the gardens,forest and the front entrance of the hotel the reason being the view was beautiful(even in the rain) and as the balcony got very little sunshine it was always a cool and peaceful place to relax late afternoon after a day in the sun whether it be after a day at the beach or out sightseeing or shopping.My husband always took the opportunity to sit out with a beer while waiting for me to…

title: fantastic
review: We stayed here as a family in June 2011. We stayed in one of the outer buildings away from the main hotel, Rooms were clean and basic, slightly on the small side for 3 of us. The food was fantastic with plenty of choice. We ate at the italian and chinese and both were outstanding. Drinks were good though we often had to ask for double measures as you could not taste the alcohol in single measures. Entertainment was of a good standard and all the staff worked very hard. My 7 year old did try the kids club but found it more catering for the foreing children. There were many different nationalities at this hotel but mainly russian. Most were ok but some were very rude and thought nothing of pushing in front of you in queues, we just tapped them and put them right! This is the only…

title: Best all inclusive I've ever stayed at
review: Just returned from a fantastic two week family holiday at this excellent hotel and we're already looking at booking again for next year.  The entertainment from the animation team was great at all levels. Not too pushy at the daytime / poolside, but putting on a broad variety of evening entertainment. Loads for the kids to do, whatever their age.  The hotel grounds are immaculate, and the sunbathing areas have ample room for all guests, as well as beach and access to two piers.  The food is varied and extremely well presented and cooked. Primarily Turkish but with themes on different evenings. Only visited two of the four a la carte restaurants, but make sure you visit the Turkish one - it's exceptional. The food was, by some margin, the best I've had at an all-inclusive.   We…

title: The best for family.
review: Advantages: Decent hotel for a comfortable family holiday. Can be recommended for families. The area is big, green (forest, flowers), well-groomed. The food is very varied and tasty. Service is beyond praise, warning, benevolent, cultural.   Disadvantages:  Entertainment is not enough good ones.

title: Third Time at the Turquoise - still excellent
review: We had a week at the Turquoise as a couple in early May which was our third visit and we had already booked for a family holiday in August. I have reviewed the hotel after each visit on the Holiday Check site but following the recent reviews on Trip Advisor would like to add my twopenn'orth.  We have stayed at 3 other excellent hotels in the Side area over the last 6 years but the Turquoise has the edge which is why we have returned over and again. The difference is really the genuine friendliness of all the staff from the chefs to the bar staff, most remember returning guests and welcome you like friends. The Animation team are outstanding, they work so hard and give this hotel a real edge, they cater for all ages and have something going on that everyone can join in. If you…

title: Wonderful Family Resort
review: I realise that Trip Advisor is  such a helpful site when thinking about booking a holiday. I do however wonder if people have stayed in the same hotel as I have when reading the reviews!! We have just returned (after a dreaded night flight) from Hotel Turquoise where we had a simply fantastic 2 week family holiday. We were located in the side annex - between the main hotel and the garden villas. Because there were 9 of us in total in 3 rooms (2 families), we had requested adjoining rooms. Unfortunately, when we arrived we found ourselves spread over 2 floors, rooms apart. The next morning we went to reception who were very helpful and we were moved with no fuss. The grounds of the Turquoise were beautiful and very well tended. As usual for Turkey, there were quite a few cats -…

title: Great hotel, bad location
review: Having stayed in other places in Turkey we thought this resort would be pretty much the same but its not.  We decided on this hotel for our honeymoon as it is a Thompson Platinum and Thomas Cook style. They are right. We arrived at 10:30pm with champagne on ice waiting for you. Obviously at this time there were no restaurants open but they took sandwiches to our rooms and told us the main restaurant was open for midnight soup at midnight. Our room was lovely - at the side of hotel - but could still see the sea. Food was out of this world, even the fussiest eaters could have eaten every night. There was hot food, salad, continental food, and puddings in the main restaurant, plus there were stations outside cooking something different on each one. The food wasn't repeated at all.…

title: inclusive turkey
review: having been to the turquoise hotel and spa side in may 2012 what a disapointment the room was dull needed redecoration not been done for some time the laundry was terrible old and thin the bath and shower  was old and terrible to get in and out of. the room was on the side and we could see them cooking the food the smell was terrible.also the food was cold and the service could have been better. not a platinum hotel we are use to  would not return to this hotel again.it took us 10 hours from Birmingham to get to hotel what a let down.

title: Overall a good holiday
review: Just returned from 2 weeks at the Turquoise.   We travelled as a party of 4 adults and 2 children  the hotel is fantastic for children the entertainment team work really hard to ensure they have a fun holiday.    Food  - was of a high quality, although gets very repetitive but always found something to eat.  The Italian a la carte was superb, by far the best food and service.  The service in the main restaurant was hit or miss, during lunch you were very lucky if you were offered a drink, which let the hotel down for us. We believe that the hotel should take a look at the a la carte restaurants as a whole as the service for these were very poor with the exception of the Italian. When dining in these types of restaurants you wouldn't expect to have to ask for a drink continually…

title: 2nd visit to this hotel
review: This was our 2nd visit to this hotel, last came 4 years ago and was not disappointed, the food is still excellant and the service of the waiters very good. We were upgraded when we arrived to a villa and we had our own pool that we shared with a few other villas, we had our own individual sunbeds(the sun beds had the room numbers on them) and parrasol, and a bar were you could obtain drinks during the day. We also visited the other pools and the waterslides as were have 2 teenage kids.The cleaner cleaned our rooms every day and towels were changed every day. The rep advised that taxis were expensive to side and would cost about 30 turkish lira, we went into side every evening and had a taxi from outside the hotel to side and this costs either 8 euro or 20 turkish lira each way.…

title: Second Visit To Turquoise Was Just As Good As The First!
review: Having spent two fantastic weeks at the Turquoise in September 2010, we went again May 12-26 2012 and although it can be a mistake to return somewhere you rated highly the first time, we weren't let down! In fact, it was better because there were four of us and we got our rooms upgraded to a 2 bed/2 bath villa with private pool (one pool to 12 villas) and reserved sunbeds at no extra cost! All the staff were as lovely and helpful as ever, and the food still fantastic.  A great value holiday.

title: Just amazing!!!
review: Dont really have a lot to say to be honest as I cannot possibly describe how exceptional this place is... You must see for yourself!!! It is just amazing and we can't wait to go back!!! I went with my mum and dad, I'm in my twenties, it was out of this world, we had a villa with a pool and it can only be desrcibed as out of this world, thank you for a wonderful stay :)

title: Disappointing start-pros but some cons
review: On arrival room allocated must have been one of the worst in the hotel. In a small corner back of hotel it was dark,claustrophobic with peeling wallpaper and overgrown greenery on the balcony very oppressive. Called Thomson line who phoned reception when we got to reception arguing over phone with rep. Had to pay a lot for an upgrade to a sea view room- better but very noisy on a night with entertainment until small hours not ideal with small child. Moved again with reps help-but still noisy. Wanted to get on with holiday so put up with it. Reception not helpful.   Pros- food excellent- lots of choice, plentiful very good standard and variety. Pool excellent- very good size childrens pool and another pool area with slides . No hassle getting a sunbed. Extensive, well kept…

title: Fantastic holiday
review: Myself, my husband, and our 9 year old daughter stayed here in May for 10 nights.  Lovely hotel with great facilities for kids - daughter loved the slides, pool and evenng entertainment.  Nice quiet pool too for the adults, good gym and tennis courts.  We found all the restaurants and service to be excellent.  Very nice sandy beach by the hotel where we saw turtles swimming.  Not too far to walk into Side or if you don't fancy the walk along the beach it's easy and cheap to catch the dolmus outside the hotel.  Overall a brilliant holiday and we would definitely recommend this hotel and resort.

title: Full of Germans - English are treated as the minority!
review: After spending a week at this hotel in 2010 we decided to go again in September 2011 for two weeks - myself, husband and 2 year old daughter.  When we arrived at 5am - we found there was a cot in the room when we had specifically asked for a bed for our daughter - it took two hours for a bed to be brought - and by 7am we were extremely tired!  Upon arrival at our room - we had booked a family room as this was what we had booked the year before - only to find that the rooms names had changed and last year the room we had was a villa and not a family room.  Apparantly, villas are now not available to english guests only German - and so were misled into thinking this was what we had booked again.    We were in G Block and overlooked a small restaurant and bar - unfortunately we…

title: A great hotel
review: 12 mature ladies stayed here for a week at the end of October and we can't fault it.  We have done AI in several rsorts in Turkey at the same time of year and this was easily the best.

title: Good All Inclusive for families
review: Myself and my husband spent 11 nights at the Turquise from 7th October, and yes we had 5 days of the most horrendous torrential rain and winds, but that is out of anyone's hands.  We booked with Thomsons as we always do and when we arrived at about 11.30pm, we were greeted with a glass of bubbly, and asked to sit in the bar, whilst the night receptionist explained all the details of the resort. We were a bit disappointed to be shown to a room in the main hotel, overlooking a service road, when I had asked to upgrade (and was willing to pay) as it was my husbands 60th birthday. The reason we were given was that there was no other rooms available - which was acceptable to us, unitl I heard some German guests being upgraded the next day at NO COST!.  The room was perfectly…

title: Second visit-can't wait to return!
review: This is our second visit to the Turquoise. We went on a friend's recommendation last year and we were not disappointed. We arrived in the afternoon to be met with a lovely glass of chilled wine, our luggage had been taken care of quicker than we could get off the coach and check in was brought to us-no standing around at reception. Again our room was in the main building but I was delighted to find it looked out over the gardens and forest. What a setting! This was a great start to our holiday and it only got better. Our room maid was a gem. She always knew when we were at breakfast or had gone out for the day before she came to change the linen and clean the room which was always left immaculate and the mini bar was replenished daily with beer,water,cola etc.,  Last year if you…

title: all inclusive hits the spot
review: We stayed between 7th and 14th october on a girlie holiday . We upgraded to a family room on arrival as all their standard rooms have double beds and a couch - not ideal for 3 middle aged women ! We were allocated a garden room which in my opinion is a nicer option than the main hotel block, The gardens are really pretty and well maintained and the complex is spacious and whilst the hotel was almost full with 1200 guests it never felt overcrowded, The food was exceptional and with a different theme in the restaurant every night , you never ate the same meal twice, We didnt try the a la cartes but had mixed reviews from other guests. The cocktail menu was superb as were all the choices of drinks - even had baileys to go with the after dinner coffee ! All the waiters were lovely…

title: Very good hotel, but I do not fully agree with all previous reviews
review: I will split my review in 2 pieces. 1st I will review the Turquoise hotel. The 2nd part will be a comparison of the Turquoise hotel with the Amara Wing in Kemer. (please see my other reviews for the one from last year)  1st Part of my review:  We were a group of 6: 4 adults, 1 child (5y) and 1 baby (1y) and stayed from the 3rd of Oct until the 17th of Oct 2011. Besides a few days of rain and thunderstorms we had a very good stay. Our kids enjoyed the Miniclub a lot. They did fun things like, T-shirt painting, dancing, … We had our rooms in the E block room 6035, a bit away from the hotel. Nice and quiet. Except from our upstairs neighbors from time to time. The hotel had a high number of Germans and Dutch people.   We went out the hotel a few times by ‘taksi’. 8€ to Side and 10€…

title: Amazing
review: This hotel is amazing best hotel we have ever been to, we had already looked at the reviews and we got alot more than we expected.  The welcome was amazing and we felt like royalty. The food was extremley impressive with different themes every night, the a la carte restaurants were goregous especially the Italian and Chinese which were our favourites.  The etertainment team were great and the shows at night were brilliant with different show every night even though we were there 14 nights. Daily entertainment was also great even when it wasnt the best of weather they found some way to make you smile and laugh. All the staff were fantastic, would do anything for you and were fantastic. We would recommend this hotel to anybody and would definatley be coming back at some point in…

title: SIMPLY THE BEST
review: 8 of us stayed in the Turquoise. We had 4 rooms in Block E. The rooms were all spotless and well looked after during our weeks stay.  The pools and beaches were very good, no problems getting a sunbed. Some shale under the water on some of the beach , beach shoes handy.  Food, everything first class.    Drinks first class, nice to get waiter service at meal times.  Hotel Staff,   from arrival to departure all staff were extremely polite and friendly,  If you do go outside the Hotel take Euros for spending money.  At last a hotel you can call ' Simply the best '

title: Fantastic time, again!
review: We went to Hotel Turquoise in Side for our honeymoon between 12th and 19th september this year because we had stayed here in 2006 and said if we ever got married we would come back for our honeymoon and we wasnt disappointed. Having spent many a holiday in Turkey and this area before we knew what we was getting and you couldnt really ask for more. This time around we noticed a few nice changes, more and more staff seem to speak and understand more english instead of the usual german and russian which made the stay easier because we did have a couple of problems (not hotel related). Last time we stayed we stayed in the main hotel block but this time we had a room in the F block a short walk towards the back of the complex and we was glad, it was a lovely room very quiet. The food…

title: GREAT HOLIDAY
review: Firstly I must say that Thomas Cook is about the worst Airline in the world even Ryanair has more legroom. Emergency exits between seats is about 18 inches wide. Find another way of getting to a wonderful hotel. Now the Hotel, we arrived at around 5 in the morning, greeted with a glass of Champagne and no waiting at the check in desk, it came to us. Luggage taken to room where in the fridge was a sandwich and refreshments. Absolutely first class particularly after that flight.  The room was exceptionally spacious and clean. Didn't think it needed updating, beds very comfortable with linen and towels changed daily. The room maid, although didn't speak English, was great. (we were in Turkey why should they speak English). We were in block G which was a couple of minutes away from…

title: Brilliant holiday
review: Visited this hotel for the third time in 3 years.  Rooms do need some updating but they are very clean and spacious. The hotel is kept spotless and the garden areas are well maintained. Te food is absolutely fantastic and if anyone can't find a range of food to enjoy then they are truly fussy eaters.  Visited the Chinese and Italian A La Carte restaurants, service was very good, choice is limited but the menu is shown outside beforehand so that you are aware of what you will be eating, quality is excellent. There are a range of activities for all age groups and no pressure to join in anything if you don't want to. The majority of the staff in the hotel are very polite and friendly, just the odd one that appeared a bit miserable. Outside the hotel it is very easy to catch the…

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: This hotel was amazing; the food, staff and rooms were excellent.  Our rooms were suites; there are four themed restaurants as well as the buffet (the chinese was great); it really was the whole package; 11 of us went.  The animation team were really good (Murka being one of them); they tried to get people involved with activities without pressure and their nightly shows (dancing etc.) were well worth sitting through.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to singles or families; it was a truly lovely holiday.

title: Amazing hotel. Spotless and first class service
review: After reading the reviews of this hotel, it did not seem like we would need to worry about what we were going to. And this proved 100% correct. This hotel would take a lot of beating by any standards. We travelled as 2 couples and had requested rooms next to each other. On arrival at 2.30 am, we were greeted by cold champagne, and given a full rundown by the hotel staff member on the hotel. We were informed that we had been upgraded to a villa as no rooms available together.But this did not suit once we were shown the villa, as it was basically 1 big double room and a similar size living area with 2 single sofas to use as beds. We got this changed to 2 double rooms a few hours later. But i would advise if a couple or family with 2 children were offered this free upgrade, to grab…

title: Enjoyable
review: Went to the turquoise on the 26th August for 11 nights as 4 couples 2 of which went here last year, on arrival we were greeted with a drink and cold towel then after a short chat with a member of staff were shown to our rooms, although they were clean and comfortable i was a little disappointed as our room was very dark and the balcony had too much overgrown greenery growing around it. The air con was very good but to be honest i think there are certain little things in the rooms that could do with a a bit of an upgrade for instance the shower fell off the wall when you tried to adjust it and kept running hot & cold, the little dish with the complimentary toiletries in was chipped and as the week went on the towels were almost thread bare, also i was very surprised that there…

title: hotel was what it said on the can
review: this was our first visit to the hotel turquoise an it wont be our last it was out standing in all departments from entertainment food outstanding spotlessly clean friendly and our age group were 50 plus however all age ranges were catered for .

title: FANTASTIC RESORT! WILL DEFINITELY RETURN!
review: Where to start??? What a fantastic holiday. Myself and my husband, together with my parents, visited the Turquoise between 19th August and 2nd September. We were made to feel welcome immediately being greeted with a glass of sparkly wine and a cold towel. We were then told all about the hotel and its surroundings by a lovely member of the reception team before being shown to our 2 bedroomed poolside villa. We arrived late at night and sandwiches were left in our room. our villa room was gorgeous  and included a large living room area and 2 double bedrooms (one with en suite) and a separate shower room. They were cleaned to a very high standard every day with fresh linen and towels provided. The air conditioning is perfect (and free). and after having sat in the burning sun all…

title: WOULD 100% GO BACK
review: the hotel was fab slides were amazing so was the pool  service was amazing the staff made you feel welcome, the restaurants were amazing the Italian was ok the Chinese was fantastic the fish was really disappointing the main restaurant was good too. WOULD 100% GO BACK.

title: loved it from coral and family
review: we stayed at the Turquoise hotel in august. The hotel was great there was a great choice of food. Barberque night was amazing.All the staff are friendley and work very hard. We especially liked the animation team Henry and his brother who kept everyone of all ages entertained.

title: Mind blowing !!!!
review: As with other reviews, this is going down a very similar track. I am trying to fill a hole or two left out by others. Should you be unable to book the a la carte restuarants, too busy or whatever, I would not lose sleep over it. You get a free visit to each one, 4 in all, but I would say that the chinese is the only one you would not experience in the main restuarant anyway. Main dining is fantastic, we ate as a family of 4 and could have not duplicated meals in 11 night stay had we wished. Some dishes though I could not pass up the chance again. Check the food being offered outside of the main serving area before you grab the tempting stuff inside !! I haven't seen too many talking about the sea turtles so here goes. Off the longer of the 2 piers run a rope with floats. With…

title: Amazing hotel - far exceeded our expectations
review: Fantastic. Great experience - I would recommend this hotel to anyone, young or old. I am worried this review won't do the hotel justice - I really can't speak highly enough about the place and its attentive staff. I have travelled widely and stayed in all kinds of accommodation but this place will take some beating!  My husband, teenage daughter and I have just returned from 10 days at the Turquoise and we all have nothing but praise for the hotel and the staff.  From the cool towels and champagne on arrival, to the attentive staff, excellent kids activities, excellent tasty food, spotless rooms and well-kept grounds, this hotel has something for everyone.   Set on its own beach with plenty of sun loungers for everyone, the hotel also has 2 jetties on the beach where you can…

title: Amazing Hotel
review: We stayed at the the Turquoise for 10 nights from 8th - 19th August and it was fantastic although very hot. We found the best place to sunbathe was on the jetty as you get a nice breeze. This place is massive and  room for everyone, in the mornings we went down to get a bed at about 8.45 and at that time all the beds are still available as you cant reserve until after 9 your towels will be removed! The staff really are so friendly and will do everything they can to help you, if you do have any problems make sure you see the guest relations lady she is so helpful.We were in the main hotel and not the villas but the rooms were still very nice, air con was great a big relief after being outside all day in 40 degrees.The hotel is spotless they are always cleaning towels and sheets…

title: AMAZING HOTEL
review: Went to this hotel july/aug 2011,myself ,hubby,two boys 15 & 12,mum & sister.so pleased we chose this hotel,it has every thing you want from a holiday.the rooms are great,food,pools,beach everything was great.we went to the italian alacarte resturant & it was lovely,nice to be waited on to.it was very hot 40/50dec.side town is 5/10 mins in taxi or bus,lots of the usual shops & resturants,booking trips there is much cheaper than hotel.Entertainment,well the reps dont stop all day & night.Shows were good in the ampitheatre,then music & dancing till 12pm,then disco till 2am,& if you want more the reception bar 24/7.Cant wait to come back next year probably with more of the family in tow.FANTASTIC.

title: nice holiday
review: Arrival & reception was very good with a sit down face to face intro to hotel & how it all runs. Cases sorted of the coach before I could turn around & this standard of service continued thro out the holiday. Entertainment was good if you could stand the multi-lingual explanations every few mins but team were very professional and so many of them!  The food in the main restaruant was good - varied & plentyfull but we found the speciality restaruants a disapointment mainly as a result of language difficulties & the very limited choices. The main pool was large & safe for children and never a prob getting sun beds, a strict reservation policy was in place & this helped. Pool/beach side drinks were easy to obtain although the staff were not very well trained in coctails, the bar in…

title: Extremely well run hotel with friendly and attentive staff.
review: From the moment we arrived we were greeted like VIPs, it was so nice to receive a moist flannel after the 45min- 1hour transfer.  The staff gave us an introduction about the hotel and its facilities.  Throughout our holiday the staff remained helpful and very attentive.  The hotel was in a lovely spot and only a short 15min bus ride from Side town which is well worth a visit.  The ruins at Side are best visited in the evening(sunset), but be prepared for countless dinner propositions from Restaurant staff touting for business.  The only slight down sides regarding this hotel is that as AI, the Ice Creams are only available from 1200-1400 daily(the same as most other Turkish Hotels) and we would have liked a guideline on which types of meals the various restaurants served such as…

title: Brilliant holiday! 1 week was not long enough!
review: Just got back from an amazing holiday!  Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff and wonderful food..the diet starts now!   I would say this hotel is brilliant for couples and families with children of all ages.  There are plenty of activities for the children throughout the day and there is a special covered playarea and eating place for them.  The teenagers also have a club of their own and activities organised for them.  The entertainment team were brilliant and work so hard.  There are activities for adults including step aerobics, water gym, water polo, archery, volleyball, extreme bocha, football, yoga etc all day and if you are willing to join in and have a laugh you will have a great time and make lots of friends.  If you do not want to join in you don't have to and it is easy…

title: 2nd time for us :-)
review: After such a lovely holiday last year we decided to return and we were not disappointed.  We met many people from last year who had returned.   This time we stayed in Block A rather than the main hotel - which was lovely for us as we had 2 large rooms and a balcony overlooking the garden.   We enjoyed this holiday just as much as before.  The staff are very friendly, helpful and the hotel itself has everything you need - beach, swimming pool, slides, food, drink.  Our boys loved the water slides and they made so many friends.   We met some lovely people and would definitely like to return again next year.   Thank you Turquoise Hotel - miss you already.

title: very good but not 5 star
review: fantastic holiday stayed 11 nights and loved it. im not a person to moan about everything but read reviews and to be honest think few people get carried away with romance of holidays,this is a fantastic place and loads to do if you got kids its a must ,The majority of staff are very happy and polite but the barman who works in bar in the reception is the most miserable person i have ever met and sure anyone who been there agrees with this.hotel really clean and looked after but we stayed in room 2126 which is not in the hotel but like a annex and really only at best 3 star urgent need of updating and was like block of flats and asked to be moved and offered pay upgrade but with no joy.The italian was the  best i ever had but was spoilt by the top waiter having a go and abusive…

title: A paradise for familyholiday
review: Arrival: Like a real luxuryhotel you recieve a cold towel and a glass of cava.  Rooms: There are rooms in the mainbuilding, bungalows in the garden and poolvilla's. We booked a familyroom with 2 bedrooms. We had a room in the bungalow in the garden wich was very large, clean and comfortable. But there is no door between the room of the parents and the corridor. Because we let the light on in the bathroom ( so that the kids (6 and 8) would find there way at night to go to the toilet) we had a lot of light in our bedroom. In the mainbuilding are doors at the room of the parents.  Restaurants: The mainrestaurant has a huge terrace. The biggest I ever saw in a hotel. So, you can go for dinner whenever you want (between 19.00-21.30) and always have a nice table outside. Food is…

title: good but some dissapointments
review: service rooms food ok beach pool fine but why advertise some international drinks when none are available on all inclusive  deals we are aware costs must be cut in this financial climate but please be able to back up your sales pitch with promises kept

title: FANTASTIC HOTEL - WE HAD A TRULY FABULOUS HOLIDAY
review: We booked this holiday as our parents spent 2 weeks there last year and thoroughly recommended it..... even although I was not too pleased when my wife booked a trip to Turkey over Mexico for my birthday this hotel did not disappoint in any way.  Pre arrival we emailed the hotel to request an a-la carte booking for our 5th wedding anniversary which was met positively by the hotel who booked us a lovely meal in the Italian.  The personal touch was continued on our anniversary day with flowers delivered to room and a beautiful table set and welcome at the restaurant.  The hotel is about 70 mins from the airport and as we arrived in the middle of the night we were dropped off at the maiin road and ferried to the reception on a buggy, where we were greeted with a champagne and cold…

title: suitable for families
review: It is a 5 stars hotel, near sea, in a pine forest. Most of the staff was very polite and could speak both english end german. Rooms are always clean but some times it smells bad. We could not understand its reason. There are 3 pools. One is big, and two others are smaller. One of the small ones, is reserved just for the use of villas. Sea is clean but weavy and rocky.  its difficult to swim for beginners. In the high season, hotel is very crowded. All inclusive system restaurant is  turkish and international buffet. There are four a la carte restaurants which are highly demanded. If you have chance, you can try one or two of them in a week.

title: definately go again
review: Love this hotel been twice already. Stayed all inclusive.  The hotel is lovely and clean, nice staff,  good food beach location.  The gardens are  very tropical  looking. Could not find fault with this hotel. Would  recommend it to anyone.

title: The very best place.
review: Very nice and beatiful hotel. Good place for famyli whis children. Good rooms and good staff.

title: Amazing, We will struggle to beat this one!
review: We arrived on the 8th July 2011 at about 23.00 hours, we were greeted with a glass of champagne and cold flannel, the check in was nice, they sit down and explain everything, and then the porter takes you to your room.  Because we missed tea they put sandwiches in your room, but they did have food still in the restaurant until midnight.  The bar in the reception area is 24/7 and there is also free wifi.  The rooms are nice and spacious we stayed in the main hotel which is over 3 floors and there are lifts. The bed was comfortable plenty wardrobe space, flat screen TV with loads channels including news, music and two film channels. There is a safe in the room which was 2 euro’s a day. There was a bath with shower over which was ok and hot. There is a mini bar with pepsi, fanta…

title: Best hotel I've ever stayed in!!
review: This hotel is absolutely amazing! As you come in off the main road, driving down the drive-way the gardens are incredibly well kept. When checking in the staff are excellent and will give you a free welcome cocktail. The rooms are spacious and clean, the food is fantastic with a great selection and the evening entertainment is great.  Just one tip, we booked a boat trip with an excursion shop outside the hotel, the day of the trip the failed to pick us up and when we went to complain and get our money they denied knowing us!! We then booked a boat trip with the Thomas Cook rep and it was a great day out with no problems. Lesson learned for us, always book through the rep with a reputable company such as Thomas Cook!!

title: Great hotel
