review: stayed here in June, great hotel, first time at an all inclusive hotel. I can't say enough about the wonderful staff, they look after you so well nothing a problem, hotel grounds are well looked after, wish I had booked a villla more expensive but well worth it. food good if you like all inclusive, I've decided I don't but nothing to do with the hotel itself, well recomended

title: 3rd visit and still a great hotel!
review: just returned from an 11 night stay at the Turquoise Hotel, Side. This hotel is not for everyone but suits us down to the ground. Friendly staff, great service, great food and drinks. Staff seem extremely happy to be working there which illustrates that it is a well managed efficiently run operation. Food is so good that i managed not to eat on single chip in the whole 11 nights ( something of a mirical for me)  The Hotel grounds are immaculate and it is set within Sorgun woods -- beautiful sorroundings - this sets the scene for a real chill out holiday.  There is a nightly disco- cant comment as did not visit. think however that the hotel is best suited to couples and families rather than singles groups. Entertainment - well we dont really play an active part during the day but…

title: Great time was had by all!!!!
review: To be totally honest im not going to write too much this time around as all you need to do is look at the best comments on here and you have the truth about this hotel. It is a great place although not the very best i have been too but up there in a close 2nd or 3rd but number 1 for the price. It has got the best and most polite staff of any hotel that i have ever been too. So if you like your hols this is a great place to go, with a great surrounding area if you do  not want to stay at the hotel.  Andy

title: loved it ,but to expensive to come back
review: hi everyone we stopped here from 7th -22nd june it was great just like it was last year all the staff was very helpful including akram he was ace do any thing for you ,we did the walk on the beach to side approx 40 mins some places were shingly ,we did the water park (aqua planet) it was good ,and the adventure park it was brilliant zip wires and climbing great but we booked in side town it was much cheaper than rep,our stay was great the food the pool the gardens great ,we went with my mother ,father in law ,my father in law is in a wheelchair but he got everywhere on his own as was very flat everywhere the staff could,nt do enough for him ,the only little downfull there is keeping your room on the day you leave as we got picked up 12 midnight they are wanting 80 euros to keep…

title: Awsome!!!!!!
review: Just come back from 10day stay in turquoise hotel had a wicked time!! Animation team are awsome bunch! Location, food and facilitys all good! Will be coming back asap!!!!

title: Gorgeous hotel.
review: Me and my boyfriend came to this hotel 10 may for two weeks as our first holiday together.  Its safe to say the hotel surroundings are beautiful!! the hotel is alot bigger than expected with well kept gardens. Hotel was SPOTLESS, i couldnt fault a thing reguards to the cleanlyness of this hotel. Location was abit out the way- no bars near by to strole to at night. 45 min walk along beach to Side WARNING beach is abit shingly!! But you can get a bus ride easily to Side on the number 10 bus, the bus stop is situated outside the hotel gates and across the road. Well worth taking a day trip to! We also had a day trip to Troy aqua park which was good, ask your holiday rep about this (we went with thomas cook)  There were a wide variety of pools; main pool, pool with slide, kiddies…

title: Great time had by all !!
review: Travelled as a party of a couple with a 6 year old and 2 single twenty somethings and we all thoroughly enjoyed our stayed.  Food was really really good there was a choice of a la carte restaurants but we never even used them as the main buffet  was really good.  Rooms were very tastefully decorated and were always cleaned well with mini bar stocked daily with water, pepsi and an orange drink.  We always sat around the waterpark pool and never found it a problem to get a sunlounger.  I thought I had already wrote this review but when I was looking through my contributions I realised I had not so Im afraid im not in as much detail as I normally would but if anyone has any questions please contact me.

title: the best!
review: I have just returned from the Turqoise hotel and i have to say it was one of the best holidays yet, i did not want to leave! My mother and sister felt the same and enjoyed every bit of the holiday just as much. Firstly we arrived to a champagne reception and were immediately impressed. Throughout the week all of the staff were hardworking, helpful and friendly making us feel very welcome and made our holiday enjoyable and unique. The animation team are certainly a credit to the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel for any age as there is a range of different activities including games, archery, darts, volleyball and many more as well as the nighttime entertainment varying and involving all ages. As well as this there were many opportunities to go outside of the hotel for…

title: With luck we'll be back
review: This must be one of the best hotels on this stretch of the Turkis coast.Everything about it is wonderful,from the initial greeting to the last farewell. The Turquoise is set in a wooded area of Sorgun near Side,yes it is a bit out of the way but in some way this enhances the hotel. Rooms are a good size and towels and bed linen are changed daily,in some rooms the air conditioning could be a little better. The main restaurant is well laid out but could be a little cramped in the event of rain but this doesn't detract from the comfort and the excellent waiters will have you seated in no time. The food is good quality and well cooked and there is plenty of it,enough choice to tempt anyone,even the fussiest eater. All bar areas are clean and well staffed although I wasn't too happy…

title: Wonderful holiday!
review: We stayed here last week in May, first week in June, thoroughly enjoyed it, the only hiccup was an initial problem with the air conditioning in our room (in the main hotel) which was only looked at 2nd time of asking , at one point we were told that the aircon only worked between 1-4pm so it was cool for when we came in from the pool/beach - slightly odd considering the power goes off in the room when you take the key card out of the slot!  However, it suddenly appeared to start to working a little better but certainly wasn't working as well as you'd expect considering it was getting hotter and hotter throughout our stay!   Also, just a quick note that if you ask for a Sea View, it appears that you're likely to be above where the main bar area/band stage is so is not likely to…

title: FANTASTIC HOLIDAY
review: This hotel really is fantastic. We were 4friends staying here and as soon as we arrived were given a glass of fizz each and  they offered us a free upgrade to one of the villas which were brilliant! we hadn't booked or requested a villa but if you get offered one definately take it! Theres a seperate pool just for villa guests which was nice and quiet. The staff are all so friendly and cant do enough for you! especially mesut and ozman at the sultan bar! They made us some very nice cocktails! The hotel is kept spotless all the time everywhere you go someone is cleaning! Its in a fab location, can walk into side along the beach or take the dolmus from outside the hotel. The beach is lovely and the slide pool is great fun. food is fantastic lots of choice for everyone! different…

title: Very Good Hotel
review: This was my second visit to this Hotel, what i like about it is the location which is just outside the town but close enough that you can walk there in about 45 minutes. It has a adult only pool which is very peaceful. The hotel kept to a very high standard, it is very clean and the gardens are nice. The food is excellent there is a large selection of dishes which should satisfy most tastes. There is also three a la carte restaurants that you can book for free once during your stay. The Fish and Chinese restaurants are good the other one is a Italian which in my op-ion is not up to the standard it should be.   The service in the bars is very good and the cocktails are very nice!!!  The evening entertainment is very poor only the Michael Jackson show is any good the rest is…

title: Definately going again...  Awesome Holiday
review: We booked this hotel "Blind" basically walked into a travel agents and told them we wanted to go to Turkey but wanted somewhere more mature and not 18-30.  So it was basically like throwing a dart at a map, anyway we threw the "Double Top" as far as we were concerned as it wasn't till we got home that we checked Trip Advisor.   Coming off the main road through the Hotel gates down the drive to the Entrance we were amazed at how clean and well kept the grounds were.   Checking in we were offered sparkling wine and the Kids (12 and 6 years old) were given non alcoholic cocktails.  The family room we had 2 rooms.  A twin room for the kids and a double for us, both rooms had a TV and Aircon the main room had the balcony. The main eating area is very well catered with plenty of staff…

title: Would definatley go back!!
review: Best holiday I've ever been on and myself and my boyfriend would definatley go back! Facilities are great on the second day we used the spa had a salt scub and massage, would highly recommend! Food was really good, different theme every evening and lots to choose from, desserts were amazing!! Drinks were really good too, cocktails were delicious. Most off the staff were really friendly (except one or two of the reception staff) and all worked so hard. It was my boyfriends birthday whilst we were there and at dinner they reserved and decorated a table for us. We also met some other lovely couples from England, although there are mostly German, Dutch and Russian guests, we also met some really nice Dutch people. All in all great value for money as we got a really good deal only…

title: Heaven
review: What can I say, I love this hotel I love the food the staff it is defo top marks from me n my family n we are  going back for the third time end of aug, so guys we will see you all again:)

title: Fantastic!
review: My husband have been to this hotel twice and we have not been dissapointed! Great food , great drink. Hotel is spotless, staff are friendly and like the english! We befriended a waitress and every eve she saved our table had our drinks ready and waiting for us and decorated our table with flowers! We spoke to a lot of the english people in the hotel and most of them are booking to go back again this year as we have too. Always a sun bed lovely beach for a walk each afternoon. Cant wait to go back!!

title: brilliant
review: went with our 2 year old granson and his mother and my son and girifriend who are 24 as there was a age gap between us this hotel has it all for every age group the entertainment team  was 24 strong and the evening shows were the best  i seen in any holiday hotel the service was ist class and friendly the food was of an high standard  so much to chose from my granson had his second bithday while we were there and they sent him a present to his room and laid on a special table and a birthday cake in the evening  the drink flowed all day and night with so much food on hand durring the day  there was an area for everyone and even an aldult only pool where u could relax with a book with out any noise  the grounds were kept clean and tidy the hotel sits in  a mini  forrrest of 98…

title: Lovely hotel, but beware of the non-existent air-con in the main hotel.............
review: We arrived at the hotel mid morning and were greeted with a glass of champagne. We then filled out all of the necessary forms and waited to be allocated our rooms. We were very pleased to find that the friends that we had travelled with were allocated a room just along the corridor from us and we were pleased with the sea view from our rooms (which had cost us £300 extra). First impressions were very good with the whole place being spotlessly clean and the rooms being a nice size with a mini fridge, hair dryer and safe. However on day three things came to a bit of head as the air conditioning had not worked in our rooms once since we had arrived. We were given various conflicting stories regarding this, from it was the 'wrong time of year for air-conditioning', it was…

title: Superb value and great location
review: Arriving very early in the morning with the two friends we were travelling with we were told that the sea view rooms we had booked were not available and would we mind moving into a 2 bedroom villa instead. Had we known about this option we would have happily booked it in adavance. The villas are set around private pools at the back of the hotel. There is a seperate restaurant and bar for villa occupants.  The short walk to the main hotel through the pine woods was a pleasant start to every day. Food from the buffet was always excelllent with plenty of options. Make a point of knowing your waiter and the service is impeccable. There are four other restaurant options that are well worth a visit. Children have their own area away from the main attractions and there is little…

title: One Word - AMAZING!
review: Everything and everyone at the hotel was above average! Although the hotel complex itself is gigantic it someone manages to remain completely personal. The Animation Team and Staff actually remember you even though there are over a thousand other people there...even down to them remembering your drinks order!!  Grounds, Pool, beach, restaurants, bars all perfect!  Quite simply, it is the best all inclusive hotel I have stayed at. I would recommend this to litterally everyone and anyone!

title: FAB
review: We have just returned from our second visit to this hotel, it is a truely wonderfull hotel the staff are very nice especially Ozzy at the beach bar,The food is some of the best I have ever had in any hotel i've stayed in we even had Roast beef and yorkshire pud!! the hotel is spotless the cleaners do a wonderfull job...there are always sunbeds available either around the pools or on the beach or piers..this Hotel is a really good all rounder its anly a 10 minuet walk into side along the beach or the bus stops outside the hotel and runs about every 5mins

title: Tremendous Value Holiday
review: This was our first visit to the Turquoise and we were not disappointed.  Although many reviews quite rightly say the majority of guests are German, we didn't find this an issue at all; the staff were very friendly and helpful to everyone and would whatever they could to make your stay enjoyable. The food was superb with a huge selection at all meal times and snacks in between, and I highly recommend you try the famous Turkish pancakes served in the Nomad tent between 12.00pm and 4.00pm, they're great!  there are also four A La Carte restaurants (Fish, Turkish, Italian and Chinese) where you are served a five course meal and you are entitled to one visit to each restaurant per stay - fantastic. It's a lovely, leisurely one hour walk along the beach into Side town (40 minutes at a…

title: what a lovely hotel!
review: My family which consisted of a party of 14 thoroughly enjoyed our holiday at the Turqoise. Our ages ranged from 14 to 74 and we all had a great time.  The food was great with plenty of choice and a constant supply of food throughout the day.  The rooms were of good size and had sufficient facilities and the maid service was excellent, ensuring clean and tidy rooms and all times.  We all loved the main pool and the fact that you had the choice of a quieter outside pool and an indoor pool.  The staff, apart from the odd miserable member. were all very cheerful and friendly. The only thing I would change if I went back again was to go earlier or later in the year as we went in July and it was far too hot.  The grounds of this hotel are absolutely beautiful, full of lovely flowers…

title: Most relaxed I've been in ages
review: What a brill holiday, just come back after a weeks stay with my husband, my 2 year old daughter, my 9 week old baby and my mum and dad, and it was heaven. Food was amazing and so healthy with so much choice ( i'm a fish eating vegeterian) pools were fab, beach was great, rooms were perfect and service was slic. We'd never been on an all inclusive before and what with 2 babies I wouldn't have it any other way, everything was so easy. We hope to go back next year, why go somewhere else when you know it doesn't get much better than this.

title: Great relaxing holiday
review: We (2 adults and 2 children aged 10 and 6) stayed at the Turquoise at the end of August /beginning of September 2010.  Lovely welcome with cocktails for the children and a glass of fizzy wine for the adults.  Check in swift and efficient.  The family room was very large,basically the size of two rooms, large double bed in one room and two singles in the childrens room.  The rooms were a tiny bit tired, but were well maintained and clean so it really isn't a complaint.  Pools were very nice, be careful on the waterslides though as some of the kids (and older kids!) come flying down without leaving a big enough gap from the person in front so we did have a incident that left my husband out of action for a few days!  Food was plentiful, varied and of a good standard, would advise…

title: Do not go to this hotel if…
review: I came to this hotel  as a single 30 years old belgian man and it was not a good idea. First of all, i do not understand why people says that it is a fantastic hotel. It seems that they didn’t compare with the surrounding hotels. Food is good but nothing special in comparison with other hotels. Beach is not good and it was dangerous to swim.This  cannot be considered as a beach. Some square meters of sand directly followed by a steep slope of stones. Because of the slope, the waves are big. In the sea, there are at some places big rocks that makes swimming dangerous. While I swam on the back, I struck a rock with my head. The name “turquoise” is a joke. The water has never been this colour. It was rather dirty with a lot of algae. Surprisingly, beaches from surrounding hotels…

title: Great AI - super service and fab for families!
review: Having previoulsy done S/C and AI in hotels in Spain, Kenya and the Canaries this was a pleasant surprise as it offers excellent AI service.    Rooma are comfortable with everything you could wish for - however the lakehouse villas are vastly superior in terms of accomadationa and an ideal location with own private pool and allocated sunbeds.   As stated in previous reviews the grounds are extensive and beautifully maintained by an army of gardeners.  The whole place is immaculate and the staff offer superb service in all aspects.  The Animacion team are so freindly and go out of thier way to entertain get everyone involved - and if you want to get away form it all you can choose to avoide the main swimming pool where all the action takes place.  The lovely Sasha is fab and the…

title: This sets a standard for true All inclusive
review: This was the second time we have stayed at am all inclusive hotel.  On arrival we were met with a nice cold glass of sparkling wine. Speedy check in and room allocated. The hotel sits in a pine forest the grounds are well maintained and the pools are clean and well placed around the grounds. The kids pool is great, and there is a quiet pool just for over 16yrs. Bars are well placed near to pools and have the best bar staff I've seen in a while from bottled water, cocktails to beers.... The animation team was fantastic putting on shows most nights from Michael Jackson " This is it" to  Mama Mia . Water polo , archery, water aerobics, step classes, and for the health and fitness buffs there's a free gym  next to the spa with two running machines two bikes, free weights etc and…

title: What a lovely place .....
review: On arrival we were greeted by a glass of champagne, juice for the children and a ballon and colouring book was presented to our youngest.  After check in we were shown to our room which overlooked the front of the hotel and out into the lovely gardens.  Our room was lovely and had it's own air con.   We were shown the villas but these weren't suitable for us  - but would be perfect for those of you wanting to be away from the main pool and if you don't mind a little walk to the facilities.   The food was lovely - we ate in the main restaurant which had so much choice each night they cooked food outside (felt so sorry for the chefs as they were melting).  There are a la carte restaurants and we managed to eat in 3 out of the 4.   The beach is small and stoney.  There are 4 pools…

title: FANTASTIC HOLIDAY
review: We have just got back after 14 nights at the Turquoise , what a fantastic hotel.  The staff were so friendly and could'nt do enough for you.  the animation team were brilliant and BiBi was fab with the kids. We tried out the Italian A La Carte restaurant and is was superb, you really felt that you were out having a nice meal in a restaurant and the service was 100% committed to make you feel special.  our 8 year old daughter loved it and met some little friends, we rarely saw her all day she only came back to get more sun lotion on.  It is a great safe place for kids.  There are 4 pools and and even an indoor pool which we used every day about 5pm to 6pm just to cool down after a day of sunbathing as the water is there was so cool and lovely to wind down in at the end of the…

title: Dont think about going here...JUST GO !!
review: Our first time in Turkey our first all inc...it was amazing....super rooms....pool villa...lovely quiet pool to sit by with our own sunbeds with our room number on them just by a cafe and bar which we ate breakfast at rather than the main buffet....food everywhere was excellent..fresh,lots of choice and well presented. All staff were polite and helpful even though they must have been tired out....they all semed to work all day every day and in the heat and humidity that cant be easy !! Our teens loved the teen "club" and games and been able to take part in 2 of the evening shows...there were hugs and tears when they had to say goodnye to their new friends...thanks goodness for facebook !! Everything was all inclusive even the mini bars in our rooms were filled with bottled water…

title: Fantastic value and great food
review: We stayed in the new part of the complex which was based up at the back near the main road.  It took 10 mins down to reception and the beach but we didn't hear any of the traffic due to double glazing.  We also had 2 rooms, with 2 televisions and had safety deposit box which was reasonable in price.  The walk down was very pleasant as you pass the turkish restaurant and bar which is free.  Wide selection of choice in food but the 4 A La Carte restaurants quite good except fish restaurant.  Please note there is a 24hour bar near reception which we did not find until the last day.  Although beach not the widest in sand the 2 pontoons provide an alternative to staying near the pool or on the beach.  Some games go on near the pool but not intrusive.  Childrens Club seemed to be…

title: Superb Hotel!!
review: Arived at the hotel to be met by cold glass of champagne... just what i neede after travelling with two teenagers, two young boys and an overworked husband. Shown to our two rooms, out in the blocks at the back of the hotel and they were superb.We had two family rooms which consist of two double rooms and a bathroom. Teenage girls loved having their own independance.The hotel is immaculate, from the gardens to the resteraunt to the toilets. Staff couldnt be more helpful (although found ice cream lady rather miserable)  The sun bed situation was rather tiresome....You have to be down poolside by 8.15am to get a pitch and sit there until 9.00 or your towels are removed. First day we got there at 8.50 and had to drag beds off the beach so we could watch the boys in the pool. Food…

title: Great Hotel
review: Having just come back fromt his hotel, all I can say is that I LOVED IT!  I did not want to leave at all and was asd whe I did after only staying there for 1 week  Everything about the hotel is great from the rooms, to the pools, to the entertainment, staff food, everything.  The entertainment team have activities daily to suit what everyone likes to do or if you like me a good game of Darts!  The food has something for everyone, with a wide choise, and each night the meain restraunt has a diffrent theme.  I can recomend you try the Turquoise Special Cocktail it is yumm!  The hotel also has pool towel where you can get fresh towels each day.  At night, the entertainment team have diffrent shows on I would highly recomend that you see the,, the team are great, do a very hard job…

title: Great location, great food, friendly staff.
review: What more can I say we stayed there for 2 weeks and had a brilliant time I always worry about the food when staying at an all in one hotel, no worries the food and choice was excellent.  The staff were helpful and friendly and willing to help.  We walked along the beach to the nearby town of Side several times which took about 40 minutes.  while there we booked a trip via a local travel agent to Cappadocia which was very interesting the only down side was the hotel we stayed if for the two nights compared the the excellent Turquoise is was a bit rough but we survived  with no ill effect except a hang over!!

title: Our return trip to this hotel.
review: Having just returned from the Turquoise Hotel for the 5th consecutive year we can fully recommend this hotel. The food is outstandingly excellent !  dont believe anyone who tells you otherwise,  if anyone tells you the food is poor & repetative there is something drastically wrong with them and they are the type of people who go along in life complaining for the sake of it. The choice is unbelievable, the only thing i have noticed this year is the choice of deserts seems to have dwindled, there was probably 40 different deserts to choose from in previous years and only around 20 this year, also at coffee and cake time 5pm - 6pm at the snack bar this as also dwindled with just half a dozen cakes  to choose from and its now self service, in previous years it was served to u. I…

title: Amazing!!
review: Travelled with my husband and out 3 year old daughter to this hotel. As it said in the title.... Amazing! Little touches remind me of being on a cruise ship, from the sparkly on arrival to the flower petals on the beds. Food is superb, rooms are a little small but perfectly acceptable and are very, very clean. Swimming pools lovely and the beach is nice & quiet. The grounds of the hotel are stunning and are very well kept. The staff are very nice and cant do enough for you. All in all, a fantastic hotel- we have booked to go back next year!

title: our return trip to the turquoise hotel was even better than the 1st!
review: just returned from our second holiday to the turquoise resort hotel and spa. a truely amazing holiday once again. we love this hotel that much, that we have indeed booked to go again in june of next year for our third time. a very big thank you to the general manager haluk tufekci for doing a fantastic job in running this wonderful hotel. from the moment we arrived every need was catered for. our party consisted of myself and my husband our 3 girls age 9, 7, and 2, my mother aged 56 and my best friend 31 and her daughter age 5. we all had a fantastic hoilday and could not fault this place. the staff here will bend over backwards to please you from the cleaners, waiters, bar staff ( a big shout out to ozzi in the lobby bar, who kept our drinks topped up all the time.)  and last…

title: Absolutely Fabulous holiday for all the family.
review: The Hotel itself was well maintained. All staff were extremelly pleasant and helpful. The food was excellent and with the choice of the 4 Al a Carte restrauants made the holiday. The pools and Aqua park were great for the kids there was no need to leave the actual hotel. There was plenty to do day and night. The annimations team worked extremely hard and produced many shows through out the fortnight. We were there during the World Cup and we were well looked after football was shown away from the main guests to cause minimal disturbance. The towel exchange was yet again great. In all honesty we could not fault this hotel and 2 weeks just was not enogh

title: Super, smashing, great!
review: Stayed here with the wife and 10yr old daughter, first 2 weeks of June.  We arrived at the hotel and were greeted with a glass of champers for us and non-alcoholic cocktail for our daughter, we had read about this but did not expect it as we arrived early hours in the morning.  We were then taken to our hotel room on a golf buggy which our daughter found very exciting.  The first thing we noticed about the hotel was the friendliness of the staff.  This was our second visit to Turkey, and one time! we went to the Titanic Hotel in Antalya and although this was a stunning hotel the staff were not friendly at all.  At the Hotel Turquoise you get to know loads of the staff''s first names and have a laugh with them.  Our room was nice, quite basic though but the aircon was fantastic. …

title: ABSOLUTELY SUPERB
review: We as a family (with two young children aged 1 & 4) travelled here the last week of May & first week of June, and I can honestly say that it's the best holiday I've ever had.  We travelled here with Thomas Cook (our first holiday with them, as we have always previously travelled with Thomson) but found this holiday to be hundreds cheaper with them. We arrived at reception to be greeted by smiling staff who immediately could not do enough for us. We were given a glass of champagne each & the children given a non-alcoholic cocktail, before being quickly checked in & shown to our room by the bellboys who were only too happy to lug our cases there for us. Our room was of a good size, well decorated & comfortable, with room controlled air-con (rather than centrally controlled air-con…

title: Fantastic hotel, couldn't wish for better
review: I have travelled to quite a few places around the world and I must say that is the best hotel I have stayed in so far. I travelled with friends that had stayed in the hotel the previous year and I wasn't dissapointed from their reviews. The staff could not do enough to help you and the hotel was clean, tidy and run very efficiently. The night life was fantastic for the children, something different in the amphie theatre everynight. A must say a big thank you to the kids club cheif Musty and also Bibi who kept our kids entertained all the time. The animation team work very hard in their productions and their shows were fantastic considering that english is their third language. I have already booked to return next year and im hoping that all the same staff will be there. If your…

title: First holiday together and definatly one to remember!
review: We arrived at the Hotel Turquoise at around 4.00am in the morning and were met by pleasent and chearful reception staff. Once we had filled in all of the documentation that was required from us, we were given a glass of Champagne each. The reception area is clean, tidy and very well air-conditioned.   Room: We were in room 1326 and were met by a plate of freshly made sandwhiches. The room had great views of the hotel, the gardens and the sea. The bathroom was of a good size and had everything that you need. The room was very stylish and was of a very high standard. The maid would clean the room every day and would replenish the mini-bar every day (contents: 2 Pepsi, 1 Fanta, 1 Sprite and 2 water). Although, some days this would be as early as 8.00am. The safe in the room, worked…

title: Great hotel
review: Arrived at the hotel at 2.30am. Were collected at the hotel entrance on a golf buggy and brought to reception as they didn't want the bus entering the grounds as it was so late and so as not to make noise. Were greeted at reception and were taken to our room were a plate of fresh sandwiches was available.  Room - nicely decorated and modern. Housekeeping was very good and room was cleaned every day. Air conditioning worked very well.  Food - despite being a fussy eater I always found something to eat as there was a good variety. We ate in 3 of the 4 a la carte restaurants. You need to book these between 9 and 9.15am the day before you want to go. The 3 we ate in Chinese, Turkish and Italian all have a set menu but you get a choice for your main course. Chinese and Turkish were…

title: Fantastic Hotel - couldn't fault it
review: Just stayed at this hotel for a week with my husband and 14 month old son. The staff were really helpful and very good with the children. the food was very good considering the size of the hotel and the amount of people they cater for. The room was cleaned everyday and although some people complained about the air conditioning going off from midnight to 7am ours never did and actually had to switch it off as it worked too well!! We only used the kids pool and the main pool near the beach but they were very clean and very refreshing after sitting in the heat all day. the animation team were very organised with water aerobics and water polo, archery, darts, volley ball and free test dives with the in house diving school and they never hassled you to join in if you said no.  the…

title: As GREAT as before
review: It was our second visit to Turkey and after long discussions we selected Turquoise once again. I had doubts because I remembered that good things usually get worse eventually. ..But.. The hotel was immensely good as 2 years before. We were met with glasses of cool wine and juice for my 11-years old daughter. We've got a splendid suite in a new building. Everything in the room was well thought-out and comfortable. We had everything we need and even more :) I think the family with smaller children would be happy to have a small kitchen with all tableware but we even didn't touch it, because of great variety of dishes in KervanSeray. Actually, breakfasts were rather monotonous for our Ukrainian taste, but I'm sure that for all European guests there were everything they'd like. I…

title: Good Hotel
review: Stayed at this hotel 2 weeks may 2010. Could not fault the hotel On arrival sparkling wine offered arrived late at night luggage taken to our room.2211.Sandwiches in room lovely touch. Fridge with water and soft drinks replenished on a daily basis. A couple of beers wouldn't have gone amiss. Large grounds and lots of sunbeds never could not find one. Towels not given out till 9am so solved problems on towels on sunbeds issue. Largely German and Russian people with a few English and other nationalities. Not a problem. Hotel staff excellent although English was not widely spoken mostly German. Food I felt for a premier hotel average although after saying that there was a wide choice available so always something to eat. Catered we felt for the Germans and Russians mostly. No…

title: turquoise hotel, a great holiday
review: the hotel is set  about about 2 miles from Side, in pine forest,quite a large complex, plenty space, food drink was fantastic, loads to eat and choose from, stalls out side main restaurant cook serving food at lunch and dinner, snacks from 12pm through to around 6pm, ice creams 12-1pm, 4 al la carte restaurants, Chinese, Turkish, Italian and fish, we didn't go to the fish but the others where great. few pools around the grounds, one main swimming pool, there's a kids pools with 3 slides, set of to the side of the hotel plenty sunbeds,  hotel kids club, things to do for the kids all day,  should put on by there entertainment team also competitions etc, during the day, all usual darts football, archery etc, padi diving school on site, which very good, hotel very clean tidy, staff…

title: Well worth the money
review: Got to the hotel around 1 in the morning and was greeted with champagne bell boy took cases to room and let us in where fresh sandwiches awaited us which were tasty,  Rooms were gorge and we had a flat screen tv and a mini bar which had coke water fanta and sprite refilled daily had a large double bed and a travel cot for our 2 year old Food was amazing and ive never seen deserts like it in my life and im well travelled something for everyone I especially liked the ice cream cones every 2nd evening great for the kids Drinks Wow wot a selection cocktails beer wine gin vodka brandy copied baileys and peach snapps all avail 24 hours we met some great people and they all rated this hotel too the hotel is value for money and you will not be disapointed say hello to the photo guy and…

title: Fantastic Hotel... Best Holiday in Years!
review: We travelled to the Turquoise on 21 May 2010 for 1 week.  After reading all the reviews, we had high expectations... and were NOT disappointed!  On arrival we were greeted with a glass of champagne (they even went to the bar and fetched our 12-year-old an alcohol-free cocktail) and a very friendly 'bellboy' who took our luggage and loaded us all onto a buggy to take us to our 'room' at the back of the complex.  In the room there were plates of fresh sandwiches waiting for us.  The room itself was more like a small apartment.  We had booked a family room and this compromised of a large entrance hall, 2 massive bedrooms, decent sized bathroom and outside patio area, all furnished and decorated to a high standard in neutral tones.  The complex was immense, but not too big to be…

title: very enjoyable
review: 1st visit to Turkey not the last. Hotel spacious & very clean. Staff were very friendly & helpful. Food in buffet was always hot & plentiful. Outside was where freshly cooked food was-very nice. The 4 a la cartes have to be booked a day in advance at customer information desk. They varied in quality- fish was lovely(grilled whole fish), turkish very good(bottle of wine on table), chinese ok but food warm not hot , italian disappointing. You can have the all inclusive drinks in these restaurants including wine. The hotel is in a very quiet position so if you want to eat/drink outside of the hotel you have to go to Side which is 10 minutes by bus or 40 minutes walking. There wasn't much choice of bikes to hire & although we were going to do this we decided against. Whilst we were…

title: Can be very good and very bad at the same time
review: This hotel could be excellent but it needs to iron out some problems first. The location is nice, the main hotel is on the beach with blocks of rooms set in a pine forest on the side of a hill. It is kept very clean with even the main public toilets kept to a high standard. The food is excellent quality with loads of variety of dishes. The hotel has a main restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating and also a open air snack bar and a smaller snack bar for children and unlike the earlier reviewer i liked the yogurt drink! One tip you can book a Italian, Chinese and a fish restaurant once during your stay but you must be at the desk by 9am i saw one German woman there at 8:15am. There are a few pools with one especially for children which has flumes and are great fun there is also…

title: A great week
review: There is very little to fault this hotel on so problems up front. If you value a good night's sleep make sure that you get a room in one of the villa blocks at the back of the site. Otherwise you are likely to be kept awake till 2am every night by thunderous disco music. Also when we were there the majority of the clientele was German with a leavening of Dutch. Many of the staff speak German but not English, and suck up to the German guests as they are seen to be bigger tippers, so Brits can feel a bit neglected, but that may not be true all year round. Other wise this is a very nice hotel, set in lovely grounds, big enough to be interesting but not so huge as to be daunting, like some of its neighbours. The facilities are all you could wish for, and the food is superb and…

title: Super place to relax and unwind
review: I was little bit nervous about booking a holiday in Turkey but, I must say that mostly all my fears were unfounded.  We arrived at the Turquoise Hotel at 10.30pm and were met by a glass of champagne for the adults and a cocktail for the children, check in was very quick and we were led to our room.  We booked a family room and we were not disapointed.  We had two interconnecting rooms, ours had the bathroom, tv and fridge etc and the children had a room with two single beds a table and kitchenette.(not that we needed it). Both rooms had balconies, we were very happy with the rooms.  Sandwiches arrived few moments later.  we decided to venture out and have a look around, there was a mini market in the hotel grounds selling all the usual stuff and the main dining room was serving…

title: Turkish Gem
review: I spent 2 weeks during September 2009 at the Hotel Turquoise. What a super hotel. Well placed to visit other locations by bus (dolmus) very cheap and frequent. drivers very helpful. Side is just 10mins away and worth a visit.  The Hotel itself is large but still maintains personal touches. Staff are friendly and polite. The beach is a little stoney so worth taking some jelly shoes. The pontoons off the beach are great for fishing (lifeguard always happy to take any reasonably sized catch home for tea!) The swimming and snorkelling are great, fish in abundance we were lucky enough to see a couple of Turtles from the pontoon. The evening entertainment by the animation team is average but you can not fault them for their energy and enthusiasm.  We visited this hotel on someones…

title: Excellent
review: Travel AI twice a year with 2 children this is the best so far for eveything.  The foood was excellent, the staff were so friendly and polite the place was immaculate, the beach and sea were lovely. Watersports fantastic. Kids went Paragliding. The restaurants that we ate in we fantastic (chinese being our favourite). You cannot reserve beds before 9am unless you are sat on them or your towels will be removed so that sorts the famous 5am germans out!!! If you stay in a family room as we did (a must if you have children they are out of this world) 2 beds 2 baths - they have their own pools and sunbeds with your room no's on!  If I had to pick one thing I did not like it was the lack of control on the water slides. Children were alowed to come down straight away after the one in…

title: AMAAAAAZING HOTEL!
review: My fiance and I have just returned from a two week holiday to the Turquoise. After reading the reviews we were looking forward to going to a top hotel...we were NOT disappointed. Upon arriving at the gotel, the bellboys took our bags for us (we were in the private blocks so got taken up in a buggy to our room), we were given a glas of champagne when checking in, once in our room there were fresh sandwiches waiting for us, this is standard for late night arrivals. Mini bar had 2 bottles of water and four bottles of soft drinks which was topped up every day without fail. Our room was amazing, very clean and spacious, set in the woodland area of the hotel...each block has its own pool too.  The food was out of this world. I'm a fussy eater but they cater for everyone, although…

title: What a Fantastic Hotel
review: Have just got back from a fantastic 2 week stay at this marvellous hotel.We were looking forward to going after reading all the reviews which we singing the praises of this hotel and we were not dissappointed. Arrived early morning, taken from the gatehouse on a buggy, quickly checked in (champagne offered) sandwiches in our room. Room was very spacious and like the rest of the hotel was kept scrupulously clean. Food was excellent even for a fussy eater like me. We even had fillet steak one night. There was something for every one and a choice of 3 A La Carte (we did'nt try these). Drinks were plentiful from the several bars dotted about, Ice cream from the kiddies club available every day. The kiddies club was one of the best I have ever seen with its huge pool area. Wespent…

title: Wish I was still at the Turquoise! Fantastic Hotel
review: Me and my girlfriend had a fantastic holiday in September at the Turquoise in Side/Sorgun. Everything about the hotel is perfect. From the friendly and helpful staff, to the beautiful gardens, the waterslides, the choice of food all day every day, the all inclusive drinks! We especially loved the Nomad tent (12 -4pm), where you could sit and relax eating some freshly cooked Gozleme (traditional Turkish food).  There was so much food to choice from each night and something for everyone. They even have a kids buffet by the kids club! We went to two of the a la carte restaurants while we were there, the Italian and the Chinese. Both were excellent quality, but we thought the Chinese was the better of the two. You can visit all four of the a la carte restaurants once free of charge…

title: Beautiful! Can't wait to go back!
review: My husband and I took our 8 year old grandaughter to the Turquoise for a week in May. I always do my homework to make sure we get value for money and we certainly did. The pictures of this hotel don't do it justice as the majority of the rooms are set in a pine forest. Some rooms have their own private chairs, patios and pool. The staff are so friendly and welcoming. Animation team were very good with some good shows in the amphitheatre. The main poolside area was large and spacious with lots of natural shade from the lovely Turkish sunshine. The food was tremendous! Most cooked outdoors at all meals. Plus the main patio bar area always had a nice buzz from 4pm onwards, with live bands on 3 nights of our week long stay. A bus stops at the top of the hotel drive for the 10 min…

title: our best holiday
review: We knew on arrival how good ! it was going to be when we were toasted with champagne, The staff were so helpful, no queuing at the bar waiter service if you prefered it. just give a little tip at the begginning of your holiday. Great investment. Such a relaxing holiday. Everything about this holiday is good. Clean, great food, top entertainment, brilliant for the kids. I have read reviews about to many germans and russians! get a grip there is a good mixture of people.If you want to holiday with english people go to blackpool.Would definately recommend this hotel.Email me with any questions

title: Hotel Turquoise was the best holiday we have had!
review: A fantastic 2 weeks!  Everything about the hotel from the food to locatioin to the rooms was fantastic! We travelled with our 2 young children (4 and 2) aswell as friends of ours and their 9 year old son. From the drinks on arrival and quick check in we got to our rooms to find sandwiches waiting, which was great after the journey. The hotel grounds are stunning and imacuatley kept. Everywhere is extreemly clean and people cant do enough for you! Great facilities and the kids club was fantastic! Brilliant holiday for people of all ages! Thinking of going next year! THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!

title: BEST ALL INCLUSIVE HOTEL / RESORT EVER !!!!!
review: Have just returned from a 2 week stay in this hotel and Turkey for the first time. We have done all inclusive type holidays for about 8 years now and as the title suggests this has to be the best. Everything that is written in the previous reviews is TRUE. Here's just a few points : 1  Food excellent from main buffet to 4 a la carte restaurants that you can use. 2  Pools fab including slides. 3  service best ever. Waiters and bar staff cannot do enough for you and so polite. 4  entertainment staff tops. Work so hard all day and night. 5  Accomodation great. We were in main hotel but brother in law was up graded to 2 bed appt. with own private pool, sunbeds etc.......very nice. !!! 6  beach and sea ace. bir rocky but 2 jetties stretch out where you can swim from with the turtles.…

title: Fabulous hotel- Great value **must read** GREAT STAFF
review: We travelled to the Turquoise resort and spa in Side from 4-18th August 2009 , We are in our early 30's with two girls aged 5 and 2.  We booked with and flew with Thomson who gave the best price after going back and to from the others, and it was part of their 'Beach Club' with gave extra benefits.  This was our third time to Turkey, first to Side, we liked Side best. The hotel is about an hour and 20mins transfer from Antalya airport.  Its set about a £5 taxi ride from Side Old town, where there are shops selling usual tourist things, fake clothing, souveniers and restaurants and bars.  Also there is the Apollo temple which is lovely to visit at sunset, and the amphitheatre and general Roman ruins.  Turquoise is set in the Sorgun pine forest, lovely setting. There is the main…

title: Second time in this wonderful hotel!
review: We visited the Turquiose Hotel back in August 2007, because we enjoyed it so much the first time we decided to go back a second time. This time we took some of our family with us, there was 5 adults and 3 children altogether aged under 11 yrs.  We were not dissapointed at all, the service is the first thing that hits you. All staff are very professional, always willing to assist, they work so hard and such long days.  The food is supberb and anyone who complains about the choice available must be very hard yo please.   The pool and slides entertain the children for hours, beach is OK very rocky, but of you walk just walk along the beach passing the parasailing blokes you come to a lovely stretch which is shallow and has no rocks at all, ideal for the little ones to paddle in. …

title: fantastic holiday what more can i say
review: went to the turquoise with my partner and our twelve year old son in july 2009 had an absoloutly fanastic time hotel was really nice set in beautiful gardens in a pine forest never seen a hotel and grounds so clean never saw any litter, we paid for a sea view room well worth it . The staff were really friendly and couldn't do enough for you a tip goes a long way worth giving a couple of lira for even better service the best barman was yalcin from the bar by the slides (mini club bar) he was brilliant always knew what we wanted and it seemed like he always had our drinks waiting for us when we went to the bar really friendly and funny. The animation team worked really hard we all really enjoyed the lion king show and we heard the mama mia show was also really good but we never…

title: Just like Center Parcs but in the sun!!!!
review: We stayed in this hotel for two weeks at the end of July. We had such a brilliant time. The hotel grounds are beautiful. We were in block C which was a good spot. Not to far from anything but a short walk through the gorgeous gardens. The food was varied, hot and very well presented. It was served in large covered containers which was good. The cakes and puddings were out of this world. My favourites were the coconut macaroons and the carrot cake! There are  4  a la carte restaurants which you can go in during your stay  (1st time in each free). We tried the Italian which was brilliant!  The service in all of the hotel was first class eventhough it was high season. You never had to wait long to be served at the bar and we never had to wait for dirty plates to be moved from the…

title: brilliant holiday
review: travelled with group with ages 64, 62. 42.41, 23, 13 ,9, 7 and 7 so large family from grandparents to children we all had a brilliant time . the spa was better than most 5* hotels visited.  food was good surroundings were beautiful in pine forest . the resort was spotless the staff bent over backwards to please.  the only minor gripe was the nearest cash point was in side or mangavat . the photographer and watersports could not be put on room tab and had to be paid cash. the animation team was good . the photographer took good pictures.    this resort is becoming more popular with the british and rightly so. the germans were rude but you get that every where you go.    the children cried when we left as they had such a good time.   we will go back next year as this was as near…

title: Fantastic hotel
review: Brilliant hotel one of the best I have stayed in. Everyone was helpful, rooms spotless, mini fridge in room filled with soft drinks daily, free towels, food was superb, fresh, and beautifully presented, brilliant location, loads of sunbeds and shade - great pools, one of the nicest hotels i have ever stayed in - and will return.

title: Best holiday for years, excellent!!!
review: Just returned from a week here with my husband and 2 daughters aged 12 & 14.  Our first time in Turkey and we booked this as a late deal with Thomsons.  We normally arrange our own holidays and were a little wary of going on a package holiday.  What can I say!! but what a fantastic holiday, hotel was first class, food, service, rooms, facilities & weather was amazing.  Restaurants were excellent and the choice and quality of food was outstanding.  All of the hotel was spotlessly clean and you could have eaten off the floor.  Very international flavour to the resort with, British, Dutch, French, Belgian,German & Russian visitors in equal numbers.  Not a lager lout in sight!!!  The animation (entertainment) team were brilliant and arranged loads of activities and shows from dawn…

title: Excellent Service and Food
review: Where do you start - glass of sparkling wine as you get into the hotel lobby, room decent size set in pine woodland, main building less than 100 yards to beach, 5 star food for all meals - snacks inbetween - 6 pools including one indoors - professional PADI dive centre - excellent daytime and evening entertainment - bars open from 10am fully inclusive drinks and no holding back on the service - most occasions as soon as our glasses were emptying there was another one ready within a couple of minutes - this hotel does not skimp on qulaity or service from the management down to the general staff - well kept gardens - excellent choice of hot and cold dishes at all meal times - varied foods - themed each evening - plus 4 a la carte restaurants which you can use at no extra charge…

title: everything we expected and more
review: absolutely great, myself & my partner were with 2 16 year olds and were worried that the room wasnt going to be big enough, we needn,t have worried, we were in a lakesdide suite which had 2 large adjoining rooms.  The food and drinks were excellent, the drinks service in the main dining room was however  very poor,  unlike the service at the bars, which wasnt a problem. Clearly they dont have enough staff on in the resturants in the evening.  We booked several trips in Side with a company called Ora tours, do yourself a favour and avoid them.  My partner booked a trip to go to Pummakale and was told he would be picked up at the main entrance at 5.45 a.m. they never turned up.  also we arranged to go to the water park with them, they took us to a gold factory first!  all in all…

title: Fanrastic all inclusicve!!
review: I went to the hotel at the end of july into the begining of august and it was absoloutley fantastic. the All inclusive was fantastic ans the staff where very funny, hard working and great with the kids. The shows the animation team put on evrey night where brilliant aswell. The weather was fantastic and so hot i was lovely.   i Would definatley come back if i had the chance it is definatley worth the money(wich was not that expensive!)  The swimming pools wjere also brilliant as where the restaruants and a la carte restaruants.  A GREAT HOTEL!!!!

title: 1st Time A/I in Turkey
review: It's been 7 years since I last visited Turkey  and I had always stayed either on a B/B or S/C basis. Since discovering the many advantages of taking an A/I holiday I decided to try this type of holiday in the Antalya region. After trawling through many different hotels I finally settled on the Turquoise and am so pleased that I did. I travelled with my eldest daughter and one of my grandaughters. Our flight with Thomsons was uneventful and in next to no time we arrived at the hotel. We were told by the Rep that because it was late (1am in the morning!!) that they couldn't drop us at reception but we would be transported there complete with our luggage in a buggy.  Like everyone else we were given a glass of champagne filled in the forms and went off to our allocated room. I was…

title: Fantastic Value for Money!
review: This hotel if a hidden gem. We have stayed at this hotel before -- in 2006 and it was good then but has improved since.The number of English guests is definately increasing although we still seemed out numbered by Germans and Russians. Most guests are very friendly although the language barrier with the Russians means that friendly banter with them is often not possible. The hotel is really all about relaxing in pleasent surrounding, eating great food and being waited on by attentive staff. If you are looking for the following then book this hotel. Great food.- Head Chef has apparently worked for VIP's in the Middle East. Buffet Restaurant is so good that you only book the Al La Carte Restaurants for change of routine rather than going in search of better food! Drinks are very…

title: Would definately recommend - read more!
review: If you are anything like me you try to read as much as you can about a place before committing to buy, well the reviews on trip advisor provided that for me so I thought I would return the favour! Here goes for a thourough and honst review: We booked using Hayes Travel for a week from 26th June - 4th July (flight with Thomson, transfers with A 2 B and accommodation you travel), we saved about £600 in total from the same holiday advertised with Thomson. The transfer was about 45 minute drive from the airport.and when we arrived at the hotel it was in the early hours of the morning and we were greated by staff at the hotel with a glass of cava, which was sweet. In the room sandwiches had been left for us. The room - our room was in the main building (villas/appartments behind the…

title: Lovely hotel, great holiday
review: I chose this hotel because it had so many good reviews and many of the other 4* seemed to have mixed ideas on food, etc.  I must say that I am glad that I did as it is a well established hotel set in beautiful mature gardens, so you can always find a spot in the shade if you need to.  I think the average temperature was 33 C.    Antalya airport is nearly an hour and half away, apparently because of the speed restrictions I think.  In England we would have done it half the time.  We were told one hour to Side when we left and that Alanya was going to be two hours.  I have never been to Turkey before, but I have been twice to Egypt and so only have that to compare for the Middle East.  Everything in the hotel is kept spotlessly clean and the staff are friendly, helpful and very…

title: Wonderful holiday
review: Large hotel with lots of amenities. So many staff so you never waited long to be served anywhere. Good selection of food, enough of a variety to suit most people. As it was very hot (and getting hotter by the day!) more parasols are needed. The sunbeds weren't a problem, there were a good number available, however people were vying for some shade. The staff are lovely but mainly speak German, and of course Turkish. There were people from Russia, Germany, France and England. Because they are getting more English people visiting, the staff do seem to be making attempts at speaking English. The rooms were well equipped but on the small side. Brilliant shower, always plenty of hot water. Lots of lights and mirrors. Fridge with various soft drinks daily. We took a travel kettle for a…

title: A great All Inclusive!
review: Me and my partner visited Turquoise resort in June and we loved it, a nice relaxing week away!  I would reccomend this hotel for most people, for adults there is an adult only pool which is small but it was never full when we were there, for kids a large pool and seperate pool with slides. Animation team worked so hard all day and all night, fair play to them! They put on a show each night and after you leave you are given a cocktail to take back to the bar, this was a nice touch.  All the food was good, ate in main restaurant most nights (only there for a week) but did try Chineese which was good and the Turkish which was OK but nothing special and service was slow, but hey your on holiday so relax! Each evening had a different theme, there was lots of choice and lots of fresh…

title: Best kept secret in Side!
review: What a great surprise, never expected the hotel to be as good as it was, were upgraded to a villa - very special, we had our own pool and restaurant for breakfast and lunch plus the main restaurant in the evening, have been to many top hotels in the world Burgh El Arab , Peninsular Hong Kong, Hayman Island Barrier Reef, believe me this up with the best of them, their website doesn't do them justice. Staff were all very friendly nothing was too much trouble, has to be seen to be believed, set in 120 acre pine forest, beautiful gardens, go and see for yourself.

title: The best All inclusive I have stayed in
review: We were two couples aged 40-44 and stayed between 28/5/09 and 12/6/09. This is by far the best All inclusive we have stayed at and I have visited Turkey 7 times and Side twice. From the glass of champagne on arrival at 2am to finding sandwiches in the room waiting for us, they really do think of everything. Even the cocktails are part of the all inclusive!  The food is fantastic with a huge variety (always hot) and each night you could watch your chicken, veal, pork, kebab etc being cooked in front. The food never ran out and was always fresh. there was a choice of between 30 and 40 desserts at each meal time. All beautifully presented and delicious. I am now putting my belt on with a boomerang!  The staff were magnificent, the location and beautiful gardens it is set in great …

title: Beautiful hotel , very friendly staff.
review: We stayed at Turqoise resort for our honeymoon ( although brought the kids too). We arrived at approx 2am and greeted with a glass of champagne.  As we had informed Thompsons that it was our honeymoon we had a bottle of champagne in our room, bowl of fresh fruit, cakes , sandwiches and dressing gowns!  The resort is massive ,always perfectly clean , food is fab and lots of it! The lunchtime selection is always the same though, still delicious. The staff  speak little English but are very friendly and the housekeeping staff are wonderful, had our rooms cleaned daily. There was a mini disco for half an hour during the evening followed by a live show of some kind. The entertainment staff work ALL DAY and are very talented. There is loads for kids to do, we had a fifteen month old…

title: The best holiday ever Wow.
review: Stayed at this hotel from the 24th may for 2 weeks there was 11 of us,6 adults 5 kids we all loved it  can`t wait to go back,Staff were great always making sure your glass was topped up and that you were having fun.There was loads to do from bathing by the pools to jet skiing or parasailing at the beach just outside the hotel,Beach is not the best ive been on a little stoney for my liking but don`t let that put you off.the only let down on this trip was the excursions we went on two and they were both disappointing no fault of the hotel as these were sold by MED holiday reps steer clear of them the guy that sold us ours was called( Alper ) Avoid him,We went on a pirate ship for the first trip they said it was mainly for the kids that they were going to dress them up in pirate…

title: Such a wonderful place!
review: Like the last reviewer we absolutely loved the Hotel Turquoise.  My  grown up daughter and I went for a week early May and arrived after two days of thunderstorms, so we were a bit concerned about the weather. We had in fact 7 days of perfectly clear blue skies and warm sunshine.  Best of all, no flies or mosquitos.  The rooms were large and clean and beds were comfy. We were actually given a family room so we basically had two rooms, hallway and a bathroom with individual a/c - brilliant!  We were in a block  about 100 yards from the main hotel and we loved the walk through the tropical gardens every day, the grounds are kept beautifully. The hotel was 75% full when we stayed and yet it never felt busy. I'm one who likes my own space and never ever felt it crowded. We didn't…

title: Great hotel for a relaxing sunshine holiday
review: This was a great hotel. It is about an hour from the airport and we paid for transfers which was about £25 return. The hotel has a nice setting, right on the beach. The hotel itself is very comfortable. The rooms large and spacious. They have a mini-bar and safe - though you pay a couple of euros a day for the safe. The rooms have air conditioning though it does not work all year and was not on when we went and it did make for slightly warm nights- though we had a large balcony door which we left open and this helped.  We were all inclusive and the food was an excellent standard - very tasty. It caters for all tastes - those wanting to try the local food and for those less adventurous who want to stick to pizza, burgers, pasta etc. The food was very fresh.  The beach and pools…

title: fantastic holiday
review: What a fantastic place, when we arrived, even at 2am in the morning we were offered a complimenatry glass of champagne while they soreted out our booking in. We were then taken to block c which was a short 20 yard walk to a very very spacious room with a spotless bathroom and a balcony overlooking the gardens. Breackfast was in the main restraunt and there was plenty of variety to chose from, the restraunt staff were the friendliest and accomodating that i have ever come across in over 25yrs of overseas travel. The Bar areas of the hotel are very very efficient no waiting at the bar and even waiter serviceduring the evening while enjoying the entertainment. lunch was either in the main restraunt or the snack bar (which has the best variety of snacks i have seen anywhere) Evening…

title: we cried on the way home!
review: oh my god wot a fab tym, 2weeks is not long enuf. animation team are fabulicious. but beware the lasses in the kids club dnt interact  wiv the kids at all. but steve is great wiv the kids. bware of jamie he luks young but goin bald, he realy freaks us out! blondes also beware, ther lyk flies 2 poop wen turks c them, i was pestered constant in side. hotel staff are really frendly n always hav tym for you and the kids. the shows are amateurish but are fabulous and the sketchshows r hilarious. the gay 1 is great in the shows but always has a sour face on him during day. just luv the animation team lads altogether. ther wernt many ppl ther my age (18) so ther great 2 hav a joke about wiv! a missed them so much am goin back in october!

title: Really good
review: Me and my husband stayed here for a week in Sep. The weather was fantastic  Food was ok BUT I am a fussy eater and I always found something to eat. We where lucky enough to be allocated one of the apartments at the top of the resort in the pine forest. If you pay extra for the apartments you will also be able to eat breakfast here wich is better than the main restaurant,  as not as many people queueing.The staff are all lovely. Because we where allocated this room without paying extra we would have to pay extra for breakfast ( the only complaint we had as we where not told this) I think it was about four or five Euros extra. We paid this for our last morning because it was so close to our apartment. These apartments all have little pools alongside with allocated sunbeds for each…

title: what more could anyone ask for?
review: the Turquoise,in our opinion, has to rate one of the best.We arrived late at night,but had sandwiches left in the room & drinks in the fridge(which were replenished daily) Everywhere was spotlessly clean and the staff very friendly & helpful. The setting is gorgeous, right in the forest, so it felt peaceful, but within easy reach of both Side & Manavgat by dolmus.(don't need to bother with taxis, about twice the price) Currency isn't a problem- eveything is priced in euros, but sterling and turkish lira seem to get best value.The swimming pools are amazing, again,very clean.The beach area has plenty of sunbeds, as do the 2 piers,which also have easy access into the sea.(it's pretty rocky, so getting into the sea from the piers is less painful on the feet!!)Food is fab, with…

title: fantastic
review: my wife and i have  just returned from the turquoise hotel ,this was the first time we have been to turkey, it wont be are last as we will be booking  up to go again in june.we loved it.The hotel was one of the cleanest and most friendly one i have ever been to .Yes there are lots of russians and germans,but they on the whole are good fun,we meet  about six other  nationalitys  including lots of english. Most of the people we spoke to have been to the turquoise hotel   4 or 5 times before .The food was good  and varied the main restraut has different themes each night (turkish ,african ,mexican etc)j ust remember that you cant wear beach shoes or swimwear at dinner or lunch in the main restarant (,you will be tuned away to change)but you can eat in the snack bar(serves almost…

title: wow will be going back next year
review: What can i say this hotel lived up to all my expectations rooms were on par with a 3 star but we only slept and washed in them.  From start to finish of the holiday it was fantastic everyone made us feel very welcome and the animation team were out of this world if your willing to join in and have a go at different sports and activities this is the hotel for you.  food was very good, my 8 year old son is a fussy eater but found no problems at all.  would go back tomorrow if i could..... Umit and Edip in animation team were excellent and got us to join in with pool games and archery and darts.  Shows at night were very entertaining and fun.  drinks are available 24 hours so you will never go thirsty,  dont think you will go wrong if you book this hotel...We met loads of english…

title: great hotel
review: Stayed here in August myself and 13 year old daughter. Lovely hotel pool very nice. Staff were exeptional especially the waiters. You only had to sit down and you were offered a drink. Staff in the dining room very helpfull. Food was excellent puddings ok but all were very sweet, but there was plenty of fresh fruit. Drinks were great slushes for the kids. Not much fresh fruit between meals but you could usually get something to eat so not a problem. We hardly spent a penny all week. There are a couple of pool tables that you have to pay for but you give them your card and you pay when you leave the hotel as they do not take cash. Beach not up to much parasailing,pedaloes and jet skis which were payable on beach but reasonable prices. Evening entertainment started with mini disco…

title: Go there-You will have a great holiday
review: We arrived at our hotel at about 1am as we had a 2 hour delay at Gatwick, we were greeted with a cocktail and checking in was a breeze. We were told that the Lobby bar was open 24 hours and included in the all inclusive, so if  we had wanted to we could have carried on drinking (there isn't a cut off time to get drinks as there is in some other hotels we have stayed in) In our rooms we found Club sandwiches had been left for us and the mini bar stocked with soft drinks. We have been to Turkey on two other occasions staying in the Lara Beach Hotel in Lara and the Atlanta hotel in Belek, both of these are newish hotels in comparison to the Turquoise which is 20 years old, therefore the hotel was a little 'shabby 'in places, but please do not let this put you off as it is…

title: An absolute must!!!!
review: Booked our hoilday through Thomson in the UK. We had booked 2 adjoining rooms to accomodate a family of 5 but upon arrival at the hotel we found out this was not available but they offered us an alternative. WOW...... We were moved free of charge to a Private Villa that they call a Lake Villa. 3 rooms, 2 bathrooms, Private sun loungers (no worries about not getting a lounger) and access to a Private Lake pool ... what a touch!!!!! The room was immaculate and very modern. If you can get one of these it is worth it. Daily maid service to a very high standard. Mini bar topped up daily with soft drinks but the Lake villas have access to their own bar with waiter service if you want to be lazy!! The food was varied and alot to choose from. If you are a fussy eater you might find it…

title: Lovely but lonely for the Brits!
review: Well, where do I start?  I booked this hotel VERY last minute (day before we flew) and had read the reviews on here before booking.  I'm glad that I did, as the place was stunning.  We flew out on 24th July for a week - me, husband and three children aged 14, 6 and 3.  The facilities at the hotel are amazing - with little luxuries like free toiletries and waiter service (without the need for constant tipping!) We arrived around 7.00pm and were greeted by friendly staff on reception and a porter to carry our luggage.  The rooms in the main part of the hotel were pleasant enough, with working air conditioning (which you will DEFINITELY need) and a full bathroom (godsend with little kids), a telephone which meant we could contact each other room to room - but beware the cost of…

title: ari ari
review: Enjoyed our stay ay the Turquoise, after a few teething problems on arrival, such as getting into our room and  getting the power and air conditioning to stay on. (Air conditioning won't work if patio door is open) We did nt find reception very helpful through out our stay, and even though it says ih the hotel information that you can leave your valuables at reception on check out day, they were unwilling for us to do this ,so we had to carry passports, money, jewellery etc around with us all day.  Room was clean, though the bed was the hardest and most uncomfortable I have ever slept in! The hotel itself was immaculate and all the staff were very hard working, friendly and polite. The food was very good with loads of choice, but all the desserts, though they looked fantastic,…

title: Single Mum and teenager had fab time at Turquoise
review: Stayed at the Turquoise in Side from 8 to 15 July 08.  I was travelling alone with my teenage son and it was the first time we had holidayed by ourselves but had no problems at all. We were allocated a room in Block C, room was spacious with a double and single bed, balcony and towels, toiletries etc in the room.  Check in was very quick and easy and i did purchase the safe which you pay for if you want extra which is available in the room. This was about 2 lira a day.  The first thing i must say is that i wasnt sure what currency to take but opted on mainly lira with a little Euros, TAKE LIRA!!!!  The rate of exchange is approx 40p = 1 Lira and 80p = 1 Euro but if you do go into Side Old Town to barter (you really should by dolumus which you catch outside hotel gate at 1.75…

title: Great Hotel, superb location and an all inclusive to be proud of.
review: Where can I start....this is a great hotel on the whole. My wife and I were located in one of the annexes and had a standard room which had a large double bed and a single bed. The room was fairly basic, which if you go by the 5 star rating will dissapoint...but hey you won't spend much time in it anyway.  The people are great...although some staff need to up their game. Although most of the staff were very professional and helpful, although a few came across as flippant...never to the extent that you felt insulted but just not professional enough.  Service at the bars was hit and mixed...if you got a barman who had a collar on his shirt he was someone who had earned them and would be able to make almost any drink you asked for. If you got one without his collars you'd sometime…

title: You won't be dissapointed!
review: The title says it all! Great food and plenty of it, great drink and great people. Not much around the hotel itself but then when it is this good, why would you want to move? We did take a walk into Side (takes about half an hour along the beach,) but wasn't that impressed. Food and drink in Side, on the whole, expensive and the shopping was far too expensive, with prices on average double that in Marmaris. If you don't enjoy this hotel you need your bumps felt!

title: Turquoise - paradise!
review: We have just returned from a fantastic week at the Turquoise! When we arrived with our friends, who had been before we were shown a standard (but very nice) room.  Our friend then spoke to a very helpful member of staff at the Reception and we were upgraded free of charge to a lake side villa.  This was two very spacious rooms both with en suite and private deck.  This was absolutely amazing.  It was situated at the back of the hotel and had its own long 'lake' pool.  My husband was happy as he is not keen on the busy pool side and had the most relaxing time.  We had access to a beautiful little restaurant and bar which was so peaceful compared to the larger bar near the main restaurant.   The food was excellent in the main restaurant with the Head of Food and Beverage checking…

title: fantastic slides!!!!!
review: We went to the hotel turquiose in May 2008 witha range of ages from 6 months to 67 years!!! 4 separate families,13 of us in total. The hotel was excellent, the bedrooms are either in the main building or in annexes. Someof our party where in the annexes and as they have small children one family decided it was too far to push the prams to the main areas but the other family with small children decided that this was a benifit as it was very quiet for the kids to get to sleep at night so they stayed put. Our family (2 adults and a 12 yr old) were allocated a room in the main hotel. The room was lovely it had carpet which we liked as it prevented sand etc getting in the bed!!! the bed was very comfortable(Quite firm) and our son had a proper bed unlike other places were he`s had a…

title: A Very Good Hotel Overall
review: I stayed at the Hotel Turquoise from May 10th to May 17th 2008. I was with my girlfriend, my Dad and his girlfriend. We booked through Thomson as a package deal, so this included the flights and transfers.  The Hotel Turqoise is roughly an hour away from Antalya Airport by coach. The journey is very flat and there are no steep drops or cliffs anywhere in sight (for the faint-hearted). On leaving the airport we went straight to the Thomson desk and were quickly directed to the right coach. The coach only stopped at three different hotels, of which we were the second, so that was a bonus.  Once we arrived at the hotel I made sure I kept my suitcase with me (despite a battle with one of the porters). I'd always advise people to do this, especially if you're arriving late on a night…

title: Lovely Hotel
review: This really is a great hotel, and the perfect setting for a lovely holiday.  The layout is brilliant, all the accomodation set amongst stunning, well-maintained gardens.
