The staff are friendly, hard working and almost all have a basic grip of English (and German, Dutch and Russian!).  There are about 6 swimming pools, so there's a real variety. Although some seem to have special sun loungers with numbers on reserved for specific rooms. I'm not sure if these are premium rooms, or family rooms or what - I certainly didn't have a choice about what kind of room i could book. Worth asking about before you book.  The water slides were great and often had more adults on them than kids!  As with what some other people have said, Brits are definately in the minority here. It certainly…

title: Hotel Turquoise: A disappointment!
review: I am just back from this hotel. We went for a week holiday with my husband.  On our arrival to this hotel, we got to the hotel after midnight. The hotel was so lifeless and dark!! No light was on in the lobby! I felt depressed thinking how I was going to stay in such a depressing place for a whole week!  the place I was going to stay for a week! The agent has offered us a standard room, but we were not told that a standard room locates in the little flats in the back of the main building!! Even thought the greenery in front of them was beautiful but we did not want all the way to the Mediterranean sea just to stay in a small woods in the back of a hotel. It was going to feel like staying in a park rather than seaside!!  After paying extra we were moved to a sea view room. Even…

title: Fanatstic Holiday
review: I spent sometime looking for a good hotel and based on reviews here and on holidaytruth.com I went of this hotel. I can honestly say this was the best hotel I have stayed in!!. We have always shyed away from all inclusive as I had assumed the food and drinks would be naff....I could not have been so wrong. The hotel was on 30% full so that meant, no queueing for food, drinks or sunbeds. What impressed us was how clean the hotel was and how friendly the staff were. The food was varied and very good quality. Drinks were local brands but all were fine with us. The children enjoyed cocktails and soft drinks, my wife loved the cakes. We were very lucky as the weather was superb but i really struggle to fault this hotel. Obviously I am not sure what it would be like in mid summer but…

title: Loved every minute
review: A beautiful place, a lovely hotel, great staff, very nice beach.  I loved every minute of this holiday and would go back like a shot.  The food was beautiful, the staff are so friendly and helpful and the place is spotless.  Unlike most all inclusive places, the staff are constantly working hard to keep the place clean and because of this, the guests really do respect the place.  Not many Brits at all, we met about 5-6 others there (which is prob a good thing) but we keep ourselves to ourselves and this did not bother us one bit. I cannot even think of one think that I could moan about here.  Quite simply, the best holiday we have ever had.

title: Info for the Turquoise
review: Just returned today 15th October from Alanya to Glasgow. The flight times with Thomas Cook airlines are pretty dire and returning from any Turkish airport at 02.30hrs after being out of your hotel room from 12.00hrs the previous day is not something I would recommend. Booked extra leg room seats with Thomas Cook airlines but be aware row 31 on the Boeing 757 aircraft has one seat in the emergency exit row sold at a premium of £50 for short haul obstructed by the emergency slide equipment. The hotel Turquoise was one of the better all inclusive hotels I have visited on my travels. The check in at reception was adequate but I did not find the staff very receptive to excelling in customer service, and more seemed to be if your face fitted and were a nationality other than British…

title: Delightful
review: Just returned from a weeks holiday at this resort and what a lovely time we had.  There were not many brits staying, the hotel mostly caters for germans, as the kiddy clubs were in german and the staff always addressed us firstly in german.  We tend to keep ourselves to ourselves so this did not bother us.  We had two children aged 2 and 7 and the pools with the slides and baby pools entertained them.  The hotel sits right on the beach and the it was clean and not overcrowded.  There is a pier which you can walk out on and feed the fish.  My only complaint is there was not enough going on in the evening but as we had a young family we did not stay up late in the evening.  All I can say is more brits should go to this hotel as it is really lovely, the staff are lovely and so…

title: Fantastic complex for all ages
review: Fantastic,fantastic, fantastic.We have been to Turkey four times now to all-inclusive hotels and so far had a great time but there has always been something not making it 100%, this hotel gets 100% for everything from food, drinks, staff, location, and entertainment.The rooms were cleaned everyday fresh sheets and towels, clean beach towels everyday, no silly wrist bands just a credit type card that was only used to swipe for your beach towels. The spirit drinks were very strong not watered down as in previous hotels weve stayed at, excellent friendly staff that couldnt do enough for you, always cleaning and clearing tables, the whole place was spotless, toilets also with disposable toilet seat covers. What made it for us and our daughter (aged 11 ) was the annimation team who…

title: Amazing value for money
review: We are a young couple and we chose the Turquoise for our first holiday together and it was the best holiday either of us have ever had!    When we were dropping other people off on the coach ride to the hotel, we were very concerned as they all seemed to be on ugly main roads but the Turquoise is secluded and with virtually no traffic noise except from departure and arrival coaches, but this did not disturb us. The grounds are beautiful, constantly upkept by the hard working groundsmen; the cleaners do an amazing job as do the waiters and bar staff. Tipping a member of the Bar Staff at the start of your hoilday is a good idea too as they will go out of there way to make you happy and serve you quickly.   However, as we are younger than many other guests (18 and 20) we seemed to…

title: Very accomadating
review: June 15-29 2007 London Uk Family Holiday  29,31,18months  Arrived back from the hotel today, The resort was great the hotel was very clean and well maintained.whilst staying in this hotel turkey had extreme weather for June temperature reaching 52oc very hot for a baby!!  We stayed in the main building for just over a week, but due to the air conditioning being turned off at 20.00hrs it played havoc with sleeping so we requested to be moved into the garden apartments which were not as good as the main building but had the bonus of air conditioning 24hrs and with a small baby this was more practical. Food was great and plentiful, need to try and get there at 7.30 or well after 8pm as 8pm it was like a cattle market pushing and shoving although i must stress this only started to…

title: Fantastic little gem !
review: Wow, this hotel is an absolute gem. I was tempted to keep it a secret from everyone else, but I enjoyed it so much I have to let you know.  We returned back to England a couple of days ago and are already planning our next trip back to the Hotel Turquoise.  The hotel and grounds are absolutely beautiful as has already been mentioned but the activities are also fantastic. We learned how to scuba dive on site. Everyone is entitled to one free lesson in the pool and then if you want to you can dive in the sea for about Euro 50 per person. I would really recommend this as the instructors are really friendly and helpful. I was a bit scared to begin with, but we didn’t see any sharks !  Its worth taking the dolmus into Side but this will only take you to the bus terminal in Side which…

title: Loved It!!!! Everything fantastic, would go back next year.
review: Just returned from a fantastic holiday, the hotel was very clean, and maintained to a high standard, nothing was too much trouble for you. We needed to move rooms as the air conditioning was only on 1-5pm and we were too hot and they moved us the same day to a room with full time air conditioning, very accomodating. I had a problem with my ear and the information desk arranged to medication to be sent to the hotel, couldnt believe it. And only at a normal prescription price!!  The pools being 3 of them were very clean and had many activities going on, never time to get board but if you want the piece and quiet you could go to the adult pool or settle in the gardens or on the beach, felt you were in a different hotel each day!! The food was fantastic, much to choose from and good…

title: already booking to go back in September
review: Got back on Monday from my first trip to an All Inclusive! Turquoise is amazing, fabulous location, beautiful scenery and very helpful staff... an ideal holiday for just about anyone, you can join in (or not!!!) with loads of different entertainment run by the animation team, or simply relax.  Having been in desperate need to get away from it all for a week, I was pleasently suprised to find our last minute deal could be so perfect... on arrival in the lobby we were presented with a cocktail style drink, then once escorted to our room (in a apartment/bungalow style building, not the main hotel) we found the hotel had supplied us with sandwiches due to our late night arrival. From then it was seven blissfull days relaxing on the jetty above the sea, wandering through the grounds…

title: Brilliant holiday great hotel
review: Just had two weeks 1-15 June at the Hotel Turquoise with the bonus of beautiful weather. 9 persons ages from 4yrs to wrong side of 60. Booked 4 rooms.  THE GOOD  Main 3 storey hotel set in fabulous well kept grounds, also lots of annexe apartments literally in a forest.  Plenty of sunbeds at no time did we have to rush to find one.  Beach towels everyday on production of your card.  All inclusive drinks were great, we had vodka drinkers with us  there were no complaints. Plenty of all incl cocktails  Food was of a very high standard, lots of fresh meats cooked in front of you. Plenty of variety which I didnt find repetitive.  Beautiful cakes pastries served during afternoon. Coffe, tea & bottles of water freely available all day.  Constant chefs milling around, absolutely…

title: Booked again for July '07
review: I have to agree with all that has been said previously about this hotel, it is gorgeous!  The gardens and setting are stunning and it is only about a 20 minute walk into Side along the beach.  We have our own apartment in Side and like to spend the last few nights of the holiday at an all inclusive hotel to relax and let someone else do the washing up!  On arrival we were shown to a rather tired room in one of the annexe buildings, but we were moved without any fuss when we complained.  Our room was comfortable and spacious with a balcony and table and chairs in a quiet area just beside the tennis courts.  The food was varied and plentiful with outside seating in the main restaurant, plenty fruit and pastries for breakfast and various pizzas and meats cooked outside at lunch and…

title: Superb value
review: Just wanted to pay a well earned compliment to the hotel management and staff at the Turquoise in Side. A very very good hotel which is made into a great hotel by the quality of the staff at every level. I would rate it a good four star with 5 star facilities..looks a little tired in places but absolutely nothing to complain about. Specifics:- Location : Could not be better. Half hour walk to Side centre and ruins along the beach - or dolmus every few minutes for 1 euro each - or taxi for 5/6 euros full car. Pine forest at the front and beach at the rear. safe bathing; Three pools;  Cleanliness - rooms etc: 10/10. Food: All buffet but truly excellent. Amazing considering the numbers and diffferent nationalities involved ( 800 - 1000 per meal time ! ) Always huge choices from 2…

title: Superb hotel
review: This hotel was one of the best I have ever stayed in!  Set in a pine forest with beautiful gardens that led to the beach. All the staff were nice and worked very hard. There were literally hundreds of sunbeds and a similar number of umbrellas. Tne  beds were all around 3 swimming pools, the gardens, the beach and also 2 huge piers which jutted out in to the sea.  There were numerous bars so you were never more than a few metres from a drink!  Food was neverending and very plentiful.  The animation team worked very hard and were very funny, and a couple of times a week there were live bands and other acts.  As an animal lover I hate seeing all the mangy hungry cats that usually hang around hotels, but here there were only about 10 very healthy ones who had all been neutered and…

title: Stunning Location
review: We are a Guernsey couple and this was our first visit to Turkey. The Hotel is set in a pine forest and the location is absolutely stunning. It is about 20 minute walk along the beach to Side. Beware though as the shop owners hassle you all day long. We pretended to be Russian and it worked  a treat as they do not know any Russian. Once they cotton on that you are English they will try almost anything to get you in the shop. The animation team at the Hotel are fab. There are activities all day long, water polo, volleyball, pool games, archery etc etc. In the evening they put on a show. Although it is not "West End" it is good entertainment and they try very hard. There are free towels which you can get with your card. You have a card, rather than a wrist band. The food is great,…

title: Great food - great for the kids
review: Excellent last minute break for myself, my daugher and 8 year old Grandson. Booked with Travel Republic, supurb arrangements from this company with a 12 seater minibus for just us there and back from the airport. On arrival, as the hotel was booked direct we did not have to wait for the perverbial 'welcome' meeting, we were met and greeted by an english speaking member of the guest relation staff and told all about the hotel. We were given a welcome cold drink and encouraged to ask what we wished to know. As a well traveled individual I must give this 5 stars as it meant we could get on with our holiday straight away. This hotel is very cosmopolitan with multi national guests and staff. Staff are very helpful and courteous. The food is very good with huge variety; however if you…

title: Lovely hotel, but beware if you're not German
review: Just got round to writing a report on this hotel, where my girlfriend & I stayed earlier on in May this year. We booked the holiday online via teletext, with a company called Travel City Direct, & what a useless company they were.  Firstly, we were told that transfer's were included (& we payed for them) which was not true...they just didn't turn up at the airport & we had to get a taxi to the hotel (about £50!). Hardly anyone speaks English, so trying to find our rep was near impossible. As it turned out, Travel City Direct do not have any of their own rep's at this resort, instead they rely on a local company who don't answer their phones or speak English when they do. The hotel was a nice surprise,though, & both the rooms & grounds were kept to a very high standard.…

title: EXCELLENT
review: My partner and I went to the Turquoise this May, to say we were impressed was an understatement, our room was lovely  the cleanest and tidiest hotel we have ever been to. The food standard was excellent nobody complained or had bad tummys, the food was high quality and varied we were spoilt for choice. The only draw back was the snacks on a night 11 till 12 it was soup and we did not bother.  The only problem we had was our room it was smelly due to a recent leak, we reported this and were moved imediatley to another room with our approval first and fresh fruit and cakes were sent to our room and an appology. We were very impressed. The pools were excellent and the adult pool had a resident tortoise that was very old and would come round the pool for a walk . The beach was…

title: Fantastic Hotel & Holiday!
review: Stayed here in June 2006. We are a 23 year old couple and had a fantastic time.  We managed to get a really good deal through Thomson and only paid £350 for a week (all-inclusive).   The hotel was really clean and had loads of different facilities. It is split into a hotel and a number of apartment buildings. We were in an apartment type block which was great.  We spent the majority of our time around the pool area which was absolutely massive! The hotel complex is a lot wider than we initially thought and there were various snack bars and restaurants towards the beach side of the complex. The 3 al-a-carte restaurants were also very good and we visited the Italian and Turkish ones.  The restaurants were very good and the food was pretty nice too, a bit samey towards the end but…

title: Good Holiday but food got a bit samey
review: Had a really enjoyable holiday.  Staff very friendly hotel was lovely but food options not very good.  After one week got a bit samey and some quite unusual options!!!  Would probably not go back as other reviews have said VERY GERMAN!!!!

title: Loved it
review: We stayed at Turquoise in May 2005. All excellent, friendly staff, very helpful and always smiling.  Excellent meals, however main restaurant a bit croweded at opening times.  Rooms could be a bit better, not that they were bad, but ... just a bit below 5* when it comes to bathrooms.  Lots of green and trees making it possible to walk or just rest in the shade with infants. Mini-zoo is an excellent idea. Children friendly, our daughters loved it. Getting sunbeds may be difficult if You don't get up early. Easy access to Side town by cab (around 5-7 EUR), or by local bus service (rather van service, as a matter of fact).  Limited knowledge of english though, mostly german, russian and french spoken.  Excellent animation staff, very nice people at the hotel scuba diving center.

title: We Loved This Hotel
review: We stayed at this wonderful hotel the last 2 weeks of August 2005. It was fabulous. Myself, sister and 2 children ages 4 and 10.  The staff were absolutely fabulous.They were very attentive and wonderful with the children, the level of service was 5*. The animation team were very professional,the shows in the evening were very entertaining & professional. During the day you could do as much or as little as you wanted and the animation team included everyone. The children loved the kids club and took part in some excellent shows. The children especially enjoyed the slide pool and spent hours here. The relaxation pool is a quiet child free haven, whilst the main pool has more going and is alot busier.  The private beach was very clean and the sea crystal clear, although a little…

title: A fantastic place
review: An absolutly amazing hotel, situated right next to the beach,water sports and activities and plently of sun loungers,I never had to reserve one. Food excellent, different themed nights so every meal is different, chefs cooking everything fresh while you watch,also three al a carte restaurants which you could visit so was a change from a buffet and very nice too. Staff very very friendly,cant do enough for you very efficient service,bringing drinks and cleaning up all the time. Entertainment on an evening was also excellent, differnet shows in the ampitheatre. Also very good bars,drinks avaliable til 2am all inclusive but 24 hour bar avaliable but i think after 2am you have to pay.  Cocktails galore!!!!  Rooms excellent,mini bar in room re stocked everyday which is included in…

title: Turquoise Hotel
review: We tavelled with Thomson Holidays from Manchester 060905 for one week stay. Arrived at the Turquoise hotel approx. 4.00am. On arrival the reception was good and a sandwich with drinks were waiting in the room.  The food at the hotel is excellent from breakfast to late bites at midnight. Staff are very friendly, although English is spoken it is very busy with Russian & German tourists. Plently of entertainments during the day & shows in the evening.  The rooms are suitable but a little dated, but have everything you need.Set in 35 acres of pine forests,the peace & tranquility is great. The beach & pools are fantastic.Plenty for children to do aswell.  Side is very close a dolmus (local bus) can be flagged down outside the main entrance to the hotel cost 3 turkish lire…

title: Superb Holiday
review: We spent the last week of August at this hotel and loved it.  Food superb, hotel superb (very clean and efficient).  We liked the fact that there were hardly any English and that it wasn't like being in Benidorm.  Germans did not bother us at all.  Yes you have to fight to get a sunbed but breakfast finished at 10 so you had to be up for that anyway!!  We loved it so much, we only left the complex once and plan to go back next year!!

title: You Will Not Be Disappointed
review: Booked a week there but wish had stayed longer. Food was excellent, staff very very friendly and facilities first class. Normal problems of towels on sunbeds early in the morning but only a slight hiccup. If someone has a sweet tooth then go there as the deserts were out of this world-easy to put weight on! Located in huge pine forest 2 miles from the town of side. Taxis to Side only 6 euros each way. Roman remains there well worth a visit. If you like drinking all day then that is not a problem as one bar is open 24 hrs. One good thing is at mealtimes you can order bottles of wine rather than glasses-of course all included. Weather was  hot -in the 40's each day. Spa is good with sauna small gym and steamroom free. All in all well worth trying out and we hope to go there again…
